original: tvāṃ hy agne sadam it samanyavo devāso devam aratiṃ nyerira iti kratvā nyerire
analyzed: tvām hi agne sadam id samanyavaḥ devāsaḥ devam aratim nyerire iti kratvā nyerire
translated: For, O Agni, the gods, of one mind, have ever sent thee forth, O god, as their messenger.

original: amartyaṃ yajata martyeṣv ā devam ādevaṃ janata pracetasaṃ viśvam ādevaṃ janata pracetasam
analyzed: amartyam yajata martyeṣu ā devam ā devam janata pracetasam viśvam ā devam janata pracetasam
translated: Worship the immortal one among mortals, the god among the gods, the wise one, the all-wise one.

original: sa bhrātaraṃ varuṇam agna ā vavṛtsva devāṃ achā sumatī yajñavanasaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ yajñavanasam
analyzed: sa bhrātaram varuṇam agne ā vavṛtsva devān achā sumatī yajña vanasam jyeṣṭham yajña vanasam
translated: Turn to us, O Agni, to thy brother Varuna, to the gods, to good will, to the chooser of the sacrifice, to the best chooser of the sacrifice.

original: ṛtāvānam ādityaṃ carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīdhṛtam
analyzed: ṛtāvānam ādityam carṣaṇī dhṛtam rājānam carṣaṇī dhṛtam
translated: To the truthful Aditya, the supporter of men, to the king, the supporter of men.

original: sakhe sakhāyam abhy ā vavṛtsvāśuṃ na cakraṃ rathyeva raṃhyāsmabhyaṃ dasma raṃhyā
analyzed: sakhe sakhāyam abhī ā vavṛtsva āśum na cakram rathyā iva raṃhyā asmabhyam dasma raṃhyā
translated: O friend, turn to thy friend, like a swift wheel to the chariot, like a swift runner to us, O wondrous one, to us.

original: agne mṛḷīkaṃ varuṇe sacā vido marutsu viśvabhānuṣu tokāya tuje śuśucāna śaṃ kṛdhy asmabhyaṃ dasma śaṃ kṛdhi
analyzed: agne mṛḷīkam varuṇe sacā vidaḥ marutsu viśva bhānuṣu tokāya tuje śuśucāna śam kṛdhi asmabhyam dasma śam kṛdhi
translated: O Agni, be gracious with Varuna, the knower, with the Maruts, the illuminators, for offspring, for impulse, shine brightly, be gracious to us, O wondrous one, be gracious.

original: tvaṃ no agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḷo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍaḥ vaḥ yāsisīṣṭhāḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, who knowest well, shalt best deliver us from the noose of Varuna, the god.

original: yajiṣṭho vahnitamaḥ śośucāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi pra mumugdhy asmat
analyzed: yajiṣṭhaḥ vahnitamaḥ śośucānaḥ viśvā dveṣāṃsi pra mumugdhi asmat
translated: Best worshipper, most purifying, shining, loose all enmities from us.

original: sa tvaṃ no agne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ agne vamaḥ bhava ūtī nediṣṭhaḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: So be thou, O Agni, our nearest, most helpful protector at the dawning of this dawn.

original: ava yakṣva no varuṇaṃ rarāṇo vīhi mṛḷīkaṃ suhavo na edhi
analyzed: ava yakṣva naḥ varuṇam rarāṇaḥ vīhi mṛḷīkam su havaḥ naḥ edhi
translated: Worship for us Varuna, granting us favour, come, be easy to invoke, be not hard to win.

original: asya śreṣṭhā subhagasya saṃdṛg devasya citratamā martyeṣu
analyzed: asya śreṣṭhā subhagasya saṃdṛś devasya citratamā martyeṣu
translated: This is the best, the most delightful sight of the god, most wonderful among mortals.

original: śuci ghṛtaṃ na taptam aghnyāyā spārhā devasya maṃhaneva dhenoḥ
analyzed: śuci ghṛtam na taptam aghnyāyāḥ spārhā devasya maṃhanā iva dhenoḥ
translated: Pure, like heated ghee, of the spotless one, desirable, like the milch cow of the god at his worship.

original: trir asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāny agneḥ🔽anante antaḥ parivīta āgāc chuciḥ śukro aryo rorucānaḥ
analyzed: tris asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāni agneḥ  anante antar parivītaḥ āgāt śuciḥ śukraḥ aryaḥ rorucānaḥ
translated: Three times are his highest, his true ones, desirable, the generations of the god Agni.🔽The endless one has come within the enclosed (altar), pure, bright, noble, shining.

original: sa dūto viśved abhi vaṣṭi sadmā hotā hiraṇyaratho raṃsujihvaḥ
analyzed: sa dūtaḥ viśvā id abhi vaṣṭi sadmā hotā hiraṇya rathaḥ raṃsu jihvaḥ
translated: He, the messenger, looks down upon all the seats, the priest, with a tongue that moves, with a golden chariot.

original: rohidaśvo vapuṣyo vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatīva saṃsat
analyzed: rohidaśvaḥ vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatī iva saṃsad
translated: With red horses, beautiful, shining, always friendly, like a gathering of many kinsmen.

original: sa cetayan manuṣo yajñabandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti
analyzed: sa cetayat manuṣaḥ yajña bandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti
translated: He, thinking, the friend of Manu in the sacrifice, they lead him with a great rope.

original: sa kṣety asya duryāsu sādhan devo martasya sadhanitvam āpa
analyzed: sa kṣeti asya duryāsu sādhan devaḥ martasya sa dhani tvam āpa
translated: He moves about in his houses, accomplishing (his work), the god, the mortal's wealth-possessor.

original: sa tū no agnir nayatu prajānann achā ratnaṃ devabhaktaṃ yad asya
analyzed: sa tu naḥ agniḥ nayatu prajānan achā ratnam deva bhaktam yat asya
translated: May that Agni lead us on, the wise one, to the treasure which he has, dear to the gods.

original: dhiyā yad viśve amṛtā akṛṇvan dyauṣ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan
analyzed: dhiyā yat viśve amṛtāḥ akṛṇvan dyauḥ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan
translated: What the All-gods, the immortals, have made by thought, the father Dyaus, the begetter, pouring out truth,

original: sa jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu maho budhne rajaso asya yonau
analyzed: sa jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu mahaḥ budhne rajasaḥ asya yonau
translated: He is born first among the houses, great in the depth of his own abode, in the realm of the sky.

original: b apād aśīrṣā guhamāno antāyoyuvāno vṛṣabhasya nīḷe
analyzed: a pāt a śīrṣā guhamānaḥ anta ayoyuvānaḥ vṛṣabhasya nīḍe
translated: Footless, headless, hidden, the ends, the young bull in the womb of the strong one.

original: pra śardha ārta prathamaṃ vipanyam ṛtasya yonā vṛṣabhasya nīḷe
analyzed: pra śardhaḥ ārta prathamam vipanyam ṛtasya yonā vṛṣabhasya nīḍe
translated: The impetuous one first extended the expanse in the womb of the strong one, in the realm of truth.

original: spārho yuvā vapuṣyo vibhāvā sapta priyāso 'janayanta vṛṣṇe
analyzed: spārhaḥ yuvā vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā sapta priyāsaḥ janayanta vṛṣṇe
translated: The young bull, the one to be desired, the most beautiful, the shining one, they, the seven dear ones, have generated the strong one.

original: asmākam atra pitaro manuṣyā abhi pra sedur ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
analyzed: asmākam atra pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ abhi pra seduḥ ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: Here our fathers, the men, have come to the sacrifice, longing for the truth.

original: aśmavrajāḥ sudughā vavre antar ud usrā ājann uṣaso huvānāḥ🔽te marmṛjata dadṛvāṃso adriṃ tad eṣām anye abhito vi vocan
analyzed: aśma vrajāḥ sudughāḥ vavre antar ud usrāḥ ājan uṣasaḥ huvānāḥ  te marmṛjata dadṛvāṃsaḥ adrim tat eṣām anye abhitas vi vocan
translated: The stone-enclosed ones, the well-milking ones, are in the enclosure, the dawns, the invoked ones, have arisen.🔽They have polished the stone, the seers, and others have proclaimed it on all sides.

original: paśvayantrāso abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiś cakṛpanta dhībhiḥ
analyzed: paśu ayantrāsaḥ abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiḥ cakṛpanta dhībhiḥ
translated: The singers, seeking cattle, have praised the deed, they have found the light, have looked with their thoughts.

original: te gavyatā manasā dṛdhram ubdhaṃ gā yemānam pari ṣantam adrim
analyzed: te gavyatā manasā dṛdhram ubdham gāḥ yemānam pari santam adrim
translated: They, with a mind full of cattle, have loosened the firm-set, the moving stone, which is surrounded.

original: dṛḷhaṃ naro vacasā daivyena vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ
analyzed: dṛḍham naraḥ vacasā daivyena vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ
translated: The wise men have opened with their divine speech the cow-pen full of cows.

original: te manvata prathamaṃ nāma dhenos triḥ sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan
analyzed: te manvata prathamam nāma dhenoḥ tris sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan
translated: They have measured the first name of the cow, they have found the three and seven highest of the mother.

original: taj jānatīr abhy anūṣata vrā āvir bhuvad aruṇīr yaśasā goḥ
analyzed: tat jānatīḥ abhī anūṣata vrāḥ āvis bhuvat aruṇīḥ yaśasā goḥ
translated: They have sung in praise of her, the knowers, the hosts, the ruddy one has appeared with the glory of the cow.

original: neśat tamo dudhitaṃ rocata dyaur ud devyā uṣaso bhānur arta
analyzed: neśat tamaḥ dudhitam rocata dyauḥ ud devyāḥ uṣasaḥ bhānuḥ arta
translated: The darkness has not prevailed, the sky shines, the light of the divine dawn has risen.

original: ā sūryo bṛhatas tiṣṭhad ajrām ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan
analyzed: ā sūryaḥ bṛhataḥ tiṣṭhat ajrām ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan
translated: The sun has risen, looking upon the lofty, the unbent, and the crooked among mortals.

original: ād it paścā bubudhānā vy akhyann ād id ratnaṃ dhārayanta dyubhaktam
analyzed: āt id paścā bubudhānāḥ vi akhyan āt id ratnam dhārayanta dyu bhaktam
translated: They have awakened, looking around from the rear, they have brought the treasure, the light-enjoyer.

original: viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devā mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu
analyzed: viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devāḥ mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu
translated: All the gods in all the houses, O Mitra, O Varuṇa, let truth prevail in the thought.

original: achā voceya śuśucānam agniṃ hotāraṃ viśvabharasaṃ yajiṣṭham
analyzed: achā voceya śuśucānam agnim hotāram viśva bharasam yajiṣṭham
translated: I will call upon the shining Agni, the priest, the best worshipper of all,

original: śucy ūdho atṛṇan na gavām andho na pūtam pariṣiktam aṃśoḥ
analyzed: śuci ūdhaḥ atṛṇat na gavām andhaḥ na pūtam pariṣiktam aṃśoḥ
translated: The pure-uddered one has milked the cow's eye, the purified one has sprinkled the portion.

original: viśveṣām aditir yajñiyānāṃ viśveṣām atithir mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: viśveṣām aditiḥ yajñiyānām viśveṣām atithiḥ mānuṣāṇām
translated: The all-embracing one of all the worshipful ones, the guest of all human beings,

original: agnir devānām ava āvṛṇānaḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu jātavedāḥ
analyzed: agniḥ devānām avaḥ āvṛṇānaḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu jātavedāḥ
translated: May Agni, the enveloper of the gods, be very gracious, the all-knower.

original: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā devo deveṣv aratir nidhāyi
analyzed: yaḥ martyeṣu amṛtaḥ ṛtāvā devaḥ deveṣu aratiḥ nidhāyi
translated: The immortal one among mortals, the truthful one, the god among the gods, the guest, the established one,

original: hotā yajiṣṭho mahnā śucadhyai havyair agnir manuṣa īrayadhyai
analyzed: hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ mahnā śucadhyai havyaiḥ agniḥ manuṣaḥ īrayadhyai
translated: The best priest, the most worthy of worship, to be praised with greatness, Agni is to be invoked by men with offerings.

original: iha tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adya jāto jātāṃ ubhayāṃ antar agne
analyzed: iha tvam sūno sahasaḥ naḥ adya jātaḥ jātām ubhayān antar agne
translated: Here, O son of strength, O Agni, born today, thou goest between the two born peoples

original: dūta īyase yuyujāna ṛṣva ṛjumuṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrāṃś ca
analyzed: dūtaḥ īyase yuyujānaḥ ṛṣvaḥ ṛju muṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrān ca
translated: As a messenger, O lofty one, yoking the pure and strong ones with straight horns

original: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā
analyzed: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā
translated: The two red ones, swift to grow, anointed with ghee, I think in my mind, O most swift one of truth

original: antar īyase aruṣā yujāno yuṣmāṃś ca devān viśa ā ca martān
analyzed: antar īyase aruṣā yujānaḥ yuṣmān ca devān viśaḥ ā ca martān
translated: Thou goest within, yoking the red ones, to you gods and to the people of mortals

original: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū maruto aśvinota🔽svaśvo agne surathaḥ surādhā ed u vaha suhaviṣe janāya
analyzed: aryamaṇam varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū marutaḥ aśvinā uta  su aśvaḥ agne su rathaḥ su rādhāḥ ā id u vaha su haviṣe janāya
translated: Aryaman, Varuna, Mitra, Indra-Vishnu, the Maruts, and the two Ashvins🔽O Agni, with good horses, good chariot, good gifts, do thou carry to the people who offer good oblations

original: gomāṃ agne 'vimāṃ aśvī yajño nṛvatsakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ
analyzed: gomān agne vimān aśvī yajñaḥ nṛvat sakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ
translated: O Agni, may the sacrifice be rich in cattle, sheep, and horses, a friend like men, ever unassailable

original: iḷāvāṃ eṣo asura prajāvān dīrgho rayiḥ pṛthubudhnaḥ sabhāvān
analyzed: iḷāvān eṣaḥ asura prajāvān dīrghaḥ rayiḥ pṛthu budhnaḥ sabhāvān
translated: This wealth, O Asura, is full of food and offspring, long, with broad base, naturally so

original: yas ta idhmaṃ jabharat siṣvidāno mūrdhānaṃ vā tatapate tvāyā
analyzed: yaḥ te idhmam jabharat siṣvidānaḥ mūrdhānam vā tatapate tvāyā
translated: He who, rejoicing, has brought thee fuel, or has heated the head for thee

original: bhuvas tasya svatavāṃḥ pāyur agne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyata uruṣya
analyzed: bhuvaḥ tasya svatavān pāyuḥ agne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyataḥ uruṣya
translated: O Agni, thou art his own protector, his guardian from all evil; protect him

original: yas te bharād anniyate cid annaṃ niśiṣan mandram atithim udīrat
analyzed: yaḥ te bharāt anniyate cit annam niśiṣat mandram atithim udīrat
translated: If from thy store thou hast sent forth as a guest the slow one who desires food, even when not appointed

original: ā devayur inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayir dhruvo astu dāsvān
analyzed: ā devayuḥ inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayiḥ dhruvaḥ astu dāsvān
translated: He who in the abode of the pious kindles thee, in him be wealth stable and bountiful.

original: yas tvā doṣā ya uṣasi praśaṃsāt priyaṃ vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān
analyzed: yaḥ tvā doṣā yaḥ uṣasi praśaṃsāt priyam vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān
translated: He who praises thee in the evening or at dawn, or who with oblation makes thee dear,

original: aśvo na sve dama ā hemyāvān tam aṃhasaḥ pīparo dāśvāṃsam
analyzed: aśvaḥ na sve dame ā hemyāvān tam aṃhasaḥ pīparaḥ dāśvāṃsam
translated: Like a horse in his own stall, to be fed, him from distress do thou deliver, O bountiful one.

original: yas tubhyam agne amṛtāya dāśad duvas tve kṛṇavate yatasruk
analyzed: yaḥ tubhyam agne amṛtāya dāśat duvaḥ tve kṛṇavate yata sruc
translated: He who offers to thee, O immortal Agni, who performs his service, who holds up his kindling-stick,

original: na sa rāyā śaśamāno vi yoṣan nainam aṃhaḥ pari varad aghāyoḥ
analyzed: na sa rāyā śaśamānaḥ vi yoṣat na enam aṃhaḥ pari varat aghāyoḥ
translated: He shall not be separated from wealth by striving, nor shall misfortune come to him from the wicked.

original: yasya tvam agne adhvaraṃ jujoṣo devo martasya sudhitaṃ rarāṇaḥ
analyzed: yasya tvam agne adhvaram jujoṣaḥ devaḥ martasya sudhitam rarāṇaḥ
translated: Whom thou, O Agni, acceptest for the immortal, the god, the mortal who offers good service,

original: prīted asad dhotrā sā yaviṣṭhāsāma yasya vidhato vṛdhāsaḥ
analyzed: prītā id asat hotrā sā yaviṣṭhā āsāma yasya vidhataḥ vṛdhāsaḥ
translated: May he be dear to the Hotar, to the youngest, to him whose praises are increased by the arranger.

original: cittim acittiṃ cinavad vi vidvān pṛṣṭheva vītā vṛjinā ca martān
analyzed: cittim acittim cinavat vi vidvān pṛṣṭhā iva vītā vṛjinā ca martān
translated: The wise one shall arrange the thought and the thoughtless one, as the back the woven and the unwrought mortals.

original: rāye ca naḥ svapatyāya deva ditiṃ ca rāsvāditim uruṣya
analyzed: rāye ca naḥ su apatyāya deva ditim ca rāsvā aditim uruṣya
translated: And for our wealth and good rule, O god, grant us room and protection, and be gracious.

original: kaviṃ śaśāsuḥ kavayo 'dabdhā nidhārayanto duryāsv āyoḥ
analyzed: kavim śaśāsuḥ kavayaḥ dabdhāḥ nidhārayantaḥ duryāsu āyoḥ
translated: The wise, the infallible, have directed the sage, the supporters, in the dwellings of the living one.

original: atas tvaṃ dṛśyāṃ agna etān paḍbhiḥ paśyer adbhutāṃ arya evaiḥ
analyzed: atas tvam dṛśyām agne etān paḍbhiḥ paśyeḥ adbhutām aryaḥ evaiḥ
translated: From here, O Agni, with thy five eyes, look upon these wondrous, noble ones.

original: tvam agne vāghate supraṇītiḥ sutasomāya vidhate yaviṣṭha
analyzed: tvam agne vāghate su praṇītiḥ suta somāya vidhate yaviṣṭha
translated: You, O Agni, are the well-guided one to the sacrificer, to the one who offers Soma, to the one who has prepared the oblation, O youngest one.

original: ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇiprāḥ
analyzed: ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: Bring the treasure, the wide and bright one, to the one who strives, to the one who is eager, to the one who leads the people, for help.

original: adhā ha yad vayam agne tvāyā paḍbhir hastebhiś cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ
analyzed: adhā ha yat vayam agne tvāyā paḍbhiḥ hastebhiḥ cakṛma tanūbhiḥ
translated: Now when we, O Agni, have made you with our limbs, with our hands, with our bodies,

original: rathaṃ na kranto apasā bhurijor ṛtaṃ yemuḥ sudhya āśuṣāṇāḥ
analyzed: ratham na krantaḥ apasā bhurijoḥ ṛtam yemuḥ sudhyaḥ āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: Like a chariot, with our swift services, we have striven for truth, eager for wealth.

original: adhā mātur uṣasaḥ sapta viprā jāyemahi prathamā vedhaso nṝn
analyzed: adhā mātuḥ uṣasaḥ sapta viprāḥ jāyemahi prathamāḥ vedhasaḥ nṝn
translated: Now may we be born as seven sages from the mother dawn, as the first creators of men.

original: divas putrā aṅgiraso bhavemādriṃ rujema dhaninaṃ śucantaḥ
analyzed: divaḥ putrāḥ aṅgirasaḥ bhavema adrim rujema dhaninam śucantaḥ
translated: May we be the sons of heaven, the Angirases, shining, we would burst open the wealthy mountain.

original: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso agna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
analyzed: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāsaḥ agne ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: Now as our fathers of old, O Agni, eager for truth,

original: śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran
analyzed: śucī id ayan dīdhitim uktha śāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindantaḥ aruṇīḥ apa vran
translated: Have purified the light, the rule of the hymns, bursting the brown clouds, have spread the earth.

original: sukarmāṇaḥ suruco devayanto 'yo na devā janimā dhamantaḥ
analyzed: su karmāṇaḥ su rucaḥ devayantaḥ yaḥ na devāḥ janimā dhamantaḥ
translated: The well-working, the very radiant ones, the god-adoring ones, the gods, blowing on the birth of iron,

original: śucanto agniṃ vavṛdhanta indram ūrvaṃ gavyam pariṣadanto agman
analyzed: śucantaḥ agnim vavṛdhantaḥ indram ūrvam gavyam pariṣadantaḥ agman
translated: Shining, have increased Agni, have increased Indra, have come to the pasture full of cattle, have surrounded it.

original: ā yūtheva kṣumati paśvo akhyad devānāṃ yaj janimānty ugra
analyzed: ā yūthā iva kṣumati paśvaḥ akhyat devānām yat janimānti ugra
translated: He has proclaimed it, like a herd in a wide place, the birth of the gods, which is terrible.

original: martānāṃ cid urvaśīr akṛpran vṛdhe cid arya uparasyāyoḥ
analyzed: martānām cit urvaśīḥ akṛpran vṛdhe cit aryaḥ uparasya āyoḥ
translated: They have made the wide paths of mortal men difficult to traverse, even for the noble one who is to be helped.

original: akarma te svapaso abhūma ṛtam avasrann uṣaso vibhātīḥ
analyzed: akarma te su apasaḥ abhūma ṛtam avasran uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: We have become inactive, O self-moving one; the dawns have passed away, shining with truth.

original: anūnam agnim purudhā suścandraṃ devasya marmṛjataś cāru cakṣuḥ
analyzed: anūnam agnim purudhā su ścandram devasya marmṛjataḥ cāru cakṣuḥ
translated: The unimpaired, very beautiful Agni, the god's delightful eye, is being made pure in many ways.

original: etā te agna ucathāni vedho 'vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva
analyzed: etā te agne ucathāni vedhaḥ vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva
translated: These hymns, O Agni, O wise one, we have recited to the sage; accept them.

original: uc chocasva kṛṇuhi vasyaso no maho rāyaḥ puruvāra pra yandhi
analyzed: ud śocasva kṛṇuhi vasyasaḥ naḥ mahaḥ rāyaḥ puru vāra pra yandhi
translated: Shine forth, make our possessions increase; send us great wealth, O bountiful one.

original: ā vo rājānam adhvarasya rudraṃ hotāraṃ satyayajaṃ rodasyoḥ🔽agnim purā tanayitnor acittād dhiraṇyarūpam avase kṛṇudhvam
analyzed: ā vaḥ rājānam adhvarasya rudram hotāram satya yajam rodasyoḥ  agnim purā tanayitnoḥ acittāt hiraṇya rūpam avase kṛṇudhvam
translated: Make Agni, the king of the sacrifice, the priest of the two worlds, the one who offers true sacrifices, Rudra.🔽Make him, Agni, the golden-hued, for protection, before the thunderbolt, before the thoughtless one.

original: ayaṃ yoniś cakṛmā yaṃ vayaṃ te jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ
analyzed: ayam yoniḥ cakṛma yam vayam te jāyā iva patye uśatī su vāsāḥ
translated: This Agni, whom we have made a womb, like a loving wife, with beautiful garments,

original: arvācīnaḥ parivīto ni ṣīdemā u te svapāka pratīcīḥ
analyzed: arvācīnaḥ parivītaḥ ni sīda imāḥ u te svapāka pratīcīḥ
translated: Sit down, surrounded, facing west, these your own-cooked oblations.

original: āśṛṇvate adṛpitāya manma nṛcakṣase sumṛḷīkāya vedhaḥ
analyzed: āśṛṇvate a dṛpitāya manma nṛ cakṣase su mṛḷīkāya vedhaḥ
translated: To the attentive one, the unshaken one, to the one with eyes for men, to the very gracious one, O wise one,

original: devāya śastim amṛtāya śaṃsa grāveva sotā madhuṣud yam īḷe
analyzed: devāya śastim amṛtāya śaṃsa grāvā iva sotā madhuṣut yam īḍe
translated: To the god, the immortal one, I sing a praise, like a presser who presses for the one whose juice is sweet.

original: tvaṃ cin naḥ śamyā agne asyā ṛtasya bodhy ṛtacit svādhīḥ
analyzed: tvam cit naḥ śamyāḥ agne asyāḥ ṛtasya bodhi ṛta cit svādhīḥ
translated: You, O Agni, be for us the guardian of this truth, O truth-knowing one, O self-dependent one.

original: kadā ta ukthā sadhamādyāni kadā bhavanti sakhyā gṛhe te
analyzed: kadā te ukthā sadhamādyāni kadā bhavanti sakhyā gṛhe te
translated: When are those praises, the best of feasts? When do they come to be in your house as friends?

original: kathā ha tad varuṇāya tvam agne kathā dive garhase kan na āgaḥ
analyzed: kathā ha tat varuṇāya tvam agne kathā dive garhase kad naḥ āgaḥ
translated: How is that to be told to Varuṇa, O Agni? How do you blame the sky? What is the offence?

original: kathā mitrāya mīḷhuṣe pṛthivyai bravaḥ kad aryamṇe kad bhagāya
analyzed: kathā mitrāya mīḍhuṣe pṛthivyai bravaḥ kad aryamṇe kad bhagāya
translated: How do you speak to the bountiful Mitra, to the earth? To Aryaman? To Bhaga?

original: kad dhiṣṇyāsu vṛdhasāno agne kad vātāya pratavase śubhaṃye
analyzed: kad dhiṣṇyāsu vṛdhasānaḥ agne kad vātāya pratavase śubhaṃye
translated: How to the kindly ones, O Agni? How to the wind, the impetuous, the auspicious?

original: parijmane nāsatyāya kṣe bravaḥ kad agne rudrāya nṛghne
analyzed: parijmane nāsatyāya kṣe bravaḥ kad agne rudrāya nṛ ghne
translated: How to the far-going, to the Nāsatyas, to the guest? How to Rudra, the slayer of men, O Agni?

original: kathā mahe puṣṭimbharāya pūṣṇe kad rudrāya sumakhāya havirde
analyzed: kathā mahe puṣṭimbharāya pūṣṇe kad rudrāya su makhāya haviḥ de
translated: How to the great Pūṣan, the bearer of increase? How to Rudra, the giver of good sacrifice?

original: kad viṣṇava urugāyāya reto bravaḥ kad agne śarave bṛhatyai
analyzed: kad viṣṇave urugāyāya retaḥ bravaḥ kad agne śarave bṛhatyai
translated: How to Viṣṇu, the far-goer, do you speak the seed? How to the loud, the great, O Agni?

original: kathā śardhāya marutām ṛtāya kathā sūre bṛhate pṛchyamānaḥ
analyzed: kathā śardhāya marutām ṛtāya kathā sūre bṛhate pṛchyamānaḥ
translated: How to the Maruts' host, to the true one? How to the great sun, when asked?

original: prati bravo 'ditaye turāya sādhā divo jātavedaś cikitvān
analyzed: prati bravaḥ ditaye turāya sādhā divaḥ jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: I reply to Aditi, the strong one. Be thou, O all-knower of heaven, the healer.

original: ṛtena ṛtaṃ niyatam īḷa ā gor āmā sacā madhumat pakvam agne
analyzed: ṛtena ṛtam niyatam īḍe ā goḥ āmā sacā madhumat pakvam agne
translated: By truth the truth is fixed. Come to the raw and cooked, O Agni, with the honey-sweet.

original: kṛṣṇā satī ruśatā dhāsinaiṣā jāmaryeṇa payasā pīpāya
analyzed: kṛṣṇā satī ruśatā dhāsinā eṣā jāmaryeṇa payasā pīpāya
translated: Though black, she has been nourished by the ruddy one, by the immortal milk.

original: ṛtena hi ṣmā vṛṣabhaś cid aktaḥ pumāṃ agniḥ payasā pṛṣṭhyna
analyzed: ṛtena hi sma vṛṣabhaḥ cit aktaḥ pumān agniḥ payasā pṛṣṭhyna
translated: For by the law the bull, the male, is anointed, Agni with milk for the back-bone.

original: aspandamāno acarad vayodhā vṛṣā śukraṃ duduhe pṛśnir ūdhaḥ
analyzed: a spandamānaḥ acarat vayodhāḥ vṛṣā śukram duduhe pṛśniḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: The bird-like one, unmoving, went along, the bull, Pṛśni, milked the bright milk from the udder.

original: ṛtenādriṃ vy asan bhidantaḥ sam aṅgiraso navanta gobhiḥ
analyzed: ṛtena adrim vi asan bhidantaḥ sam aṅgirasaḥ navanta gobhiḥ
translated: With the law they cleft the mountain asunder, the Aṅgirases rejoiced with the cows.

original: śunaṃ naraḥ pari ṣadann uṣāsam āviḥ svar abhavaj jāte agnau
analyzed: śunam naraḥ pari ṣadan uṣāsam āvis svar abhavat jāte agnau
translated: The men have sat down well at the dawn, the light became manifest when Agni was born.

original: ṛtena devīr amṛtā amṛktā arṇobhir āpo madhumadbhir agne
analyzed: ṛtena devīḥ amṛtāḥ amṛktāḥ arṇobhiḥ āpaḥ madhumadbhiḥ agne
translated: By the law the immortal goddesses, the uninjured ones, the waters, O Agni, with the sweet floods.

original: vājī na sargeṣu prastubhānaḥ pra sadam it sravitave dadhanyuḥ
analyzed: vājī na sargeṣu prastubhānaḥ pra sadam id sravitave dadhanyuḥ
translated: The strong one, to be praised in the beginnings, should always be rich in food for the flowing.

original: mā kasya yakṣaṃ sadam id dhuro gā mā veśasya praminato māpeḥ
analyzed: mā kasya yakṣam sadam id dhuraḥ gāḥ mā veśasya praminataḥ mā āpeḥ
translated: Do not always bear the burden of anyone's worship, do not be the guest of one who measures out.

original: mā bhrātur agne anṛjor ṛṇaṃ ver mā sakhyur dakṣaṃ ripor bhujema
analyzed: mā bhrātuḥ agne anṛjoḥ ṛṇam veḥ mā sakhyuḥ dakṣam ripoḥ bhujema
translated: O Agni, do not let us owe a debt to an unrighteous brother, nor to a friend, let us not suffer the loss of a powerful one.

original: rakṣā ṇo agne tava rakṣaṇebhī rārakṣāṇaḥ sumakha prīṇānaḥ
analyzed: rakṣa naḥ agne tava rakṣaṇebhiḥ rārakṣāṇaḥ su makha prīṇānaḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni, with your protections, being protected, O you of good rites, being gratified.

original: prati ṣphura vi ruja vīḍv aṃho jahi rakṣo mahi cid vāvṛdhānam
analyzed: prati sphura vi ruja vīḍu aṃhaḥ jahi rakṣaḥ mahi cit vāvṛdhānam
translated: Flash forth, break, crush the foe, slay the Rākṣasa even if grown great.

original: ebhir bhava sumanā agne arkair imān spṛśa manmabhiḥ śūra vājān
analyzed: ebhiḥ bhava sumanāḥ agne arkaiḥ imān spṛśa manmabhiḥ śūra vājān
translated: Be pleased with these hymns, O Agni, touch these treasures with your thoughts, O hero.

original: uta brahmāṇy aṅgiro juṣasva saṃ te śastir devavātā jareta
analyzed: uta brahmāṇi aṅgiraḥ juṣasva sam te śastiḥ deva vātā jareta
translated: And accept the prayers, O Angiras, O Agni, let thy praise-song, O God-attended one, be kindled.

original: etā viśvā viduṣe tubhyaṃ vedho nīthāny agne niṇyā vacāṃsi
analyzed: etā viśvā viduṣe tubhyam vedhaḥ nīthāni agne niṇyā vacāṃsi
translated: All these hymns, O wise one, these songs of praise, O Agni, have I offered to thee, O thou who knowest.

original: nivacanā kavaye kāvyāny aśaṃsiṣam matibhir vipra ukthaiḥ
analyzed: nivacanā kavaye kāvyāni aśaṃsiṣam matibhiḥ vipraḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: With my thoughts, O sage, with my hymns have I praised the hymns worthy of the sage, O thou who art to be praised.

original: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavāṃ ibhena
analyzed: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitim na pṛthvīm yāhi rājā iva amavān ibhena
translated: Make thy path wide and firm, go on thy way like a king with thy steed.

original: tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ
analyzed: tṛṣvīm anu prasitim drūṇānaḥ stāsi vidhya rakṣasaḥ tapiṣṭhaiḥ
translated: Stretching thy long rope along the earth, O thou who art to be worshipped, pierce the Raksases with thy sharpest (darts).

original: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ
analyzed: tava bhramāsaḥ āśuyā patanti anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ
translated: Thy flames fall with swift speed; touch with thy tongue, O thou who art to be worshipped, and shine.

original: tapūṃṣy agne juhvā pataṃgān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvag ulkāḥ
analyzed: tapūṃṣi agne juhvā pataṃgān a saṃditaḥ vi sṛja viṣvak ulkāḥ
translated: O Agni, with thy tongue, O thou who art to be worshipped, let loose the flying sparks, scatter thy embers on all sides.

original: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ
analyzed: prati spaśaḥ vi sṛja tūrṇitamaḥ bhava pāyuḥ viśaḥ asyāḥ adabdhaḥ
translated: Scatter thy spies, O thou who art to be worshipped, be the unfailing guardian of this people.

original: yo no dūre aghaśaṃso yo anty agne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dūre agha śaṃsaḥ yaḥ anti agne mākir te vyathiḥ ā dadharṣīt
translated: O Agni, let not thy terrible wrath reach him who injures us from afar, or who (injures us) nigh at hand.

original: ud agne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrāṃ oṣatāt tigmahete
analyzed: ud agne tiṣṭha prati ā tanuṣva ni amitrān oṣatāt tigma hete
translated: Rise up, O Agni, stretch forth thy tongue, burn away the enemies, O thou of sharp arrows.

original: yo no arātiṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ arātim samidhāna cakre nīcā tam dhakṣi atasam na śuṣkam
translated: Whomsoever, O thou who art to be worshipped, he hath made our foe, burn him down, O thou who art to be worshipped, as a dry (stick) is burnt down.

original: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny agne
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ bhava prati vidhya adhi asmat āviḥ kṛṇuṣva daivyāni agne
translated: Rise up, pierce through for us, drive away our foes, O Agni, reveal the heavenly powers.

original: ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn
analyzed: ava sthirā tanuhi jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn
translated: Destroy the firm foundations of the Yātudhānas, crush the kinsman and the stranger, crush the foes.

original: sa te jānāti sumatiṃ yaviṣṭha ya īvate brahmaṇe gātum airat
analyzed: sa te jānāti sumatim yaviṣṭha yaḥ īvate brahmaṇe gātum airat
translated: He, O most youthful one, knows thy favour who hath brought to the worshipper the way.

original: viśvāny asmai sudināni rāyo dyumnāny aryo vi duro abhi dyaut
analyzed: viśvāni asmai su dināni rāyaḥ dyumnāni aryaḥ vi duraḥ abhi dyaut
translated: To him all fair days, all riches, all glories, all doors of light, O holy one, be revealed.

original: sed agne astu subhagaḥ sudānur yas tvā nityena haviṣā ya ukthaiḥ🔽piprīṣati sva āyuṣi duroṇe viśved asmai sudinā sāsad iṣṭiḥ
analyzed: sa id agne astu subhagaḥ sudānuḥ yaḥ tvā nityena haviṣā yaḥ ukthaiḥ  piprīṣati sve āyuṣi duroṇe viśvā id asmai su dinā sā asat iṣṭiḥ
translated: Let him be prosperous, O Agni, bountiful, who delights thee with his ever-present oblation and his hymns.🔽In his own abode, in his own life, may all his desires be fulfilled.

original: arcāmi te sumatiṃ ghoṣy arvāk saṃ te vāvātā jaratām iyaṃ gīḥ
analyzed: arcāmi te sumatim ghoṣi arvāk sam te vāvātā jaratām iyam gīḥ
translated: I praise thy favour, I proclaim it, may this hymn of ours be acceptable to thee.

original: svaśvās tvā surathā marjayemāsme kṣatrāṇi dhārayer anu dyūn
analyzed: su aśvāḥ tvā su rathāḥ marjayema asme kṣatrāṇi dhārayeḥ anu dyūn
translated: With good horses and good chariots may we serve thee, mayst thou uphold our kingdoms through the days.

original: iha tvā bhūry ā cared upa tman doṣāvastar dīdivāṃsam anu dyūn
analyzed: iha tvā bhūri ā caret upa tman doṣā vastar dīdivāṃsam anu dyūn
translated: Here may he come to thee in many ways, O thou who layest the dust, shining through the days.

original: krīḷantas tvā sumanasaḥ sapemābhi dyumnā tasthivāṃso janānām
analyzed: krīḍantaḥ tvā sumanasaḥ sapema abhi dyumnā tasthivāṃsaḥ janānām
translated: Delighting in thee, with a glad heart may we serve thee, with our glories set among the people.

original: yas tvā svaśvaḥ suhiraṇyo agna upayāti vasumatā rathena
analyzed: yaḥ tvā su aśvaḥ su hiraṇyaḥ agne upayāti vasumatā rathena
translated: He who comes to thee, O Agni, with good horses and good gold, with a chariot rich in goods,

original: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yas ta ātithyam ānuṣag jujoṣat
analyzed: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yaḥ te ātithyam ānuṣak jujoṣat
translated: You are the protector and friend of him who gladly accepts you as a guest.

original: maho rujāmi bandhutā vacobhis tan mā pitur gotamād anv iyāya
analyzed: mahaḥ rujāmi bandhu tā vacobhiḥ tat mā pituḥ gotamāt anu iyāya
translated: I proclaim with words the kinship of the great one; that has come down to me from my father Gotama.

original: tvaṃ no asya vacasaś cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha sukrato damūnāḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ asya vacasaḥ cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha su krato damūnāḥ
translated: You must attend to this speech of ours, O Hotar, O youngest, most wise, most friendly one.

original: asvapnajas taraṇayaḥ suśevā atandrāso 'vṛkā aśramiṣṭhāḥ🔽te pāyavaḥ sadhryañco niṣadyāgne tava naḥ pāntv amūra
analyzed: a svapnajaḥ taraṇayaḥ su śevāḥ atandrāsaḥ vṛkāḥ aśramiṣṭhāḥ  te pāyavaḥ sadhryañcaḥ niṣadya agne tava naḥ pāntu amūra
translated: The swift ones, the very gracious ones, who are never asleep, who are never careless, who are never violent, who are never exhausted,🔽Those who are your companions, O Agni, who sit together with you, may they, O guileless one, protect us.

original: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te agne paśyanto andhaṃ duritād arakṣan
analyzed: ye pāyavaḥ māmateyam te agne paśyantaḥ andham duritāt arakṣan
translated: Those who are your companions, O Agni, who watch over Māmateya, have guarded him from misfortune.

original: rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ
analyzed: rarakṣa tān su kṛtaḥ viśva vedāḥ dipsantaḥ id ripavaḥ na aha debhuḥ
translated: The doer of good deeds, the all-knowing one, has protected them; the enemies have not obtained them, like the gods.

original: tvayā vayaṃ sadhanyas tvotās tava praṇīty aśyāma vājān
analyzed: tvayā vayam sadhanyaḥ tvotāḥ tava praṇītī aśyāma vājān
translated: Through you, O Agni, we may be prosperous, may we obtain strength through your leadership.

original: ubhā śaṃsā sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhy ahrayāṇa
analyzed: ubhā śaṃsā sūdaya satyatāte nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhi ahrayāṇa
translated: Make both sides agree, O you whose promise is true, make them agree with a loud noise.

original: ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stomaṃ śasyamānaṃ gṛbhāya🔽dahāśaso rakṣasaḥ pāhy asmān druho nido mitramaho avadyāt
analyzed: ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stomam śasyamānam gṛbhāya  daha aśasaḥ rakṣasaḥ pāhi asmān druhaḥ nidaḥ mitra mahas avadyāt
translated: O Agni, we will serve you with this fuel; accept the praise that is being sung to you.🔽Burn up the Raksases, O you who burn up; protect us from the treacherous, from the noose, O you who are the friend of Mitra, from blame.

original: vaiśvānarāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśemāgnaye bṛhad bhāḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya mīḍhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśema agnaye bṛhat bhās
translated: In unison, to the rain-bringing Vaiśvānara Agni, to what light shall we offer?

original: anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathenopa stabhāyad upamin na rodhaḥ
analyzed: anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathena upa stabhāyat upamin na rodhaḥ
translated: With a full and great utterance, O Upastamba, support the obstruction, O Upama.

original: mā nindata ya imām mahyaṃ rātiṃ devo dadau martyāya svadhāvān
analyzed: mā nindata yaḥ imām mahyam rātim devaḥ dadau martyāya svadhāvān
translated: Do not blame the god who has given me this gift, the self-existent one, to the mortal.

original: pākāya gṛtso amṛto vicetā vaiśvānaro nṛtamo yahvo agniḥ
analyzed: pākāya gṛtsaḥ amṛtaḥ vicetāḥ vaiśvānaraḥ nṛtamaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: For cooking, the strong, immortal, discerning Vaiśvānara Agni, the best of men, the young one.

original: sāma dvibarhā mahi tigmabhṛṣṭiḥ sahasraretā vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān🔽padaṃ na gor apagūḷhaṃ vividvān agnir mahyam pred u vocan manīṣām
analyzed: sāma dvibarhāḥ mahi tigma bhṛṣṭiḥ sahasra retāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān  padam na goḥ apagūḍham vividvān agniḥ mahyam pra id u vocat manīṣām
translated: The Sāman, with twofold strength, the sharp-edged one, with a thousand seed-sheaths, the strong bull,🔽The foot of the cow, well-hidden, well-known, Agni has told me this thought.

original: pra tāṃ agnir babhasat tigmajambhas tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ surādhāḥ
analyzed: pra tām agniḥ babhasat tigma jambhaḥ tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ su rādhāḥ
translated: May Agni, with his sharp-jawed, most burning flame, consume that which the bountiful one has offered.

original: pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetato dhruvāṇi
analyzed: pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetataḥ dhruvāṇi
translated: Those who transgress the law of Varuṇa, the dear, firm thoughts of Mitra,

original: abhrātaro na yoṣaṇo vyantaḥ patiripo na janayo durevāḥ
analyzed: a bhrātaraḥ na yoṣaṇaḥ vyantaḥ pati ripaḥ na janayaḥ durevāḥ
translated: The brothers are not related to the sisters, the husbands are not related to the wives, the kinsmen are not related to the people.

original: pāpāsaḥ santo anṛtā asatyā idam padam ajanatā gabhīram
analyzed: pāpāsaḥ santaḥ anṛtāḥ asatyāḥ idam padam ajanatā gabhīram
translated: Being wicked, false, and untrue, they have produced this deep-seated disease.

original: idam me agne kiyate pāvakāminate gurum bhāraṃ na manma
analyzed: idam me agne kiyate pāva kāminate gurum bhāram na manma
translated: This, O Agni, is my great and purifying thought, like a heavy burden.

original: bṛhad dadhātha dhṛṣatā gabhīraṃ yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā saptadhātu
analyzed: bṛhat dadhātha dhṛṣatā gabhīram yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā sapta dhātu
translated: You have placed the great, bold, deep, young back, with seven layers, with effort.

original: tam in nv eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītir aśyāḥ
analyzed: tam id nu eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītiḥ aśyāḥ
translated: To him, indeed, the equal, the same, the thought, purified by wisdom, should come nigh, to be honoured.

original: sasasya carmann adhi cāru pṛśner agre rupa ārupitaṃ jabāru
analyzed: sasasya carman adhi cāru pṛśneḥ agre rupaḥ ārupitam jabāru
translated: On the skin of the corn, on the beautiful back of the striped (bull), the first form, the swift one, was spread out.

original: pravācyaṃ vacasaḥ kim me asya guhā hitam upa niṇig vadanti
analyzed: pravācyam vacasaḥ kim me asya guhā hitam upa niṇih vadanti
translated: What is the praise of speech? They speak, hidden, about what is placed in the secret (place).

original: yad usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyaṃ rupo agram padaṃ veḥ
analyzed: yat usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyam rupaḥ agram padam veḥ
translated: When the cow has flowed forth, like water, from the cows, he guards the dear first form, the foot of the bird.

original: idam u tyan mahi mahām anīkaṃ yad usriyā sacata pūrvyaṃ gauḥ
analyzed: idam u tyad mahi mahām anīkam yat usriyā sacata pūrvyam gauḥ
translated: This, indeed, is that great, mighty, high host, the ancient cow that goes with the cow.

original: ṛtasya pade adhi dīdyānaṃ guhā raghuṣyad raghuyad viveda🔽adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacāsāmanuta guhyaṃ cāru pṛśneḥ
analyzed: ṛtasya pade adhi dīdyānam guhā raghuṣyat raghuyat viveda  adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacā āsām anuta guhyam cāru pṛśneḥ
translated: Shining on the place of holy order, the swift one, moving swiftly, has discovered the hidden (treasure).🔽Then, shining, he has sat down with the two parents, the hidden, beautiful treasure of the striped (bull).

original: mātuṣ pade parame anti ṣad gor vṛṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ prayatasya jihvā
analyzed: mātuṣ pade parame anti sat goḥ vṛṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ prayatasya jihvā
translated: In the mother's highest place, sitting in the cow, the tongue of the strong, shining, eager (bull).

original: ṛtaṃ voce namasā pṛchyamānas tavāśasā jātavedo yadīdam
analyzed: ṛtam voce namasā pṛchyamānaḥ tava āśasā jātavedaḥ yadi idam
translated: Speak truth, asked with homage. By your favour, O all-knowing one, this (is to be done).

original: tvam asya kṣayasi yad dha viśvaṃ divi yad u draviṇaṃ yat pṛthivyām
analyzed: tvam asya kṣayasi yat ha viśvam divi yat u draviṇam yat pṛthivyām
translated: You are the abode of all this wealth, of what is in the sky and what is on the earth.

original: kiṃ no asya draviṇaṃ kad dha ratnaṃ vi no voco jātavedaś cikitvān
analyzed: kim naḥ asya draviṇam kad ha ratnam vi naḥ vocaḥ jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: What is our wealth, what is our treasure? Tell us, O all-knowing one, O wise one.

original: guhādhvanaḥ paramaṃ yan no asya reku padaṃ na nidānā aganma
analyzed: guhā adhvanaḥ paramam yat naḥ asya reku padam na nidānāḥ aganma
translated: The highest path of this one, the cave-way, we have not found the foot nor the beginning.

original: kā maryādā vayunā kad dha vāmam achā gamema raghavo na vājam
analyzed: kā maryādā vayunā kad ha vāmam achā gamema raghavaḥ na vājam
translated: What is the boundary, what the division? How may we come to the good, like racers to the prize?

original: kadā no devīr amṛtasya patnīḥ sūro varṇena tatanann uṣāsaḥ
analyzed: kadā naḥ devīḥ amṛtasya patnīḥ sūraḥ varṇena tatanan uṣāsaḥ
translated: When will the goddesses, the wives of immortality, the dawns, spread themselves out with the sun's colour?

original: anireṇa vacasā phalgvena pratītyena kṛdhunātṛpāsaḥ
analyzed: anireṇa vacasā phalgvena pratītyena kṛdhunā atṛpāsaḥ
translated: With a word that is faint, with a word that is deceitful, with a word that is slow, with a word that is greedy, they have deceived us.

original: adhā te agne kim ihā vadanty anāyudhāsa āsatā sacantām🔽asya śriye samidhānasya vṛṣṇo vasor anīkaṃ dama ā ruroca
analyzed: adhā te agne kim iha ā vadanti an āyudhāsaḥ āsata sacantām  asya śriye samidhānasya vṛṣṇaḥ vasoḥ anīkam dame ā ruroca
translated: Now, O Agni, what do they say here? Let them sit down unarmed, let them be united.🔽The face of this kindled, powerful, bountiful one shines in the house with splendour.

original: ruśad vasānaḥ sudṛśīkarūpaḥ kṣitir na rāyā puruvāro adyaut
analyzed: ruśat vasānaḥ sudṛśīka rūpaḥ kṣitiḥ na rāyā puru vāraḥ adyaut
translated: Wearing a ruddy garment, of beautiful appearance, the giver of much wealth shines today like the earth with wealth.

original: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇo adhvarasya hotar agne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ u su naḥ adhvarasya hotar agne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān
translated: Stand up, O Hotar, in our sacrifice, O Agni, highest among the gods, erect like the beam.

original: tvaṃ hi viśvam abhy asi manma pra vedhasaś cit tirasi manīṣām🔽amūro hotā ny asādi vikṣv agnir mandro vidatheṣu pracetāḥ
analyzed: tvam hi viśvam abhī asi manma pra vedhasaḥ cit tirasi manīṣām  amūraḥ hotā ni asādi vikṣu agniḥ mandraḥ vidatheṣu pracetāḥ
translated: For thou art all-pervading, O thou of the world, thou surpassest even the thought of the wise.🔽The unerring Hotar has sat down in the houses, the delightful, wise Agni.

original: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitevāśren meteva dhūmaṃ stabhāyad upa dyām
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā iva aśret metā iva dhūmam stabhāyat upa dyām
translated: He has raised his light like the sun, he has fixed his smoke like a column to the sky.

original: yatā sujūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ
analyzed: yatā su jūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇit devatātim urāṇaḥ
translated: As the well-ordered, bountiful, well-oiled one, flying around, goes to the assembly of the gods,

original: ud u svarur navajā nākraḥ paśvo anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ🔽stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnā ūrdhvo adhvaryur jujuṣāṇo asthāt
analyzed: ud u svaruḥ nava jāḥ na akraḥ paśvaḥ anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ  stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau ūrdhvaḥ adhvaryuḥ jujuṣāṇaḥ asthāt
translated: The new-born Svara, like a bird, anoints him, well-placed, well-ordered.🔽On the strewn grass, with the fire kindled, the Adhvaryu, accepting, stands up, erect.

original: pary agniḥ paśupā na hotā triviṣṭy eti pradiva urāṇaḥ
analyzed: pari agniḥ paśu pāḥ na hotā tri viṣṭī eti pradivaḥ urāṇaḥ
translated: Agni, the herdsman, the Hotar, goes around, ascending to the threefold heaven, to the heights.

original: pari tmanā mitadrur eti hotāgnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā
analyzed: pari tmanā mitadruḥ eti hotā agniḥ mandraḥ madhu vacāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: The Hotar, Agni, goes around by his own will, the sweet-voiced, truthful one, with honeyed words.

original: dravanty asya vājino na śokā bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yad abhrāṭ
analyzed: dravanti asya vājinaḥ na śokāḥ bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yat abhrāṭ
translated: His strong ones run, his sorrows are afraid, when he shines over all the worlds.

original: bhadrā te agne svanīka saṃdṛg ghorasya sato viṣuṇasya cāruḥ
analyzed: bhadrā te agne su anīka saṃdṛś ghorasya sataḥ viṣuṇasya cāruḥ
translated: Your sight, O Agni, O fair-faced one, is auspicious, of you who are terrible, of you who are fearful.

original: na yat te śocis tamasā varanta na dhvasmānas tanv repa ā dhuḥ
analyzed: na yat te śociḥ tamasā varanta na dhvasmānaḥ tanu repaḥ ā dhuḥ
translated: Your flame is not checked by darkness, nor have the wicked brought dust to your body.

original: na yasya sātur janitor avāri na mātarāpitarā nū cid iṣṭau🔽adhā mitro na sudhitaḥ pāvako 'gnir dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
analyzed: na yasya sātuḥ janitoḥ avāri na mātarā pitarā nu cit iṣṭau  adhā mitraḥ na sudhitaḥ pāvakaḥ gniḥ dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Whose (flame) is not extinguished by the birth of the wicked, nor by the parents, the mother and father, in the sacrifice.🔽Now let Agni, the well-disposed, the purifying one, shine, like Mitra, among human people.

original: dvir yam pañca jījanan saṃvasānāḥ svasāro agnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
analyzed: dvis yam pañca jījanan saṃvasānāḥ svasāraḥ agnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Whom the five sisters, the well-attending ones, have generated twice, Agni, among human people.

original: uṣarbudham atharyo na dantaṃ śukraṃ svāsam paraśuṃ na tigmam
analyzed: uṣarbudham atharyaḥ na dantam śukram svāsam paraśum na tigmam
translated: Like a tooth for the aged, like a sharp axe for the wood, like a bright ornament, like a sharp knife

original: tava tye agne harito ghṛtasnā rohitāsa ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ
analyzed: tava tye agne haritaḥ ghṛta snāḥ rohitāsaḥ ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ
translated: Your tawny horses, O Agni, anointed with ghee, the red ones, straight-going and self-moving,

original: aruṣāso vṛṣaṇa ṛjumuṣkā ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ
analyzed: aruṣāsaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ ṛju muṣkāḥ ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ
translated: The red ones, strong, with straight horns, the awesome ones have invited to the assembly of the gods

original: ye ha tye te sahamānā ayāsas tveṣāso agne arcayaś caranti
analyzed: ye ha tye te sahamānāḥ ayāsaḥ tveṣāsaḥ agne arcayaḥ caranti
translated: Those who are victorious, untiring, brilliant, and shining, O Agni, move about

original: śyenāso na duvasanāso arthaṃ tuviṣvaṇaso mārutaṃ na śardhaḥ
analyzed: śyenāsaḥ na duvasanāsaḥ artham tuviṣvaṇasaḥ mārutam na śardhaḥ
translated: Like falcons, like those who are eager to serve, like the Marut host, with great strength

original: akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyaṃ śaṃsāty ukthaṃ yajate vy dhāḥ
analyzed: akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyam śaṃsāti uktham yajate vi dhāḥ
translated: The prayer has been made for you, O Agni, the hymn is praised, the sacrifice is performed

original: hotāram agnim manuṣo ni ṣedur namasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
analyzed: hotāram agnim manuṣaḥ ni ṣeduḥ namasyantaḥ uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
translated: Men have seated Agni as the Hotar, the praiser of the living, paying homage

original: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ
analyzed: ayam iha prathamaḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ
translated: This one was first established by the creators, the priest, most worthy of worship at the sacrifices, to be praised

original: yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśeviśe🔽agne kadā ta ānuṣag bhuvad devasya cetanam
analyzed: yam apnavānaḥ bhṛgavaḥ virurucuḥ vaneṣu citram vibhvam viśeviśe  agne kadā te ānuṣak bhuvat devasya cetanam
translated: Whom the Apnavāna Bhṛgus have made to shine, the wondrous one in the clans, in every clan🔽O Agni, when will your divine thought be fulfilled for us?

original: adhā hi tvā jagṛbhrire martāso vikṣv īḍyam
analyzed: adhā hi tvā jagṛbhrire martāsaḥ vikṣu īḍyam
translated: Then indeed they have grasped you, mortals, to be praised in many places

original: ṛtāvānaṃ vicetasam paśyanto dyām iva stṛbhiḥ
analyzed: ṛtāvānam vicetasam paśyantaḥ dyām iva stṛbhiḥ
translated: Beholding the truthful one, the discerning one, like the sky with the clouds

original: viśveṣām adhvarāṇāṃ haskartāraṃ damedame🔽āśuṃ dūtaṃ vivasvato viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhi
analyzed: viśveṣām adhvarāṇām haskartāram damedame  āśum dūtam vivasvataḥ viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhi
translated: The impeller of all sacrifices, in every house,🔽The swift messenger of Vivasvat, who looks on all people,

original: ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavo bhṛgavāṇaṃ viśeviśe
analyzed: ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavaḥ bhṛgavāṇam viśeviśe
translated: They have made the banner of the living, the son of Bhṛgu, in every clan.

original: tam īṃ hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṃsaṃ ni ṣedire
analyzed: tam īm hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṃsam ni sedire
translated: They have seated him, the priest, the wise one, in due order,

original: raṇvam pāvakaśociṣaṃ yajiṣṭhaṃ sapta dhāmabhiḥ
analyzed: raṇvam pāvaka śociṣam yajiṣṭham sapta dhāmabhiḥ
translated: The bountiful one, with the radiance of the purifying one, the best worshipper, with the seven abodes.

original: taṃ śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vana ā vītam aśritam
analyzed: tam śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vane ā vītam aśritam
translated: Him, who is spread out in the woods, in the eternal mothers, who has taken refuge,

original: citraṃ santaṃ guhā hitaṃ suvedaṃ kūcidarthinam
analyzed: citram santam guhā hitam su vedam kūcid arthinam
translated: Who is wondrous, hidden in the cave, easy to find, who moves a little for one who seeks him.

original: sasasya yad viyutā sasminn ūdhann ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ
analyzed: sasasya yat viyutā sasmin ūdhan ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ
translated: When the two, united, rejoice in him in the womb of the plant, in the abode of truth, the gods delight.

original: mahāṃ agnir namasā rātahavyo ver adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā
analyzed: mahān agniḥ namasā rāta havyaḥ veḥ adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā
translated: Great is Agni, to be worshipped with homage, always true to the offering of oblations, for the sacrifice.

original: ver adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antā rodasī saṃcikitvān
analyzed: veḥ adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antar rodasī saṃcikitvān
translated: Knowing the duties of the sacrifice, looking on both ends of the two worlds,

original: dūta īyase pradiva urāṇo viduṣṭaro diva ārodhanāni
analyzed: dūtaḥ īyase pradivaḥ urāṇaḥ viduṣṭaraḥ divaḥ ārodhanāni
translated: As a messenger you fly through the sky, knowing the distant barriers of heaven.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśataḥ puro bhāś cariṣṇv arcir vapuṣām id ekam
analyzed: kṛṣṇam te ema ruśataḥ puras bhās cariṣṇu arciḥ vapuṣām id ekam
translated: That one dark, with red rays in front, moving with wondrous radiance, is indeed the one of forms.

original: yad apravītā dadhate ha garbhaṃ sadyaś cij jāto bhavasīd u dūtaḥ
analyzed: yat a pravītāḥ dadhate ha garbham sadyas cit jātaḥ bhavasi id u dūtaḥ
translated: When the unwedded ones conceive a child, immediately born you become the messenger.

original: sadyo jātasya dadṛśānam ojo yad asya vāto anuvāti śociḥ🔽vṛṇakti tigmām ataseṣu jihvāṃ sthirā cid annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ
analyzed: sadyas jātasya dadṛśānam ojaḥ yat asya vātaḥ anuvāti śociḥ  vṛṇakti tigmām ataseṣu jihvām sthirā cit annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ
translated: The strength of him who was seen as soon as born, when the wind blows upon his flaming fire.🔽He sharpens his fierce tongue on the flints, and with his teeth he breaks even solid food.

original: tṛṣu yad annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣuṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇute yahvo agniḥ
analyzed: tṛṣu yat annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣum dūtam kṛṇute yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: When he is hungry, with hunger he waxes great; the youthful Agni makes hunger his swift messenger.

original: vātasya meḷiṃ sacate nijūrvann āśuṃ na vājayate hinve arvā
analyzed: vātasya mā iḷim sacate nijūrvan āśum na vājayate hinve arvā
translated: He follows the wind's course, shaking, and urges on the swift steed, impelling him.

original: dūtaṃ vo viśvavedasaṃ havyavāham amartyam
analyzed: dūtam vaḥ viśva vedasam havya vāham amartyam
translated: We choose you as our messenger, all-knowing, bearer of our offerings, immortal,

original: yajiṣṭham ṛñjase girā
analyzed: yajiṣṭham ṛñjase girā
translated: Best priest, we strive to win you with our song.

original: sa hi vedā vasudhitim mahāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ
analyzed: sa hi vedā vasu dhitim mahān ārodhanam divaḥ
translated: For he knows the great treasure of the sky, the abode of wealth.

original: sa devāṃ eha vakṣati
analyzed: sa devān ā iha vakṣati
translated: He will bring the gods hither.

original: sa veda deva ānamaṃ devām ṛtāyate dame
analyzed: sa veda devaḥ ānamam devām ṛtāyate dame
translated: He, the god, knows the bending of the gods, who serve the law in the house.

original: dāti priyāṇi cid vasu
analyzed: dāti priyāṇi cit vasu
translated: He gives even dear treasures.

original: sa hotā sed u dūtyaṃ cikitvāṃ antar īyate
analyzed: sa hotā sa id u dūtyam cikitvān antar īyate
translated: He, the priest, goes as messenger, the wise one, within.

original: vidvāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ
analyzed: vidvān ārodhanam divaḥ
translated: He knows the abode of the sky.

original: te syāma ye agnaye dadāśur havyadātibhiḥ
analyzed: te syāma ye agnaye dadāśuḥ havya dātibhiḥ
translated: May we be they who have offered to Agni with our oblations,

original: ya īm puṣyanta indhate
analyzed: yaḥ īm puṣyantaḥ indhate
translated: Who cherish and enkindle him.

original: te rāyā te suvīryaiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire
analyzed: te rāyā te su vīryaiḥ sasavāṃsaḥ vi śṛṇvire
translated: They, with their wealth and their heroic strength, have spread out, united,

original: ye agnā dadhire duvaḥ🔽asme rāyo divedive saṃ carantu puruspṛhaḥ
analyzed: ye agnā dadhire duvaḥ  asme rāyaḥ dive dive sam carantu puruspṛhaḥ
translated: Who have bestowed their service on Agni.🔽To us may riches come day by day, much sought after,

original: asme vājāsa īratām
analyzed: asme vājāsaḥ īratām
translated: To us may the treasures come.

original: sa vipraś carṣaṇīnāṃ śavasā mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: sa vipraḥ carṣaṇīnām śavasā mānuṣāṇām
translated: He, the priest of men, by his strength,

original: ati kṣipreva vidhyati🔽agne mṛḷa mahāṃ asi ya īm ā devayuṃ janam
analyzed: ati kṣipra iva vidhyati  agne mṛḍa mahān asi yaḥ īm ā devayum janam
translated: pierces quickly, as it were,🔽O Agni, be gracious, for thou art great, who hast come

original: iyetha barhir āsadam
analyzed: iyetha barhiḥ āsadam
translated: to the people who honour the gods, to the seat of the sacrificial grass.

original: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḷabho vikṣu prāvīr amartyaḥ
analyzed: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḍabhaḥ vikṣu prāvīḥ amartyaḥ
translated: He, the immortal one, is the guest in the human dwellings,

original: dūto viśveṣām bhuvat
analyzed: dūtaḥ viśveṣām bhuvat
translated: the messenger of all that exists.

original: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandro diviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandraḥ diviṣṭiṣu
translated: He is led around the house, the delightful Hotar in the sacrifices,

original: uta potā ni ṣīdati
analyzed: uta potā ni sīdati
translated: and also sits as the offerer.

original: uta gnā agnir adhvara uto gṛhapatir dame
analyzed: uta gnāḥ agniḥ adhvare uta u gṛhapatiḥ dame
translated: Agni is the guest of the women in the house, and the lord of the house,

original: uta brahmā ni ṣīdati
analyzed: uta brahmā ni sīdati
translated: and also the Brahman sits down.

original: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām
analyzed: veṣi hi adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām
translated: For thou art the Adhvaryu, the Upagâtri of the people,

original: havyā ca mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: havyā ca mānuṣāṇām
translated: and the oblations of men.

original: veṣīd v asya dūtyaṃ yasya jujoṣo adhvaram
analyzed: veṣi id u asya dūtyam yasya jujoṣaḥ adhvaram
translated: Thou art his messenger, whose sacrifice thou acceptest,

original: havyam martasya voḷhave
analyzed: havyam martasya voḷhave
translated: the oblation of the mortal for his offering.

original: asmākaṃ joṣy adhvaram asmākaṃ yajñam aṅgiraḥ
analyzed: asmākam joṣi adhvaram asmākam yajñam aṅgiraḥ
translated: O Angiras, accept our sacrifice, accept our sacrifice,

original: asmākaṃ śṛṇudhī havam
analyzed: asmākam śṛṇudhi havam
translated: listen to our call.

original: pari te dūḷabho ratho 'smāṃ aśnotu viśvataḥ
analyzed: pari te dūḍabhaḥ rathaḥ smām aśnotu viśvatas
translated: May thy chariot, O guest, come to us from every side,

original: yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
analyzed: yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
translated: wherewith thou protectest the worshipper.

original: agne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛśam
analyzed: agne tam adya aśvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hṛdispṛśam
translated: O Agni, with our praises today, as with a horse, we will make ready the sacrifice, the good, the heart-pleasing,

original: ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ
analyzed: ṛdhyāma te ohaiḥ
translated: may we prosper through thy favours.

original: adhā hy agne krator bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ
analyzed: adhā hi agne kratoḥ bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ
translated: For thou, O Agni, art of good sacrifice, of good power, of good counsel,

original: rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha
analyzed: rathīḥ ṛtasya bṛhataḥ babhūtha
translated: You have become the charioteer of great holy order

original: ebhir no arkair bhavā no arvāṅ svar ṇa jyotiḥ🔽agne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ
analyzed: ebhiḥ naḥ arkaiḥ bhava naḥ arvāṅ svar na jyotiḥ  agne viśvebhiḥ sumanāḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: With these hymns of ours, be near to us, the light of heaven🔽O Agni, with all your well-disposed faces

original: ābhiṣ ṭe adya gīrbhir gṛṇanto 'gne dāśema
analyzed: ābhiḥ te adya gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ gne dāśema
translated: Singing to you with these songs today, O Agni, we will serve you

original: pra te divo na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ
analyzed: pra te divaḥ na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ
translated: Your powers roar like the clouds of heaven for you

original: tava svādiṣṭhāgne saṃdṛṣṭir idā cid ahna idā cid aktoḥ
analyzed: tava svādiṣṭhā agne saṃdṛṣṭiḥ idā cit ahnaḥ idā cit aktoḥ
translated: O Agni, your most delightful appearance is seen even in the day and even in the night

original: śriye rukmo na rocata upāke🔽ghṛtaṃ na pūtaṃ tanūr arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam
analyzed: śriye rukmaḥ na rocate upāke  ghṛtam na pūtam tanūḥ arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam
translated: Like a golden ornament it shines near you🔽Like pure ghee, your body is unblemished, pure gold

original: tat te rukmo na rocata svadhāvaḥ
analyzed: tat te rukmaḥ na rocata svadhāvas
translated: That shines for you like a golden ornament, O self-existent one

original: kṛtaṃ cid dhi ṣmā sanemi dveṣo 'gna inoṣi martāt
analyzed: kṛtam cit hi sma sanemi dveṣaḥ gne inoṣi martāt
translated: Even if we have done wrong, O Agni, you lead the mortal away from hatred

original: itthā yajamānād ṛtāvaḥ
analyzed: itthā yajamānāt ṛtāvaḥ
translated: In this way, O truthful one, from the sacrificer

original: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrāgne deveṣu yuṣme
analyzed: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrā agne deveṣu yuṣme
translated: May they be auspicious to us as friends, O Agni, among the gods, you and your brothers

original: sā no nābhiḥ sadane sasminn ūdhan
analyzed: sā naḥ nābhiḥ sadane sasmin ūdhan
translated: That is our navel, the udder in this house

original: bhadraṃ te agne sahasinn anīkam upāka ā rocate sūryasya
analyzed: bhadram te agne sahasin anīkam upāke ā rocate sūryasya
translated: O Agni, the powerful one, your auspicious face shines near the light of the sun

original: ruśad dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cid arūkṣitaṃ dṛśa ā rūpe annam
analyzed: ruśat dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cit arūkṣitam dṛśe ā rūpe annam
translated: The ruddy one is seen even in the night, the food is seen in its own form, uninjured

original: vi ṣāhy agne gṛṇate manīṣāṃ khaṃ vepasā tuvijāta stavānaḥ
analyzed: vi sāhi agne gṛṇate manīṣām kham vepasā tuvi jāta stavānaḥ
translated: Go forth, O Agni, to the singer's thought, O mighty one, praised with inspiration

original: viśvebhir yad vāvanaḥ śukra devais tan no rāsva sumaho bhūri manma
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ yat vāvanaḥ śukra devaiḥ tat naḥ rāsva su mahas bhūri manma
translated: When thou art delighted with the All-gods, O bright one, then bestow on us, O mighty one, abundant thought.

original: tvad agne kāvyā tvan manīṣās tvad ukthā jāyante rādhyāni
analyzed: tvat agne kāvyā tvat manīṣāḥ tvat ukthā jāyante rādhyāni
translated: From thee, O Agni, are the thoughts of the wise, from thee the hymns are born which win us wealth.

original: tvad eti draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: tvat eti draviṇam vīra peśāḥ itthā dhiye dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: From thee comes wealth, O thou who deckest heroes, to the mortal worshipper who offers.

original: tvad vājī vājambharo vihāyā abhiṣṭikṛj jāyate satyaśuṣmaḥ🔽tvad rayir devajūto mayobhus tvad āśur jūjuvāṃ agne arvā
analyzed: tvat vājī vājambharaḥ vihāyāḥ abhiṣṭi kṛt jāyate satya śuṣmaḥ  tvat rayiḥ deva jūtaḥ mayobhuḥ tvat āśuḥ jūjuvān agne arvā
translated: From thee the strong steed, bearing his burden, is born, the helper, of true might.🔽From thee comes wealth, O Agni, inspired by the gods, bringing bliss, from thee the swift steed, the eager one.

original: tvām agne prathamaṃ devayanto devam martā amṛta mandrajihvam🔽dveṣoyutam ā vivāsanti dhībhir damūnasaṃ gṛhapatim amūram
analyzed: tvām agne prathamam devayantaḥ devam martāḥ amṛta mandra jihvam  dveṣaḥ yutam ā vivāsanti dhībhiḥ damūnasam gṛha patim amūram
translated: Thee, O Agni, the mortal men who worship, thee, O immortal one, O god, with sweet tongue,🔽With thoughts free from anger invite thee, the friend of the house, the guileless one.

original: āre asmad amatim āre aṃha āre viśvāṃ durmatiṃ yan nipāsi
analyzed: āre asmat amatim āre aṃhaḥ āre viśvām durmatim yat nipāsi
translated: Keep far from us sin, keep far from us grief, keep far from us all evil thought, since thou protectest.

original: doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne yaṃ deva ā cit sacase svasti
analyzed: doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne yam devaḥ ā cit sacase svasti
translated: O son of strength, O Agni, be auspicious in the evening, whom thou, O god, dost attend for welfare.

original: yas tvām agna inadhate yatasruk tris te annaṃ kṛṇavat sasminn ahan
analyzed: yaḥ tvām agne inadhate yata sruc tris te annam kṛṇavat sasmin ahan
translated: He who, O Agni, kindles thee, with uplifted ladle, may he thrice a day prepare thy food.

original: sa su dyumnair abhy astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaś cikitvān
analyzed: sa su dyumnaiḥ abhī astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: May he be prosperous through thy glories, through thy wisdom, O all-knowing one.

original: idhmaṃ yas te jabharac chaśramāṇo maho agne anīkam ā saparyan
analyzed: idhmam yaḥ te jabharat śaśramāṇaḥ mahaḥ agne anīkam ā saparyan
translated: He who, O Agni, hath piled thy fuel, hath served thy great form,

original: sa idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayiṃ sacate ghnann amitrān
analyzed: saḥ idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayim sacate ghnan amitrān
translated: kindled, he winneth the morning and the evening, and, increasing wealth, he slayeth his foes.

original: agnir īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasyāgnir vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasya agniḥ vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ
translated: Agni is the lord of the great dominion, Agni of the highest treasure of strength.

original: dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate yaviṣṭho vy ānuṣaṅ martyāya svadhāvān
analyzed: dadhāti ratnam vidhate yaviṣṭhaḥ vi ānuṣak martyāya svadhāvān
translated: He bestows wealth on the man who offers, the youngest, the self-existent, dispelling the niggardly.

original: yac cid dhi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭhācittibhiś cakṛmā kac cid āgaḥ
analyzed: yat cit hi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭha acittibhiḥ cakṛma kad cit āgaḥ
translated: Whatever, O most youthful, we have done amiss against thee, O Agni, in our thoughts, in that we have sinned

original: kṛdhī ṣv asmāṃ aditer anāgān vy enāṃsi śiśratho viṣvag agne
analyzed: kṛdhi su asmān aditeḥ anāgān vi enāṃsi śiśrathaḥ viṣvak agne
translated: make us sinless in the sight of Aditi: drive away all our sins, O Agni, on every side.

original: mahaś cid agna enaso abhīka ūrvād devānām uta martyānām
analyzed: mahaḥ cit agne enasaḥ abhīke ūrvāt devānām uta martyānām
translated: Even from great sin, O Agni, from the sin of the gods and of men,

original: mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yachā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yaccha tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: let not thy friends ever be injured: grant to our offspring and children welfare and peace.

original: yathā ha tyad vasavo gauryaṃ cit padi ṣitām amuñcatā yajatrāḥ
analyzed: yathā ha tyad vasavaḥ gauryam cit padi sitām amuñcata yajatrāḥ
translated: Even as ye, O Vasus, the holy ones, have loosed the cow tied with a halter,

original: evo ṣv asman muñcatā vy aṃhaḥ pra tāry agne prataraṃ na āyuḥ
analyzed: eva u su asmat muñcata vi aṃhaḥ pra tāri agne prataram naḥ āyuḥ
translated: even so deliver us from this woe: give us, O Agni, a passage to long life.

original: praty agnir uṣasām agram akhyad vibhātīnāṃ sumanā ratnadheyam
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat vibhātīnām sumanāḥ ratna dheyam
translated: Agni hath shown the foremost of the dawns, the shining ones, the giver of good things.

original: yātam aśvinā sukṛto duroṇam ut sūryo jyotiṣā deva eti
analyzed: yātam aśvinā su kṛtaḥ duroṇam ud sūryaḥ jyotiṣā devaḥ eti
translated: Come, O ye Asvins, to the house of him who offereth you gifts. The God Sûrya ascendeth with his light.

original: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred drapsaṃ davidhvad gaviṣo na satvā
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā devaḥ aśret drapsam davidhvat gaviṣaḥ na satvā
translated: Savitar the God hath raised his light on high, the drop, as 'twere, a vigorous bull, that drops with oil.

original: anu vrataṃ varuṇo yanti mitro yat sūryaṃ divy ārohayanti
analyzed: anu vratam varuṇaḥ yanti mitraḥ yat sūryam divi ārohayanti
translated: After the law of Varuṇa and Mitra they cause the Sun to mount the heaven on high.

original: yaṃ sīm akṛṇvan tamase vipṛce dhruvakṣemā anavasyanto artham/
analyzed: yam sīm akṛṇvan tamase vipṛce dhruva kṣemāḥ an avasyantaḥ artham
translated: Whom they have made to shine through darkness, the firm-seated, never-failing ones, for wealth.

original: taṃ sūryaṃ haritaḥ sapta yahvī spaśaṃ viśvasya jagato vahanti
analyzed: tam sūryam haritaḥ sapta yahvī spaśam viśvasya jagataḥ vahanti
translated: The seven strong tawny horses bear that Sun, the envoy of the world of life.

original: vahiṣṭhebhir viharan yāsi tantum avavyayann asitaṃ deva vasma
analyzed: vahiṣṭhebhiḥ viharan yāsi tantum avavyayan asitam deva vasma
translated: With those most distant ones thou movest, spreading the thread, O God, and removest the dark robe.

original: davidhvato raśmayaḥ sūryasya carmevāvādhus tamo apsv antaḥ
analyzed: davidhvataḥ raśmayaḥ sūryasya carma iva avādhuḥ tamaḥ apsu antar
translated: The rays of Sûrya have thrown off the darkness, as 'twere a garment, from the midst of the waters.

original: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṃ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na
analyzed: an āyataḥ a nibaddhaḥ kathā ayam nyaṅ uttānaḥ padyate na
translated: Unrestrained, unfettered, how doth he move? Now on his back, now prone, he falls to earth.

original: b kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa diva skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam
analyzed: kayā yāti svadhayā kaḥ dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam
translated: With what a will he goes! Who hath beheld him? The pillar of the sky is stablished in the heaven.

original: praty agnir uṣaso jātavedā akhyad devo rocamānā mahobhiḥ
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasaḥ jātavedāḥ akhyat devaḥ rocamānāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: The God Jâtavedas Agni hath proclaimed the Dawns with his great light as they shine forth.

original: ā nāsatyorugāyā rathenemaṃ yajñam upa no yātam acha
analyzed: ā nāsatyā uru gāyā rathena imam yajñam upa naḥ yātam acha
translated: Come hither to this sacrifice of ours, O ye Nâsatyas, on your car that travels far.

original: ūrdhvaṃ ketuṃ savitā devo aśrej jyotir viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvan
analyzed: ūrdhvam ketum savitā devaḥ aśret jyotiḥ viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvan
translated: The god Savitar has raised up the banner on high, making light for all existing things.

original: āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ vi sūryo raśmibhiś cekitānaḥ
analyzed: āprāḥ dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam vi sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ cekitānaḥ
translated: The sun, with his rays, has filled heaven and earth and the atmosphere, and is radiant.

original: āvahanty aruṇīr jyotiṣāgān mahī citrā raśmibhiś cekitānā
analyzed: āvahantī aruṇīḥ jyotiṣā āgāt mahī citrā raśmibhiḥ cekitānā
translated: They bring the red ones, the lights, to the dawn. The great, variegated one, with her rays, is radiant.

original: prabodhayantī suvitāya devy uṣā īyate suyujā rathena
analyzed: prabodhayantī suvitāya devī uṣāḥ īyate su yujā rathena
translated: The goddess Ushas, waking (us) for prosperity, goes forth with a well-yoked chariot.

original: ā vāṃ vahiṣṭhā iha te vahantu rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭau
analyzed: ā vām vahiṣṭhāḥ iha te vahantu rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: May your best bearers bring you here, your chariots and horses, at dawn, at daybreak.

original: ime hi vām madhupeyāya somā asmin yajñe vṛṣaṇā mādayethām
analyzed: ime hi vām madhu peyāya somāḥ asmin yajñe vṛṣaṇā mādayethām
translated: For these Soma juices are to be drunk by you two, O mighty ones, in this sacrifice, you should rejoice.

original: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṃ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na /
analyzed: an āyataḥ a nibaddhaḥ kathā ayam nyaṅ uttānaḥ padyate na
translated: Unrestrained, unbound, how does this one fall back and forth, on its back and face?

original: agnir hotā no adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate
analyzed: agniḥ hotā naḥ adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate
translated: Agni, the priest, is led around in our sacrifice, being strong.

original: devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
analyzed: devaḥ deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
translated: The god among the gods, worthy of sacrifice.

original: pari triviṣṭy adhvaraṃ yāty agnī rathīr iva
analyzed: pari tri viṣṭī adhvaram yāti agniḥ rathīḥ iva
translated: Agni goes around the threefold sacrifice, like a charioteer,

original: ā deveṣu prayo dadhat
analyzed: ā deveṣu prayaḥ dadhat
translated: placing the offering among the gods.

original: pari vājapatiḥ kavir agnir havyāny akramīt
analyzed: pari vāja patiḥ kaviḥ agniḥ havyāni akramīt
translated: The wise Agni, the lord of strength, has gone around the offerings,

original: dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe🔽ayaṃ yaḥ sṛñjaye puro daivavāte samidhyate
analyzed: dadhat ratnāni dāśuṣe  ayam yaḥ sṛñjaye puras daivavāte samidhyate
translated: placing treasures for the worshipper.🔽This one who is kindled in front of the Sṛñjayas, in the house of Divāvata,

original: dyumāṃ amitradambhanaḥ
analyzed: dyumān amitra dambhanaḥ
translated: the glorious one, the subduer of enemies.

original: asya ghā vīra īvato 'gner īśīta martyaḥ
analyzed: asya gha vīraḥ īvataḥ gneḥ īśīta martyaḥ
translated: A mortal man should not provoke the wrath of this hero Agni,

original: tigmajambhasya mīḷhuṣaḥ🔽tam arvantaṃ na sānasim aruṣaṃ na divaḥ śiśum
analyzed: tigma jambhasya mīḷhuṣaḥ  tam arvantam na sānasim aruṣam na divaḥ śiśum
translated: of the one with a sharp-edged tongue and greedy.

original: marmṛjyante divedive
analyzed: marmṛjyante dive dive
translated: They anoint him day by day, like a swift horse that wins the prize, like a red child of the sky.

original: bodhad yan mā haribhyāṃ kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
analyzed: bodhat yat mā haribhyām kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
translated: When the young man of the Sahas, having awakened,

original: achā na hūta ud aram
analyzed: achā na hūtaḥ ud aram
translated: has come to the call, to the height.

original: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt
analyzed: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt
translated: And your two tawny horses, O you to be worshipped, from the young man of the Sahas,

original: prayatā sadya ā dade
analyzed: prayatā sadyas ā dade
translated: I have quickly taken away.

original: eṣa vāṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
analyzed: eṣa vām devau aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
translated: This young man of the Sahas, O you two gods, O Asvins,

original: dīrghāyur astu somakaḥ
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ astu somakaḥ
translated: may Somaka have a long life.

original: taṃ yuvaṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraṃ sāhadevyam
analyzed: tam yuvam devau aśvinā kumāram sāhadevyam
translated: You two gods, O Asvins, make this young man of the Sahas,

original: dīrghāyuṣaṃ kṛṇotana
analyzed: dīrgha āyuṣam kṛṇotana
translated: long-lived.

original: ā satyo yātu maghavām ṛjīṣī dravantv asya haraya upa naḥ
analyzed: ā satyaḥ yātu maghavām ṛjīṣī dravantu asya harayaḥ upa naḥ
translated: May the true, the mighty one come to us; may his tawny ones hasten to us.

original: tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṃ karate gṛṇānaḥ🔽ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai
analyzed: tasmai id andhaḥ suṣuma su dakṣam iha abhipitvam karate gṛṇānaḥ  ava sya śūra adhvanaḥ na ante smin naḥ adya savane mandadhyai
translated: To him, the good-looking, the very skillful one, I offer this praise, singing.🔽At the end of his heroic journey, may he rejoice in this libation for us today.

original: śaṃsāty uktham uśaneva vedhāś cikituṣe asuryāya manma
analyzed: śaṃsāti uktham uśanā iva vedhāḥ cikituṣe asuryāya manma
translated: He praises the hymn like a wise one, a thought for the discerning, for the divine one.

original: kavir na niṇyaṃ vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekaṃ vipipāno arcāt
analyzed: kaviḥ na niṇyam vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekam vipipānaḥ arcāt
translated: The bull, the sage, accomplishing the rites, when he praises the drop, the one who drinks the pressed (drink),

original: diva itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cic cakrur vayunā gṛṇantaḥ🔽svar yad vedi sudṛśīkam arkair mahi jyotī rurucur yad dha vastoḥ
analyzed: divaḥ itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cit cakruḥ vayunā gṛṇantaḥ  svar yat vedi sudṛśīkam arkaiḥ mahi jyotiḥ rurucuḥ yat ha vastoḥ
translated: Here in the sky he generated the seven swift ones, and in a day they made the ordinances, singing.🔽When the altar was made beautiful with the lights of heaven, the great light shone forth, when the dawn came.

original: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaś cakāra nṛtamo abhiṣṭau
analyzed: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: He dispelled the blinding darkness, the hidden one, and made the light visible for men, the best of men, to be praised.

original: vavakṣa indro amitam ṛjīṣy ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
analyzed: vavakṣa indraḥ amitam ṛjīṣī ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
translated: Indra, the irresistible one, has grown in strength, he has filled both worlds with his greatness.

original: ataś cid asya mahimā vi recy abhi yo viśvā bhuvanā babhūva
analyzed: atas cit asya mahimā vi reci abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā babhūva
translated: From there his greatness has spread forth, he who has become greater than all existing things.

original: viśvāni śakro naryāṇi vidvān apo rireca sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ
analyzed: viśvāni śakraḥ naryāṇi vidvān apaḥ rireca sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ
translated: Shakra, knowing all manly deeds, has spread out the waters with his dear friends.

original: aśmānaṃ cid ye bibhidur vacobhir vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ🔽apo vṛtraṃ vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ
analyzed: aśmānam cit ye bibhiduḥ vacobhiḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ  apaḥ vṛtram vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ
translated: They who with their words have cleft even the stone, the eager ones have opened the cow-pen full of cattle.🔽He has slain the cloud-enveloped Vrtra, the earth with her heart has approved your thunderbolt.

original: prārṇāṃsi samudriyāṇy ainoḥ patir bhavañ chavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo
analyzed: pra arṇāṃsi samudriyāṇi ainoḥ patiḥ bhavam śavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo
translated: You have won the ocean's watery depths, O hero, O bold one, becoming their lord by your strength.

original: apo yad adrim puruhūta dardar āvir bhuvat saramā pūrvyaṃ te
analyzed: apa u yat adrim puruhūta dardar āvis bhuvat saramā pūrvyam te
translated: When you, invoked by many, split the rock, Saramā became manifest to you, O ancient one.

original: sa no netā vājam ā darṣi bhūriṃ gotrā rujann aṅgirobhir gṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ netā vājam ā darṣi bhūrim gotrā rujan aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Be our leader, praised by the Angirases, breaking through many strongholds, O hero, for the sake of booty.

original: achā kaviṃ nṛmaṇo gā abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam
analyzed: achā kavim nṛmaṇaḥ gāḥ abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam
translated: To the sage, to the men's hero, to the cows' protector, O bountiful one, to the one who serves you

original: ūtibhis tam iṣaṇo dyumnahūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyur arta
analyzed: ūtibhiḥ tam iṣaṇaḥ dyumna hūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyuḥ arta
translated: With your aids, O you who are invoked for glory, the deceitful, the godless Dasyu is destroyed.

original: ā dasyughnā manasā yāhy astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ
analyzed: ā dasyu ghnā manasā yāhi astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ
translated: Go to the house in your mind, O slayer of the Dasyus, may Kutsa be dear to you in friendship.

original: sve yonau ni ṣadataṃ sarūpā vi vāṃ cikitsad ṛtacid dha nārī🔽yāsi kutsena saratham avasyus todo vātasya haryor īśānaḥ
analyzed: sve yonau ni sadatam sarūpā vi vām cikitsat ṛta cit ha nārī  yāsi kutsena sa ratham avasyuḥ todaḥ vātasya haryoḥ īśānaḥ
translated: Sit in your own womb, of the same form, may the woman who knows the truth discern you.🔽When you go with Kutsa to the chariot, seeking help, the leader of the two tawny ones of the wind

original: ṛjrā vājaṃ na gadhyaṃ yuyūṣan kavir yad ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt
analyzed: ṛjrā vājam na gadhyam yuyūṣan kaviḥ yat ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt
translated: The two swift ones will strive for the booty that is to be won, when the sage is ready to go to the farther shore.

original: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavaṃ sahasrā
analyzed: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣam ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavam sahasrā
translated: For Kutsa you cast down the dry, the Dasyu, at the time of the day, the Kuya with a thousand (followers).

original: sadyo dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraś cakraṃ vṛhatād abhīke
analyzed: sadyas dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraḥ cakram vṛhatāt abhīke
translated: Immediately crush the Dasas with the Kutsa, let the sun roll the wheel in the battle.

original: tvam piprum mṛgayaṃ śūśuvāṃsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ
analyzed: tvam piprum mṛgayam śūśuvāṃsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ
translated: You delighted the boasting Pipru, for Ṛjiśvan, for the son of Vedadât.

original: pañcāśat kṛṣṇā ni vapaḥ sahasrātkaṃ na puro jarimā vi dardaḥ
analyzed: pañcāśat kṛṣṇāḥ ni vapaḥ sahasrā atkam na puraḥ jarimā vi dardar
translated: You cut asunder the five hundred black ones, the fortress, O you who are to be invoked, with your wisdom.

original: sūra upāke tanvaṃ dadhāno vi yat te cety amṛtasya varpaḥ
