analyzed: sūraḥ upāke tanvam dadhānaḥ vi yat te ceti amṛtasya varpaḥ
translated: The sun, bearing his body in the near distance, when your form, O immortal one, is discerned.

original: mṛgo na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṃho na bhīma āyudhāni bibhrat
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṃhaḥ na bhīmaḥ āyudhāni bibhrat
translated: Like a mighty elephant, he shines with his own power, like a terrible lion, bearing his weapons.

original: indraṃ kāmā vasūyanto agman svarmīḷhe na savane cakānāḥ
analyzed: indram kāmāḥ vasūyantaḥ agman svarmīḍhe na savane cakānāḥ
translated: The desires have come to Indra, seeking wealth, shining in the heaven, in the libation.

original: śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsa ukthair oko na raṇvā sudṛśīva puṣṭiḥ
analyzed: śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsaḥ ukthaiḥ okaḥ na raṇvā sudṛśī iva puṣṭiḥ
translated: The seekers of fame, striving with their hymns, are like a pleasant home, like prosperity to one of fair appearance.

original: tam id va indraṃ suhavaṃ huvema yas tā cakāra naryā purūṇi🔽yo māvate jaritre gadhyaṃ cin makṣū vājam bharati spārharādhāḥ🔽tigmā yad antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmiñ cic chūra muhuke janānām
analyzed: tam id vaḥ indram su havam huvema yaḥ tā cakāra naryā purūṇi  yaḥ māvate jaritre gadhyam cit makṣū vājam bharati spārha rādhāḥ  tigmā yat antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmin cit śūra muhuke janānām
translated: To that Indra, who is easy to invoke, we should call, who has done many manly deeds,🔽Who quickly brings strength, even what is difficult to obtain, to the singer who has served him well.🔽When the sharp thunderbolt falls somewhere among the people, in some quarrel, O hero,

original: ghorā yad arya samṛtir bhavāty adha smā nas tanvo bodhi gopāḥ
analyzed: ghorā yat arya samṛtiḥ bhavāti adha smā naḥ tanvaḥ bodhi gopāḥ
translated: When the terrible destruction of the enemy comes, then be the protector of our bodies.

original: bhuvo 'vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhāvṛko vājasātau
analyzed: bhuvaḥ vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhā avṛkaḥ vājasātau
translated: Be the protector of the thoughts of Vamadeva, be the friend in the winning of strength, O Vrka.

original: tvām anu pramatim ā jaganmoruśaṃso jaritre viśvadha syāḥ
analyzed: tvām anu pramatim ā jaganma uru śaṃsaḥ jaritre viśvadha syāḥ
translated: Following you, may I be the wise one for the singer in every way, O you of great glory.

original: ebhir nṛbhir indra tvāyubhiṣ ṭvā maghavadbhir maghavan viśva ājau
analyzed: ebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ indra tvāyubhiḥ tvā maghavadbhiḥ maghavan viśvaḥ ājau
translated: With these men, O Indra, who are your friends, O bountiful one, in every battle, O bountiful one,

original: dyāvo na dyumnair abhi santo aryaḥ kṣapo madema śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ
analyzed: dyāvaḥ na dyumnaiḥ abhi santaḥ aryaḥ kṣapaḥ madema śaradaḥ ca pūrvīḥ
translated: May we, with these men, be satisfied with glory, like the heavens, and may we enjoy many autumns.

original: eved indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahmākarma bhṛgavo na ratham
analyzed: eva id indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahma akarma bhṛgavaḥ na ratham
translated: Even so, for Indra, the Bull, the Strong One, the Bhṛgus have made a prayer like a chariot

original: nū cid yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣad asan na ugro 'vitā tanūpāḥ
analyzed: nu cit yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣat asat naḥ ugraḥ vitā tanū pāḥ
translated: So that he may not be estranged from our friendship, he may be a strong protector of our bodies

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, when praised and when sung, do thou grant food to the singer, as rivers give water

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: I have made this new prayer to thee, O lord of bays; may we be ever victorious with our thoughts

original: tvam mahāṃ indra tubhyaṃ ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ
analyzed: tvam mahān indra tubhyam ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ
translated: Thou art great, O Indra; to thee the wide mid-air, to thy lordship, O thou of mighty power, the heaven looks

original: tvaṃ vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jagrasānān
analyzed: tvam vṛtram śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jagrasānān
translated: Thou, O mighty one, hast slain Vṛtra, hast loosed the rivers that were swallowed up by the dragon

original: tava tviṣo janiman rejata dyau rejad bhūmir bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ🔽ṛghāyanta subhvaḥ parvatāsa ārdan dhanvāni sarayanta āpaḥ🔽bhinad giriṃ śavasā vajram iṣṇann āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasāna ojaḥ
analyzed: tava tviṣaḥ janiman rejata dyauḥ rejat bhūmiḥ bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ  ṛghāyanta su bhvaḥ parvatāsaḥ ārdan dhanvāni sarayantaḥ āpaḥ  bhinat girim śavasā vajram iṣṇan āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasānaḥ ojaḥ
translated: Thy flames have trembled at thy birth, heaven has trembled, the earth through fear of thy fierce wrath🔽The mighty mountains have bent, the woods have bent, the waters have flowed, the deserts have flowed🔽He cleft the mountain with his might, hurling his thunderbolt, revealing his conquering strength

original: vadhīd vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ sarann āpo javasā hatavṛṣṇīḥ
analyzed: vadhīt vṛtram vajreṇa mandasānaḥ saran āpaḥ javasā hata vṛṣṇīḥ
translated: He slew Vṛtra with his thunderbolt, rejoicing, the waters flowed, the bull was slain by his impetuosity

original: suvīras te janitā manyata dyaur indrasya kartā svapastamo bhūt
analyzed: su vīraḥ te janitā manyata dyauḥ indrasya kartā su apastamaḥ bhūt
translated: Thy father Dyaus thought of thee as a good hero; the maker of Indra became most pure

original: ya īṃ jajāna svaryaṃ suvajram anapacyutaṃ sadaso na bhūma
analyzed: yaḥ īm jajāna svaryam su vajram an apacyutam sadasaḥ na bhūma
translated: He who begat him, the heavenly one, the good thunderbolt, unshaken from his seat like the earth

original: ya eka ic cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūta indraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūtaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who alone extends the wide space, King of the people, Indra invoked by many

original: satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātiṃ devasya gṛṇato maghonaḥ
analyzed: satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātim devasya gṛṇataḥ maghonaḥ
translated: All rejoice in him as true, in the gift of the bountiful God, the singer's gifts

original: satrā somā abhavann asya viśve satrā madāso bṛhato madiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: satrā somāḥ abhavan asya viśve satrā madāsaḥ bṛhataḥ madiṣṭhāḥ
translated: All the Soma juices have been his, all the gladdening draughts of the great one, most gladdening

original: satrābhavo vasupatir vasūnāṃ datre viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ
analyzed: satrā bhavaḥ vasu patiḥ vasūnām datre viśvāḥ adhithāḥ indra kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Ever the lord of wealth, of treasures, to the giver, O Indra, all the peoples

original: tvam adha prathamaṃ jāyamāno 'me viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ
analyzed: tvam adha prathamam jāyamānaḥ me viśvāḥ adhithāḥ indra kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Thou, first of all, O Indra, being born, didst extend all the peoples

original: tvam prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ
analyzed: tvam prati pravataḥ āśayānam ahim vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ
translated: Thou, O bountiful one, with thy thunderbolt, didst cleave the dragon lying across the path

original: satrāhaṇaṃ dādhṛṣiṃ tumram indram mahām apāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suvajram
analyzed: satrāhaṇam dādhṛṣim tumram indram mahām apāram vṛṣabham su vajram
translated: The ever-victorious, daring, mighty Indra, the great one, the boundless, the bull, the good thunderbolt

original: hantā yo vṛtraṃ sanitota vājaṃ dātā maghāni maghavā surādhāḥ
analyzed: hantā yaḥ vṛtram sanitā uta vājam dātā maghāni maghavā su rādhāḥ
translated: He who slays Vrtra and wins strength, the bountiful one, the giver of great gifts, the bestower of good gifts

original: ayaṃ vṛtaś cātayate samīcīr ya ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇva ekaḥ
analyzed: ayam vṛtaḥ cātayate samīcīḥ yaḥ ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇve ekaḥ
translated: This one, the bountiful one, the sole hearer, drives away the assembled (foes) in the battles

original: ayaṃ vājam bharati yaṃ sanoty asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma
analyzed: ayam vājam bharati yam sanoti asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma
translated: This one bears the strength which he wins; may we be dear to him and to his friends in his friendship

original: ayaṃ śṛṇve adha jayann uta ghnann ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā gāḥ
analyzed: ayam śṛṇve adha jayan uta ghnan ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā gāḥ
translated: I hear him, conquering and slaying, and he also wins cattle by fighting.

original: yadā satyaṃ kṛṇute manyum indro viśvaṃ dṛḷham bhayata ejad asmāt
analyzed: yadā satyam kṛṇute manyum indraḥ viśvam dṛḍham bhayate ejat asmāt
translated: When Indra makes his mind firm in truth, all that is firm in the world trembles from him.

original: sam indro gā ajayat saṃ hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yo ha pūrvīḥ
analyzed: sam indraḥ gāḥ ajayat sam hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yaḥ ha pūrvīḥ
translated: Indra has won the cows, the gold, and the horses, the bountiful one who has many.

original: ebhir nṛbhir nṛtamo asya śākai rāyo vibhaktā sambharaś ca vasvaḥ
analyzed: ebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ nṛtamaḥ asya śākaiḥ rāyaḥ vibhaktā sambharaḥ ca vasvaḥ
translated: With these men, the best of men, he distributes wealth and treasure.

original: kiyat svid indro adhy eti mātuḥ kiyat pitur janitur yo jajāna
analyzed: kiyat svid indraḥ adhi eti mātuḥ kiyat pituḥ janituḥ yaḥ jajāna
translated: How far does Indra go to his mother? How far to his father, the one who gave birth to him?

original: yo asya śuṣmam muhukair iyarti vāto na jūta stanayadbhir abhraiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ asya śuṣmam muhukais iyarti vātaḥ na jūta stanayadbhiḥ abhraiḥ
translated: He who hurls his strength with his swift-moving jaws, like a wind driven by thundering clouds.

original: kṣiyantaṃ tvam akṣiyantaṃ kṛṇotīyarti reṇum maghavā samoham
analyzed: kṣiyantam tvam a kṣiyantam kṛṇoti iyarti reṇum maghavā sa moham
translated: You make the one who is to be destroyed not to be destroyed. The bountiful one moves the dust that is to be moved.

original: vibhañjanur aśanimāṃ iva dyaur uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt
analyzed: vibhañjanuḥ aśanimān iva dyauḥ uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt
translated: The one who destroys, like the sky that wields lightning, may Maghavan place the one who praises in prosperity.

original: ayaṃ cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ny etaśaṃ rīramat sasṛmāṇam
analyzed: ayam cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ni etaśam rīramat sasṛmāṇam
translated: This wheel of the sun has been set in motion. The swift-moving Etaṣa has been set in motion.

original: ā kṛṣṇa īṃ juhurāṇo jigharti tvaco budhne rajaso asya yonau
analyzed: ā kṛṣṇaḥ īm juhurāṇaḥ jigharti tvacaḥ budhne rajasaḥ asya yonau
translated: The dark one, hissing, licks the edge of his skin, in the womb of this wind and the realm of space.

original: asiknyāṃ yajamāno na hotā
analyzed: asiknyām yajamānaḥ na hotā
translated: The sacrificer is not the priest on the Asīknyā.

original: gavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyanto vṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ🔽janīyanto janidām akṣitotim ā cyāvayāmo 'vate na kośam
analyzed: gavyantaḥ indram sakhyāya viprāḥ aśvāyantaḥ vṛṣaṇam vājayantaḥ  janīyantaḥ jani dām a kṣita ūtim ā cyāvayāmaḥ vate na kośam
translated: The singers, longing for the cow, the priests, longing for the horse, the strong one, longing for strength,🔽Longing for the young wife, the giver of offspring, the imperishable, we urge him on like a well for help.

original: trātā no bodhi dadṛśāna āpir abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām
analyzed: trātā naḥ bodhi dadṛśānaḥ āpiḥ abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām
translated: Be our protector, be thou seen, be thou our guardian, be thou the gladdener of those who offer Soma.

original: sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṇāṃ kartem ulokam uśate vayodhāḥ
analyzed: sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṇām kartā īm ulokam uśate vayodhāḥ
translated: Be thou the friend, the father, the best of fathers, the creator of the world, the supporter of life for the eager one.

original: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā gṛṇāna indra stuvate vayo dhāḥ
analyzed: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā gṛṇānaḥ indra stuvate vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Be thou the helper, the friend, of those who are friendly, be thou the supporter of life, O Indra, to the singer and praiser.

original: vayaṃ hy ā te cakṛmā sabādha ābhiḥ śamībhir mahayanta indra
analyzed: vayam hi ā te cakṛma sabādhaḥ ābhiḥ śamībhiḥ mahayantaḥ indra
translated: For we have made thee, O Indra, the sole lord of all these gifts, exalting thee with these oblations.

original: stuta indro maghavā yad dha vṛtrā bhūrīṇy eko apratīni hanti
analyzed: stutaḥ indraḥ maghavā yat ha vṛtrā bhūrīṇi ekaḥ apratīni hanti
translated: When Indra, the wealthy one, the praised one, slays many unresisted Vr̥itras, alone,

original: asya priyo jaritā yasya śarman nakir devā vārayante na martāḥ
analyzed: asya priyaḥ jaritā yasya śarman nakir devāḥ vārayante na martāḥ
translated: The dear praiser of him whose protection the gods and men cannot ward off,

original: evā na indro maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇīdhṛd anarvā
analyzed: eva naḥ indraḥ maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇī dhṛt anarvā
translated: Even such may Indra, the wealthy one, the bountiful one, the true supporter of men, the unassailable one, make us.

original: tvaṃ rājā januṣāṃ dhehy asme adhi śravo māhinaṃ yaj jaritre
analyzed: tvam rājā januṣām dhehi asme adhi śravaḥ māhinam yat jaritre
translated: Thou, O king, beget in us the great glory which is to be given to the singer.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, praised and lauded, do thou grant food to the singer, as the rivers give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: I have performed for thee, O Lord of Bay Steeds, new worship: may we be thy charioteers for ever.

original: ayam panthā anuvittaḥ purāṇo yato devā udajāyanta viśve
analyzed: ayam panthāḥ anuvittaḥ purāṇaḥ yatas devāḥ udajāyanta viśve
translated: This is the ancient path that hath been trodden, by which all Gods were born.

original: ataś cid ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddho mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ
analyzed: atas cit ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddhaḥ mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ
translated: From thence let him be born who shall be mighty: let no one tread on his mother with his foot.

original: nāham ato nir ayā durgahaitat tiraścatā pārśvān nir gamāṇi
analyzed: na aham atas niḥ ayā durgahā etat tiraścatā pārśvāt niḥ gamāni
translated: I will not go forth from hence, for hard to pass is this: I will go forth from the sides, from the cross-ways.

original: bahūni me akṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena saṃ tvena pṛchai
analyzed: bahūni me a kṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena sam tvena pṛcchai
translated: Many are the things to be done for me: I will fight with this one, I will question with that one.

original: parāyatīm mātaram anv acaṣṭa na nānu gāny anu nū gamāni
analyzed: parāyatīm mātaram anu acaṣṭa na nā anu gāni anu nu gamāni
translated: He hath looked after the mother who is departing: I will not go after her, nor will I go after any other.

original: tvaṣṭur gṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śatadhanyaṃ camvoḥ sutasya
analyzed: tvaṣṭuḥ gṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śata dhanyam camvoḥ sutasya
translated: In Tvashtar's house Indra drank the Soma, the hundred-worth draught of the pressed (juice) in the bowls.

original: kiṃ sa ṛdhak kṛṇavad yaṃ sahasram māso jabhāra śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ
analyzed: kim saḥ ṛdhak kṛṇavat yam sahasram māsaḥ jabhāra śaradaḥ ca pūrvīḥ
translated: What hath he done to be successful, whom a thousand and many autumns have nourished?

original: nahī nv asya pratimānam asty antar jāteṣūta ye janitvāḥ
analyzed: nahi nu asya pratimānam asti antar jāteṣu uta ye janitvāḥ
translated: For he hath no measure, he is greater than the generations that have been born and those that are to be.

original: avadyam iva manyamānā guhākar indram mātā vīryeṇā nyṝṣṭam
analyzed: avadyam iva manyamānā guhā akaḥ indram mātā vīryeṇa ā ni ṝṣṭam
translated: As if it were a crime, his mother hath hidden Indra, who was born with might.

original: athod asthāt svayam atkaṃ vasāna ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ
analyzed: atha ud asthāt svayam atkam vasānaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāt jāyamānaḥ
translated: Then he arose, clothed in a robe, and filled the two world-halves as he was born.

original: etā arṣanty alalābhavantīr ṛtāvarīr iva saṃkrośamānāḥ
analyzed: etāḥ arṣanti alalābhavantīḥ ṛtāvarīḥ iva saṃkrośamānāḥ
translated: These flow on, becoming more and more lovely, crying aloud like the truthful ones.

original: etā vi pṛcha kim idam bhananti kam āpo adrim paridhiṃ rujanti
analyzed: etāḥ vi pṛccha kim idam bhananti kam āpaḥ adrim paridhim rujanti
translated: Ask them, what is this that they are saying? What rock do the waters lay hold of as a boundary?

original: kim u ṣvid asmai nivido bhanantendrasyāvadyaṃ didhiṣanta āpaḥ
analyzed: kim u svid asmai nividaḥ bhananta indrasya avadyam didhiṣante āpaḥ
translated: What, indeed, do they break for him, the barriers? The waters seek to find the blemish of Indra.

original: mamaitān putro mahatā vadhena vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn
analyzed: mama etān putraḥ mahatā vadhena vṛtram jaghanvān asṛjat vi sindhūn
translated: My son, with mighty slaughter, having slain Vritra, let loose the rivers.

original: mamac cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamac cana tvā kuṣavā jagāra
analyzed: mamat cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamat cana tvā kuṣavā jagāra
translated: The young woman hath passed thee by, the wasting disease hath seized upon thee.

original: mamac cid āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyur mamac cid indraḥ sahasod atiṣṭhat
analyzed: mamat cit āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyuḥ mamat cit indraḥ sahasā ud atiṣṭhat
translated: The waters have not been kind to the infant, Indra hath not stood up in his strength.

original: mamac cana te maghavan vyaṃso nivividhvāṃ apa hanū jaghāna
analyzed: mamat cana te maghavan vyaṃsaḥ nivividhvām apa hanū jaghāna
translated: The boar, O Maghavan, hath pierced thy temples, and struck off thy jaws.

original: adhā nividdha uttaro babhūvāñ chiro dāsasya sam piṇak vadhena
analyzed: adhā nividdhaḥ uttaraḥ babhūvām śiraḥ dāsasya sam piṇak vadhena
translated: Then the upper one was pierced, and became the head of the slave, which he crushed with his weapon.

original: gṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviraṃ tavāgām anādhṛṣyaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tumram indram
analyzed: gṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviram tavāgām anādhṛṣyam vṛṣabham tumram indram
translated: The cow hath calved the strong one, I have come to thee, the unassailable, the mighty, the red, Indra.

original: arīḷhaṃ vatsaṃ carathāya mātā svayaṃ gātuṃ tanva ichamānam
analyzed: a rīḍham vatsam carathāya mātā svayam gātum tanve ichamānam
translated: The mother hath let loose the calf to wander, seeking of itself the way for its body.

original: uta mātā mahiṣam anv avenad amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ
analyzed: uta mātā mahiṣam anu avenat amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ
translated: The mother hath followed the buffalo, the gods, O son, have forsaken thee.

original: athābravīd vṛtram indro haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva
analyzed: athā bravīt vṛtram indraḥ haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaram vi kramasva
translated: Then Indra, about to slay Vritra, said: 'Friend Vishnu, step widely, step out.'

original: kas te mātaraṃ vidhavām acakrac chayuṃ kas tvām ajighāṃsac carantam
analyzed: kaḥ te mātaram vidhavām acakrat śayum kaḥ tvām ajighāṃsat carantam
translated: Who made your mother a widow? Who struck down your friend? Who tried to kill you as you wandered?

original: kas te devo adhi mārḍīka āsīd yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādagṛhya
analyzed: kaḥ te devaḥ adhi mārḍīke āsīt yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādagṛhya
translated: What god was kind to you when you dragged your father by the foot and threw him out?

original: avartyā śuna āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram
analyzed: avartyā śunaḥ āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram
translated: I cooked the entrails of the dog that was turned back; I found no comforter among the gods.

original: apaśyaṃ jāyām amahīyamānām adhā me śyeno madhv ā jabhāra
analyzed: apaśyam jāyām a mahīyamānām adhā me śyenaḥ madhu ā jabhāra
translated: I saw my wife being treated with contempt; then the falcon brought me honey.

original: evā tvām indra vajrinn atra viśve devāsaḥ suhavāsa ūmāḥ
analyzed: eva tvām indra vajrin atra viśve devāsaḥ su havāsaḥ ūmāḥ
translated: Thus, O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, here may all the gods, the most delightful, the most gracious,

original: mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvaṃ nir ekam id vṛṇate vṛtrahatye
analyzed: mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvam niḥ ekam id vṛṇate vṛtra hatye
translated: The two great lofty worlds, the one who is mighty, choose him alone for the slaying of Vrtra.

original: avāsṛjanta jivrayo na devā bhuvaḥ samrāḷ indra satyayoniḥ
analyzed: avāsṛjanta jivrayaḥ na devāḥ bhuvaḥ samrāj indra satya yoniḥ
translated: The gods have let loose the wounds; on earth, O Indra, you are the true-born emperor.

original: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīr arado viśvadhenāḥ
analyzed: ahan ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīḥ aradaḥ viśvadhenāḥ
translated: You have slain the serpent that lay around the waters; you have opened the paths for all to travel.

original: atṛpṇuvantaṃ viyatam abudhyam abudhyamānaṃ suṣupāṇam indra
analyzed: a tṛpṇuvantam viyatam a budhyam a budhyamānam suṣupāṇam indra
translated: You have awakened the insatiable, the extended, the unknowing, the sleeping one, O Indra.

original: sapta prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa vi riṇā aparvan
analyzed: sapta prati pravataḥ āśayānam ahim vajreṇa vi riṇāḥ aparvan
translated: You have split the seven-headed serpent with your thunderbolt, even though it was without joints.

original: akṣodayac chavasā kṣāma budhnaṃ vār ṇa vātas taviṣībhir indraḥ
analyzed: akṣodayat śavasā kṣāma budhnam vār na vātaḥ taviṣībhiḥ indraḥ
translated: With his might he has stirred the surface of the earth; the wind with his powers, O Indra.

original: dṛḷhāny aubhnād uśamāna ojo 'vābhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām
analyzed: dṛḍhāni aubhnāt uśamānaḥ ojaḥ vā abhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām
translated: He has strengthened the firm (mountains), the joyous one the power, he has broken the peaks of the mountains.

original: abhi pra dadrur janayo na garbhaṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ
analyzed: abhi pra dadruḥ janayaḥ na garbham rathāḥ iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ
translated: They have rushed forth to the womb, as it were, the people, the stones have gone forth together like chariots.

original: atarpayo visṛta ubja ūrmīn tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn
analyzed: atarpayaḥ visṛte ubje ūrmīn tvam vṛtām ariṇāḥ indra sindhūn
translated: Thou hast satisfied the spreading waves, the enclosed rivers, O Indra, thou hast let them loose.

original: tvam mahīm avaniṃ viśvadhenāṃ turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm
analyzed: tvam mahīm avanim viśvadhenām turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm
translated: Thou hast caused to flow for Turvīti Vyaśva the great earth, the foundation, the all-supporting,

original: aramayo namasaijad arṇaḥ sutaraṇāṃ akṛṇor indra sindhūn
analyzed: aramayaḥ namasā ejat arṇaḥ su taraṇām akṛṇoḥ indra sindhūn
translated: Thou hast made the waters easy to cross, O Indra, the waters that were to be worshipped with reverence.

original: prāgruvo nabhanvo na vakvā dhvasrā apinvad yuvatīr ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: prāgruvaḥ nabhanvaḥ na vakvāḥ dhvasrāḥ apinvat yuvatīḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: The swift ones have filled the deep, the cloud-like ones, the young ones who know the truth, the forward-moving ones.

original: dhanvāny ajrāṃ apṛṇak tṛṣāṇāṃ adhog indra staryo daṃsupatnīḥ
analyzed: dhanvāni ajrām apṛṇak tṛṣāṇām adhok indra staryaḥ daṃsu patnīḥ
translated: Thou hast filled the dry waterless plains of the thirsty ones, O Indra, the cows who have young calves, from below.

original: pūrvīr uṣasaḥ śaradaś ca gūrtā vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn
analyzed: pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ śaradaḥ ca gūrtāḥ vṛtram jaghanvān asṛjat vi sindhūn
translated: Many dawns and autumns have passed by, he who has slain Vrtra has let loose the rivers.

original: pariṣṭhitā atṛṇad badbadhānāḥ sīrā indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā🔽vamrībhiḥ putram agruvo adānaṃ niveśanād dhariva ā jabhartha
analyzed: pariṣṭhitāḥ atṛṇat badbadhānāḥ sīrāḥ indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā  vamrībhiḥ putram agruvaḥ adānam niveśanāt harivas ā jabhartha
translated: He has burst asunder the enclosed (waters), the dams, the channels, O Indra, for the earth to flow over.🔽With the female bees he has brought the son of the cloud, the giver, from his abode, the swift one.

original: vy andho akhyad ahim ādadāno nir bhūd ukhachit sam aranta parva
analyzed: vi andhaḥ akhyat ahim ādadānaḥ niḥ bhūt ukha chid sam aranta parva
translated: The blind one has called out, seizing the serpent; the one with the hollow back has come forth, the joints have moved.

original: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni viprāvidvāṃ āha viduṣe karāṃsi
analyzed: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vipra avidvān āha viduṣe karāṃsi
translated: The learned Brāhman has told the ignorant your former deeds,

original: yathāyathā vṛṣṇyāni svagūrtāpāṃsi rājan naryāviveṣīḥ
analyzed: yathā yathā vṛṣṇyāni sva gūrta apāṃsi rājan
translated: As, O King, you have entered into the manly deeds of the strong, well-directed ones.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, praised and sung, do thou grant food to the singer, as the rivers give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: I have performed for thee, O thou who hast bay steeds, this new prayer; may we be, by our thought, ever victorious charioteers.

original: ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ugraḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ indraḥ dūrāt ā naḥ āsāt abhiṣṭi kṛt avase yāsat ugraḥ
translated: May Indra come to us from afar, may he come near to help us, the terrible one to give assistance.

original: ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn
analyzed: ojiṣṭhebhiḥ nṛpatiḥ vajra bāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn
translated: With his mightiest, the Lord of men, with arms of thunder, in the battles of the contest, the conqueror of foes.

original: ā na indro haribhir yātv achārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca
analyzed: ā naḥ indraḥ haribhiḥ yātu achā arvācīnaḥ vase rādhase ca
translated: May Indra come to us with his bay steeds, from the near or the far, to help and to give gifts.

original: tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṃ yajñam anu no vājasātau
analyzed: tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśī imam yajñam anu naḥ vājasātau
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, the bountiful one, the mighty one, may he stand by this our sacrifice in the winning of booty.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ tvam asmākam indra puro dadhat saniṣyasi kratuṃ naḥ
analyzed: imam yajñam tvam asmākam indra puras dadhat saniṣyasi kratum naḥ
translated: O Indra, thou who presidest over this our sacrifice, thou shalt grant us strength and wisdom.

original: śvaghnīva vajrin sanaye dhanānāṃ tvayā vayam arya ājiṃ jayema
analyzed: śvaghnī iva vajrin sanaye dhanānām tvayā vayam aryaḥ ājim jayema
translated: Like a swift mare, O thou who hast the thunderbolt, for the winning of treasures, through thee may we, O noble one, win the prize.

original: uśann u ṣu ṇaḥ sumanā upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvaḥ
analyzed: uśan u su naḥ sumanāḥ upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvas
translated: Favourably inclined, well-disposed, near us, O thou of true nature, of the well-pressed Soma,

original: pā indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena
analyzed: pāḥ indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena
translated: Drink, O Indra, of the offered sweet drink, rejoice with my mead that goes on the back.

original: vi yo rarapśa ṛṣibhir navebhir vṛkṣo na pakvaḥ sṛṇyo na jetā
analyzed: vi yaḥ rarapśe ṛṣibhiḥ navebhiḥ vṛkṣaḥ na pakvaḥ sṛṇyaḥ na jetā
translated: He who is praised by the new sages, like a ripe tree, like a strong bow that cannot be bent,

original: maryo na yoṣām abhi manyamāno 'chā vivakmi puruhūtam indram
analyzed: maryaḥ na yoṣām abhi manyamānaḥ chā vivakmi puruhūtam indram
translated: Like a young man who thinks of a woman, I go forth to meet the much-invoked Indra.

original: girir na yaḥ svatavām ṛṣva indraḥ sanād eva sahase jāta ugraḥ
analyzed: giriḥ na yaḥ svatavām ṛṣvaḥ indraḥ sanāt eva sahase jātaḥ ugraḥ
translated: He who is like a lofty mountain, self-powerful, Indra, from birth itself is strong for conquest,

original: ādartā vajraṃ sthaviraṃ na bhīma udneva kośaṃ vasunā nyṝṣṭam
analyzed: ādartā vajram sthaviram na bhīmaḥ udnā iva kośam vasunā
translated: Firm like a terrible thunderbolt, filled with wealth like a well-filled quiver.

original: na yasya vartā januṣā nv asti na rādhasa āmarītā maghasya🔽udvāvṛṣāṇas taviṣīva ugrāsmabhyaṃ daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ
analyzed: na yasya vartā januṣā nu asti na rādhasaḥ āmarītā maghasya  udvāvṛṣāṇaḥ taviṣīvas ugra asmabhyam daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ
translated: He who by birth has no rival, whose bounty has no end,🔽Pouring forth like a mighty one, O much-invoked Indra, grant us wealth.🔽I behold the abode of wealth of the people, and the fold of cattle you turn back.

original: īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi gonām🔽śikṣānaraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvo rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim
analyzed: īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi gonām  śikṣā naraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvaḥ rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim
translated: You lead the man who is skilled in battles to abundant riches, to a great heap of treasures.

original: kayā tac chṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭho yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cid ṛṣvaḥ
analyzed: kayā tat śṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭhaḥ yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cit ṛṣvaḥ
translated: By what, most powerful one, do you hear that by which you make many tremble again and again, O lofty one?

original: puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭho aṃho 'thā dadhāti draviṇaṃ jaritre
analyzed: puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭhaḥ aṃhaḥ thā dadhāti draviṇam jaritre
translated: You remove the greatest danger for the generous worshipper, and then bestow wealth on the singer.

original: mā no mardhīr ā bharā daddhi tan naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te
analyzed: mā naḥ mardhīḥ ā bhara ā daddhi tat naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te
translated: Do not be angry with us, bring that to us, give to the generous worshipper much to give.

original: navye deṣṇe śaste asmin ta ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ
analyzed: navye deṣṇe śaste asmin te ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ
translated: In this new gift, in this hymn that is praised, we will proclaim it, O Indra, while praising you.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, Indra, praised and sung, grant food to the singer, as the rivers give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: O you who possess tawny steeds, we have made this new prayer to you; may we be charioteers in every age.

original: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ vase upa naḥ iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ
translated: May Indra come to us for help, praised here, may the hero be in the assembly for our good.

original: vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ taviṣīḥ yasya pūrvīḥ dyauḥ na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt
translated: May his great powers, which have grown great, be honored like the sky, his lordship like the sun.

original: tasyed iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvidyumnasya tuvirādhaso nṝn
analyzed: tasya id iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvi dyumnasya tuvi rādhasaḥ nṝn
translated: Here praise his manly powers, O men, of him whose splendor is great, whose bounty is great.

original: yasya kratur vidathyo na samrāṭ sāhvān tarutro abhy asti kṛṣṭīḥ
analyzed: yasya kratuḥ vidathyaḥ na samrāj sāhvān tarutraḥ abhī asti kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Whose will is like a universal monarch in the sacrificial sessions, the victorious one approaches the peoples.

original: ā yātv indro diva ā pṛthivyā makṣū samudrād uta vā purīṣāt
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ makṣū samudrāt uta vā purīṣāt
translated: May Indra come to us from the sky, from the earth, or quickly from the ocean or from the dust.

original: svarṇarād avase no marutvān parāvato vā sadanād ṛtasya
analyzed: svarṇarāt avase naḥ marutvān parāvataḥ vā sadanāt ṛtasya
translated: From the golden one for our help, accompanied by the Maruts, from the distant abode of truth.

original: sthūrasya rāyo bṛhato ya īśe tam u ṣṭavāma vidatheṣv indram
analyzed: sthūrasya rāyaḥ bṛhataḥ yaḥ īśe tam u stavāma vidatheṣu indram
translated: We will praise him, Indra, in assemblies, who rules over great and abundant wealth.

original: yo vāyunā jayati gomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyo acha
analyzed: yaḥ vāyunā jayati gomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyaḥ acha
translated: He who conquers with the wind in the cow-rich (regions), leads with daring to better things.

original: upa yo namo namasi stabhāyann iyarti vācaṃ janayan yajadhyai🔽ṛñjasānaḥ puruvāra ukthair endraṃ kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā
analyzed: upa yaḥ namaḥ namasi stabhāyan iyarti vācam janayan yajadhyai  ṛñjasānaḥ puru vāraḥ ukthaiḥ ā indram kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā
translated: He who, supporting himself with homage in homage, moves his voice forward, begetting it, to worship🔽The eager one, the one with many boons, the priest should make Indra with praises in the assembly

original: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadanto adrim auśijasya gohe
analyzed: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadantaḥ adrim auśijasya gohe
translated: If, being thought of by those who think, sitting, pressing the stone for Auśija's sake

original: ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yo no mahān saṃvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ
analyzed: ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yaḥ naḥ mahān saṃvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ
translated: The one hard to anger, the priest of Pāṣtya, who is our great bearer in the enclosures

original: satrā yad īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣma stuvate bharāya
analyzed: satrā yat īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣma stuvate bharāya
translated: When, for the sake of the strong one, the Bharvara, his strength flows to the praiser for support

original: guhā yad īm auśijasya gohe pra yad dhiye prāyase madāya
analyzed: guhā yat īm auśijasya gohe pra yat dhiye prāyase madāya
translated: When, in the secret place, in the cowpen of Auśija, he is urged forward for the sake of joy

original: vi yad varāṃsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhir jinve apāṃ javāṃsi
analyzed: vi yat varāṃsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhiḥ jinve apām javāṃsi
translated: When I choose the best parts of the mountain, I quicken the swiftnesses of the waters with the juices

original: vidad gaurasya gavayasya gohe yadī vājāya sudhyo vahanti
analyzed: vidat gaurasya gavayasya gohe yadī vājāya sudhyaḥ vahanti
translated: He finds the cow of the wild ox in the cowpen of the bull, when they carry for the sake of strength

original: bhadrā te hastā sukṛtota pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādha indra
analyzed: bhadrā te hastā su kṛtā uta pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādhaḥ indra
translated: Your hands are auspicious, your arms are well-formed, the extenders, O Indra, to the praiser's gift

original: kā te niṣattiḥ kim u no mamatsi kiṃ nodud u harṣase dātavā u
analyzed: kā te niṣattiḥ kim u na u mamatsi kim na ud ud u harṣase dātavai u
translated: What is your obstruction? What do you envy us? Why do you not rejoice to give us wealth?

original: evā vasva indraḥ satyaḥ samrāḍ ḍhantā vṛtraṃ varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ
analyzed: eva vasvaḥ indraḥ satyaḥ samrāj ḍhantā vṛtram varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ
translated: Thus Indra is the true lord of wealth, the punisher of Vṛtra, the bestower of room for Pūru.

original: puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śagdhi rāyo bhakṣīya te 'vaso daivyasya
analyzed: puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śagdhi rāyaḥ bhakṣīya te vaso daivyasya
translated: O much-praised one, be pleased with us through your power, may we enjoy the bounty of your godhead.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, when praised and when sung, do thou grant food to the singer, as the rivers grant water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: O thou whose wealth is horses, I have made this new prayer to thee; may we be thy charioteers, O bountiful one, for ever.

original: yan na indro jujuṣe yac ca vaṣṭi tan no mahān karati śuṣmy ā cit
analyzed: yat naḥ indraḥ jujuṣe yat ca vaṣṭi tat naḥ mahān karati śuṣmī ā cit
translated: Whatever thou, O Indra, acceptest and approvest, that the great one makes for us, even though we are weak.

original: brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yo aśmānaṃ śavasā bibhrad eti
analyzed: brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yaḥ aśmānam śavasā bibhrat eti
translated: Maghavan, with prayer, with praise, with Soma, with hymns, he who goes forth bearing the stone with his strength,

original: vṛṣā vṛṣandhiṃ caturaśrim asyann ugro bāhubhyāṃ nṛtamaḥ śacīvān
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣandhim catur aśrim asyan ugraḥ bāhubhyām nṛtamaḥ śacīvān
translated: the bull, drawing the four-cornered bow, the strong one, the most manly, the mighty, with his arms,

original: śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇa ūrṇāṃ yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye
analyzed: śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇaḥ ūrṇām yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye
translated: the one who shines on the Parushni for glory, for whom the joints are extended for friendship,

original: yo devo devatamo jāyamāno maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ devaḥ devatamaḥ jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ vājebhiḥ mahadbhiḥ ca śuṣmaiḥ
translated: the god, the most divine, who is born with great strength and great powers in the great contest,

original: dadhāno vajram bāhvor uśantaṃ dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma
analyzed: dadhānaḥ vajram bāhvoḥ uśantam dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma
translated: bearing the eager thunderbolt in his arms, he has made the sky tremble with his might, and the earth.

original: viśvā rodhāṃsi pravataś ca pūrvīr dyaur ṛṣvāj janiman rejata kṣāḥ
analyzed: viśvā rodhāṃsi pravataḥ ca pūrvīḥ dyauḥ ṛṣvāt janiman rejata kṣāḥ
translated: All the barriers and the many ancient ways, the regions trembled at the birth of the lofty Dyaus.

original: ā mātarā bharati śuṣmy ā gor nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ
analyzed: ā mātarā bharati śuṣmī ā goḥ nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ
translated: The strong one bears the cow for glory, the winds, O wanderer, follow him as a man.

original: tā tū ta indra mahato mahāni viśveṣv it savaneṣu pravācyā
analyzed: tā tu te indra mahataḥ mahāni viśveṣu id savaneṣu pravācyā
translated: These, O Indra, are your great deeds, to be proclaimed at all libations,

original: yac chūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahiṃ vajreṇa śavasāviveṣīḥ🔽tā tū te satyā tuvinṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇa ūdhnaḥ
analyzed: yat śūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahim vajreṇa śavasā aviveṣīḥ  tā tū te satyā tuvi nṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇaḥ ūdhnaḥ
translated: When, O hero, O bold one, with bold courage, you with your strength and thunderbolt penetrated Ahi.🔽These, O mighty one, are your true deeds, O powerful one, all the milch-cows flow forth from your swelling udder.

original: adhā ha tvad vṛṣamaṇo bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavo javasā cakramanta
analyzed: adhā ha tvat vṛṣamaṇaḥ bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavaḥ javasā cakramanta
translated: Then indeed, through fear of your manly power, the rivers, trembling, flowed swiftly with their current.

original: atrāha te harivas tā u devīr avobhir indra stavanta svasāraḥ
analyzed: atra aha te harivas tāḥ u devīḥ avobhiḥ indra stavanta svasāraḥ
translated: Here, O possessor of tawny steeds, those divine sisters, O Indra, praise you with their voices,

original: yat sīm anu pra muco badbadhānā dīrghām anu prasitiṃ syandayadhyai
analyzed: yat sīm anu pra mucaḥ badbadhānāḥ dīrghām anu prasitim syanda yadhyai
translated: When, following your lead, they let loose the bonds, they flow along the long course to be shed.

original: pipīḷe aṃśur madyo na sindhur ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ
analyzed: pipīḍe aṃśuḥ madyaḥ na sindhuḥ ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ
translated: The stalk is pressed like a river of sweet drink; the prayer of the one who strives is your support, O Shami.

original: asmadryak chuśucānasya yamyā āśur na raśmiṃ tuvyojasaṃ goḥ🔽asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṃsi
analyzed: asmadryak śuśucānasya yamyāḥ āśuḥ na raśmim tuvi ojasam goḥ  asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṃsi
translated: Of the two who shine forth towards us, O Yama, like the swift rein of a horse, of the cow with abundant milk.🔽Make us the most prosperous, the most powerful, the most manly deeds, always, O hero, the most victorious.

original: asmabhyaṃ vṛtrā suhanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasya
analyzed: asmabhyam vṛtrā su hanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣaḥ martyasya
translated: Make easy for us the winning of treasures; destroy the weapon of the mortal who injures us.

original: asmākam it su śṛṇuhi tvam indrāsmabhyaṃ citrāṃ upa māhi vājān
analyzed: asmākam id su śṛṇuhi tvam indra asmabhyam citrān upa māhi vājān
translated: Listen to us, O Indra, here; bring us variegated treasures, O Indra.

original: asmabhyaṃ viśvā iṣaṇaḥ puraṃdhīr asmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi godāḥ
analyzed: asmabhyam viśvāḥ iṣaṇaḥ puraṃdhīḥ asmākam su maghavan bodhi go dāḥ
translated: Grant us all kinds of food, O you who give all desired things, O Maghavan, be you the giver of cattle to us.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, when praised and when sung, do thou grant food to the singer, as the rivers grant water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: O thou who hast bay steeds, I have performed this new prayer for thee: may we be ever victorious, O Indra, as thy charioteers.

original: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur yajñaṃ juṣāṇo abhi somam ūdhaḥ
analyzed: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotuḥ yajñam juṣāṇaḥ abhi somam ūdhaḥ
translated: How did he grow great? Of what Hotar did he approve, when he accepted the sacrifice and the Soma-juice?

original: pibann uśāno juṣamāṇo andho vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya🔽ko asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ ko asya
analyzed: piban uśānaḥ juṣamāṇaḥ andhaḥ vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya  kaḥ asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ kaḥ asya
translated: Drinking, rejoicing, accepting the juice, the lofty one has grown for the sake of purity and wealth.🔽What hero of his has attained the common feast? Who has shared the food with him through his good-will?

original: kad asya citraṃ cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvac chaśamānasya yajyoḥ
analyzed: kad asya citram cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvat śaśamānasya yajyoḥ
translated: Who has discovered his wonderful help? Who has become prosperous through the worship of the striving one?

original: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvann avasām asya veda🔽kā asya pūrvīr upamātayo ha kathainam āhuḥ papuriṃ jaritre
analyzed: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvan avasām asya veda  kāḥ asya pūrvīḥ upamātayaḥ ha kathā enam āhuḥ papurim jaritre
translated: How does Indra hear when he is called upon? How, hearing, does he know his worshipper's need?🔽What are his many ancient comparisons? How do they call him the fulfiller to the singer?

original: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamāno asya naśad abhi draviṇaṃ dīdhyānaḥ
analyzed: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamānaḥ asya naśat abhi draviṇam dīdhyānaḥ
translated: How may the striving one, meditating, obtain his wealth, when he is obstructed by his foe?

original: devo bhuvan navedā ma ṛtānāṃ namo jagṛbhvāṃ abhi yaj jujoṣat
analyzed: devaḥ bhuvat navedāḥ me ṛtānām namaḥ abhi yat jujoṣat
translated: The god has become the knower of the truths: he has grasped the homage which he approves.

original: kathā kad asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau devo martasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa
analyzed: kathā kad asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau devaḥ martasya sakhyam jujoṣa
translated: What is the story of this dawn when it rises? The god delights in friendship with the mortal.

original: kathā kad asya sakhyaṃ sakhibhyo ye asmin kāmaṃ suyujaṃ tatasre
analyzed: kathā kad asya sakhyam sakhibhyaḥ ye asmin kāmam su yujam tatasre
translated: What is the story of his friendship with his friends who have entrusted to him their desire for good union?

original: kim ād amatraṃ sakhyaṃ sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma
analyzed: kim āt amatram sakhyam sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma
translated: What is the measure of his friendship with his friends? When shall we proclaim your brotherhood?

original: śriye sudṛśo vapur asya sargāḥ svar ṇa citratamam iṣa ā goḥ
analyzed: śriye sudṛśaḥ vapuḥ asya sargāḥ svar na citratamam iṣaḥ ā goḥ
translated: The creations of this one, the well-seeing one, are for glory, his form is the most variegated of the wishes for food and the wishes for cattle.

original: druhaṃ jighāṃsan dhvarasam anindrāṃ tetikte tigmā tujase anīkā
analyzed: druham jighāṃsan dhvarasam an indrām tetikte tigmā tujase anīkā
translated: Desiring to kill the enemy, the one without Indra, he sharpened his sharp weapons against the one without light.

original: ṛṇā cid yatra ṛṇayā na ugro dūre ajñātā uṣaso babādhe
analyzed: ṛṇā cit yatra ṛṇayāḥ naḥ ugraḥ dūre ajñātāḥ uṣasaḥ babādhe
translated: Where the strong one, with the debt, with the debt, did not spare the distant unknown dawns.

original: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīr ṛtasya dhītir vṛjināni hanti
analyzed: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ ṛtasya dhītiḥ vṛjināni hanti
translated: For there are many swift ones of truth, the thought of truth destroys the wicked.

original: ṛtasya śloko badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamāna āyoḥ
analyzed: ṛtasya ślokaḥ badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamānaḥ āyoḥ
translated: The verse of truth pierced the deaf, the ears of the wise were purified by the light of the sun.

original: ṛtasya dṛḷhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṃṣi🔽ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣa ṛtena gāva ṛtam ā viveśuḥ
analyzed: ṛtasya dṛḍhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṃṣi  ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣaḥ ṛtena gāvaḥ ṛtam ā viveśuḥ
translated: There are many firm supports of truth, many beautiful forms for beauty.🔽By truth they extend the long food, by truth the cows have entered truth.

original: ṛtaṃ yemāna ṛtam id vanoty ṛtasya śuṣmas turayā u gavyuḥ
analyzed: ṛtam yemānaḥ ṛtam id vanoti ṛtasya śuṣmaḥ tura yāḥ u gavyuḥ
translated: Truth is to be honored, truth indeed brings gain, by the impulse of truth the swift one wins the cattle.

original: ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule gabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte
analyzed: ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule gabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte
translated: For truth, O Earth, wide, deep, for truth the two milch-kine yield milk in the highest heaven.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now praise him, O Indra, now sing forth: give food to the singer as the rivers give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: I have made this new prayer to thee, O Lord of Bay Steeds: may we be evermore thy charioteers with our thoughts.

original: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnaṃ rādhasa ā vavartat
analyzed: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnam rādhasaḥ ā vavartat
translated: What is the best praise for Indra, the Son of Strength, to turn him hitherward to the gift?

original: dadir hi vīro gṛṇate vasūni sa gopatir niṣṣidhāṃ no janāsaḥ
analyzed: dadiḥ hi vīraḥ gṛṇate vasūni sa go patiḥ niṣṣidhām naḥ janāsaḥ
translated: For the hero gives treasures to the singer: he, the Lord of the cattle, is our refuge from men.

original: sa vṛtrahatye havyaḥ sa īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭuta indraḥ satyarādhāḥ🔽sa yāmann ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivo dhāt🔽tam in naro vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām
analyzed: sa vṛtra hatye havyaḥ saḥ īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ indraḥ satya rādhāḥ  sa yāman ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivaḥ dhāt  tam id naraḥ vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsaḥ tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām
translated: He is to be invoked at the slaying of Vr̥itra, he is to be praised, Indra who gives true gifts.🔽On his way may the bountiful one grant room to the mortal who worships and to the good swain.🔽Him the men call to the conflict, trembling in their bodies, making him their refuge.

original: mitho yat tyāgam ubhayāso agman naras tokasya tanayasya sātau🔽kratūyanti kṣitayo yoga ugrāśuṣāṇāso mitho arṇasātau
analyzed: mithas yat tyāgam ubhayāsaḥ agman naraḥ tokasya tanayasya sātau  kratūyanti kṣitayaḥ yoge ugra āśuṣāṇāsaḥ mithas arṇa sātau
translated: When they have come together from their several homes, the men, for the sake of offspring and of sons.🔽The mighty powers of the warriors are sharpened, the greedy ones, in the conflict for the waters.

original: saṃ yad viśo 'vavṛtranta yudhmā ād in nema indrayante abhīke
analyzed: sam yat viśaḥ vavṛtranta yudhmāḥ āt id neme indrayante abhīke
translated: When the warlike tribes have gathered together, then in the battle they strive to win Indra.

original: ād id dha nema indriyaṃ yajanta ād it paktiḥ puroḷāśaṃ riricyāt🔽ād it somo vi papṛcyād asuṣvīn ād ij jujoṣa vṛṣabhaṃ yajadhyai
analyzed: āt id ha neme indriyam yajante āt id paktiḥ puroḷāśam riricyāt  āt id somaḥ vi papṛcyāt a suṣvīn āt id jujoṣa vṛṣabham yajadhyai
translated: The sacrifice is honoured for its power, the cake would be left behind,🔽Soma would be separated from the unpressed (juice), he would not delight in worshipping the bull.

original: kṛṇoty asmai varivo ya itthendrāya somam uśate sunoti
analyzed: kṛṇoti asmai varivaḥ yaḥ itthā indrāya somam uśate sunoti
translated: He who presses Soma for Indra, who delights in it, makes room for him.

original: sadhrīcīnena manasāvivenan tam it sakhāyaṃ kṛṇute samatsu
analyzed: sadhrīcīnena manasā a vivenan tam id sakhāyam kṛṇute samatsu
translated: With a mind directed towards him, he makes him a friend in battles.

original: ya indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīr uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīḥ uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ
translated: He who today presses Soma for Indra, cooks the rice-porridge, and roasts the barley-grains,

original: prati manāyor ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmam indraḥ
analyzed: prati manāyoḥ ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhat vṛṣaṇam śuṣmam indraḥ
translated: rejoicing in the two minds, in him Indra places strength and virility.

original: yadā samaryaṃ vy aced ṛghāvā dīrghaṃ yad ājim abhy akhyad aryaḥ
analyzed: yadā samaryam vi acet ṛghāvā dīrgham yat ājim abhī akhyat aryaḥ
translated: When the two powerful ones have decided the battle, when the enemy has approached the long-lasting contest,

original: acikradad vṛṣaṇam patny achā duroṇa ā niśitaṃ somasudbhiḥ🔽bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyo 'vikrīto akāniṣam punar yan
analyzed: acikradat vṛṣaṇam patnī achā duroṇe ā niśitam soma sudbhiḥ  bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyaḥ vikrītaḥ akāniṣam punar yan
translated: the wife has loudly called out to the powerful one, the Soma-pressers have sharpened the weapon in the house.🔽The greater has gone away with less, when I was not sold, I did not agree.

original: sa bhūyasā kanīyo nārirecīd dīnā dakṣā vi duhanti pra vāṇam
analyzed: sa bhūyasā kanīyaḥ nā arirecīt dīnāḥ dakṣāḥ vi duhanti pra vāṇam
translated: The greater has gone away with less, the poor dexterous ones milk the arrow.

original: ka imaṃ daśabhir mamendraṃ krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ
analyzed: kaḥ imam daśabhiḥ mama indram krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ
translated: Who will buy this Indra with ten milch cows?

original: yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad athainam me punar dadat
analyzed: yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanat atha enam me punar dadat
translated: When he has crushed the enemies, then will he give him back to me.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now praise, O Indra, now sing, as a river swells for the worshipper who lauds

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: You, O you who have bay steeds, I have made new prayer; may we be charioteers with our thoughts

original: ko adya naryo devakāma uśann indrasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa🔽ko vā mahe 'vase pāryāya samiddhe agnau sutasoma īṭṭe
analyzed: kaḥ adya naryaḥ deva kāmaḥ uśan indrasya sakhyam jujoṣa  kaḥ vā mahe vase pāryāya samiddhe agnau suta somaḥ īṭṭe
translated: What man today, longing, desirous of the gods, delights in Indra's friendship?🔽Or who, for great protection, for a ford, offers in the well-kindled fire, with Soma pressed?

original: ko nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyur vā bhavati vasta usrāḥ
analyzed: kaḥ nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyuḥ vā bhavati vaste usrāḥ
translated: For whom does he make the voice sweet, for whom does he become the life of the two dawns?

original: ka indrasya yujyaṃ kaḥ sakhitvaṃ ko bhrātraṃ vaṣṭi kavaye ka ūtī
analyzed: kaḥ indrasya yujyam kaḥ sakhi tvam kaḥ bhrātram vaṣṭi kavaye kaḥ ūtī
translated: Who seeks Indra's companionship, who his friendship, who his brotherhood, who his help?

original: ko devānām avo adyā vṛṇīte ka ādityāṃ aditiṃ jyotir īṭṭe
analyzed: kaḥ devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīte kaḥ ādityām aditim jyotiḥ īṭṭe
translated: Who today chooses the favor of the gods? Who offers to the Adityas, to Aditi, the light?

original: kasyāśvināv indro agniḥ sutasyāṃśoḥ pibanti manasāvivenam
analyzed: kasya aśvinau indraḥ agniḥ sutasya aṃśoḥ pibanti manasā a vivenam
translated: For whom do the Asvins, Indra, Agni drink the portion of the Soma of the pressed (juice), with their minds not turned away?

original: tasmā agnir bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsaj jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam
analyzed: tasmai agniḥ bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsat jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam
translated: To him may Agni, the protector, grant protection, may he long see the rising sun.

original: ya indrāya sunavāmety āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām
analyzed: yaḥ indrāya sunavāma iti āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām
translated: He who says, Let us press for Indra, to the man, the manly one, the most manly of men,

original: na taṃ jinanti bahavo na dabhrā urv asmā aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat
analyzed: na tam jinanti bahavaḥ na dabhrāḥ uru asmai aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat
translated: Him the many do not conquer, nor the deceitful ones. May Aditi grant him wide protection.

original: priyaḥ sukṛt priya indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ suprāvīḥ priyo asya somī
analyzed: priyaḥ su kṛt priyaḥ indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ su prāvīḥ priyaḥ asya somī
translated: Dear to Indra is the dear well-doer, dear is the dear well-sacrificer, dear is the dear Soma-drinker.

original: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāḷ eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktiṃ kṛṇute kevalendraḥ
analyzed: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāh eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktim kṛṇute kevala indraḥ
translated: This hero is well-praised, he eats the food of the well-praised; Indra alone makes the food of the well-praised.

original: nāsuṣver āpir na sakhā na jāmir duṣprāvyo 'vahanted avācaḥ
analyzed: na a suṣveḥ āpiḥ na sakhā na jāmiḥ duṣprāvyaḥ vahanta id avācaḥ
translated: The friend, the kinsman, the companion of the ill-praised does not carry him away, the ill-praised, the speechless.

original: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indro 'sunvatā sutapāḥ saṃ gṛṇīte
analyzed: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indraḥ sunvatā suta pāḥ sam gṛṇīte
translated: Indra does not praise with the bountiful one, the unpressed, the well-pressed with the unpressed.

original: āsya vedaḥ khidati hanti nagnaṃ vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalo bhūt
analyzed: ā asya vedaḥ khidati hanti nagnam vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalaḥ bhūt
translated: His knowledge is destroyed, he is killed naked; he alone becomes for the well-praised, for the food.

original: indram pare 'vare madhyamāsa indraṃ yānto 'vasitāsa indram
analyzed: indram pare vare madhyamāsaḥ indram yāntaḥ vasitāsaḥ indram
translated: The higher, the lower, the middle ones go to Indra, the ones who have come, the ones who are coming, go to Indra.

original: indraṃ kṣiyanta uta yudhyamānā indraṃ naro vājayanto havante
analyzed: indram kṣiyantaḥ uta yudhyamānāḥ indram naraḥ vājayantaḥ havante
translated: The ones who are living, the ones who are fighting, the men who are striving for strength call to Indra.

original: aham manur abhavaṃ sūryaś cāhaṃ kakṣīvām ṛṣir asmi vipraḥ
analyzed: aham manuḥ abhavam sūryaḥ ca aham kakṣīvān ṛṣiḥ asmi vipraḥ
translated: I was Manu, I was Surya, I am the sage Kakshivan, I am the wise one.

original: ahaṃ kutsam ārjuneyaṃ ny ṝñje 'haṃ kavir uśanā paśyatā mā
analyzed: aham kutsam ārjuneyam ni ṝñje ham kaviḥ uśanā paśyata mā
translated: I surpassed Kuts, the son of Arjuna; I am the wise one, Ushanas; look at me.

original: aham bhūmim adadām āryāyāhaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ dāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: aham bhūmim adadām āryāya aham vṛṣṭim dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: I gave the noble earth; I gave rain to the mortal worshipper.

original: aham apo anayaṃ vāvaśānā mama devāso anu ketam āyan
analyzed: aham apaḥ anayam vāvaśānāḥ mama devāsaḥ anu ketam āyan
translated: I led the waters, the lowing ones; the gods came after my banner.

original: aham puro mandasāno vy airaṃ nava sākaṃ navatīḥ śambarasya
analyzed: aham puraḥ mandasānaḥ vi airam nava sākam navatīḥ śambarasya
translated: I went forth, rejoicing, in front, nine times ninety of Shambara's.

original: śatatamaṃ veśyaṃ sarvatātā divodāsam atithigvaṃ yad āvam
analyzed: śatatamam veśyam sarvatātā divodāsam atithigvam yat āvam
translated: The hundredth, the all-supporting, Divodasa, Atithigva, whom we subdued.

original: pra su ṣa vibhyo maruto vir astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhya āśupatvā🔽acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇo havyam bharan manave devajuṣṭam
analyzed: pra su sa vibhyaḥ marutaḥ viḥ astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhyaḥ āśu patvā  acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇaḥ havyam bharat manave deva juṣṭam
translated: May the Maruts be victorious over the enemies, may the falcon be victorious over the falcons through speed.🔽When the bird, with his own power, not made with wheels, carried the oblation to be offered to Manu, dear to the gods.

original: bharad yadi vir ato vevijānaḥ pathoruṇā manojavā asarji
analyzed: bharat yadi viḥ atas vevijānaḥ pathā uruṇā manaḥ javāḥ asarji
translated: If he carried it, shaking, he sent it forth with the wide paths, swift as thought.

original: tūyaṃ yayau madhunā somyenota śravo vivide śyeno atra
analyzed: tūyam yayau madhunā somyena uta śravaḥ vivide śyenaḥ atra
translated: He went away with the sweet Soma juice, and the falcon found fame here.

original: ṛjīpī śyeno dadamāno aṃśum parāvataḥ śakuno mandram madam
analyzed: ṛjīpī śyenaḥ dadamānaḥ aṃśum parāvataḥ śakunaḥ mandram madam
translated: The strong falcon, giving the stalk, the bird from afar, sent forth the delightful rapture.

original: somam bharad dādṛhāṇo devāvān divo amuṣmād uttarād ādāya
analyzed: somam bharat dādṛhāṇaḥ devāvān divaḥ amuṣmāt uttarāt ādāya
translated: Bearing the Soma, firm, devoted to the gods, taking it from yonder highest heaven.

original: ādāya śyeno abharat somaṃ sahasraṃ savāṃ ayutaṃ ca sākam
analyzed: ādāya śyenaḥ abharat somam sahasram savām ayutam ca sākam
translated: The falcon took and brought the Soma, a thousand and ten thousand together.

original: atrā puraṃdhir ajahād arātīr made somasya mūrā amūraḥ
analyzed: atrā puraṃdhiḥ ajahāt arātīḥ made somasya mūrāḥ a mūraḥ
translated: Here the wise one left behind his hostilities, the wise one in the rapture of the Soma.

original: garbhe nu sann anv eṣām avedam ahaṃ devānāṃ janimāni viśvā🔽śatam mā pura āyasīr arakṣann adha śyeno javasā nir adīyam
analyzed: garbhe nu san anu eṣām avedam aham devānām janimāni viśvā  śatam mā puraḥ āyasīḥ arakṣan adha śyenaḥ javasā niḥ adīyam
translated: Even when I was in the womb I knew all the generations of the gods.🔽A hundred iron ones protected me in front, then the falcon with speed carried me out.

original: na ghā sa mām apa joṣaṃ jabhārābhīm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa
analyzed: na ghā sa mām apa joṣam jabhāra abhi īm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa
translated: He did not carry me away against my will, he was near with his power and strength.

original: īrmā puraṃdhir ajahād arātīr uta vātāṃ atarac chūśuvānaḥ
analyzed: īrmā puraṃdhiḥ ajahāt arātīḥ uta vā atām atarat śūśuvānaḥ
translated: The wise one left behind his hostilities, and the shining one passed through the winds.

original: ava yac chyeno asvanīd adha dyor vi yad yadi vāta ūhuḥ puraṃdhim
analyzed: ava yat śyenaḥ asvanīt adha dyoḥ vi yat yadi vā atas ūhuḥ puraṃdhim
translated: When the hawk has swooped down from the sky, when the wind has carried the treasure away,

original: sṛjad yad asmā ava ha kṣipaj jyāṃ kṛśānur astā manasā bhuraṇyan
analyzed: sṛjat yat asmai ava ha kṣipat jyām kṛśānuḥ astā manasā bhuraṇyan
translated: When the swift one, the falcon, has let go the cord in his mind, and the fire has been set in motion,

original: ṛjipya īm indrāvato na bhujyuṃ śyeno jabhāra bṛhato adhi ṣṇoḥ
analyzed: ṛjipyaḥ īm indrāvataḥ na bhujyum śyenaḥ jabhāra bṛhataḥ adhi snoḥ
translated: The swift one has brought down the falcon of Indra, the bird, from the lofty height of the sky.

original: antaḥ patat patatry asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tad veḥ
analyzed: antar patat patatri asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tat veḥ
translated: The bird's wing has fallen down within it, on the path of the swift one, of the bird.

original: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ gobhir aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ
analyzed: adha śvetam kalaśam gobhiḥ aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ
translated: Now the white pot, anointed with milk, the Maghavan has filled with the pure Soma to be drunk,

original: adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvo agram indro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvaḥ agram indraḥ madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūraḥ madāya prati dhat pibadhyai
translated: The foremost of the sweet drink, offered by the Adhvaryus, Indra has placed for his joy, for his drinking. The hero has placed for his joy, for his drinking.

original: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhya indro apo manave sasrutas kaḥ
analyzed: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhye indraḥ apaḥ manave sasrutaḥ kaḥ
translated: With thee as his ally, O Soma, Indra, for the sake of his friend, has let loose the waters for Manu.

original: ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇod apihiteva khāni🔽tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasyendraś cakraṃ sahasā sadya indo
analyzed: ahan ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇot apihitā iva khāni  tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasya indraḥ cakram sahasā sadyas indo
translated: He has slain the dragon, has won the seven rivers, has opened the openings as if they were closed.🔽With thee as his ally, O Indra, has suddenly hurled down the sun's wheel, O Indu,

original: adhi ṣṇunā bṛhatā vartamānam maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi
analyzed: adhi snunā bṛhatā vartamānam mahaḥ druhaḥ apa viśva āyu dhāyi
translated: Which was rolling on the lofty vault, O Indra, the all-supporting, the great one, of the foe.

original: ahann indro adahad agnir indo purā dasyūn madhyaṃdinād abhīke
analyzed: ahan indraḥ adahat agniḥ indo purā dasyūn madhyaṃdināt abhīke
translated: Indra slew, Agni burned, O Indu, the Dasyus before midday, in the battle.

original: durge duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt
analyzed: durge duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt
translated: With his mind he drove away many thousands, who had gone to a difficult dwelling in a difficult place.

original: viśvasmāt sīm adhamāṃ indra dasyūn viśo dāsīr akṛṇor apraśastāḥ
analyzed: viśvasmāt sīm adhamān indra dasyūn viśaḥ dāsīḥ akṛṇoḥ apraśastāḥ
translated: From all sides, O Indra, thou didst cast down the Dasyus, and didst make their people, the Dāsas, contemptible.

original: abādhethām amṛṇataṃ ni śatrūn avindethām apacitiṃ vadhatraiḥ
analyzed: abādhethām amṛṇatam ni śatrūn avindethām apacitim vadhatraiḥ
translated: Ye smote, ye slew the enemies, ye found the means of destruction with the killers.

original: evā satyam maghavānā yuvaṃ tad indraś ca somorvam aśvyaṃ goḥ
analyzed: eva satyam maghavānā yuvam tat indraḥ ca soma ūrvam aśvyam goḥ
translated: So this is true, O bountiful ones, that Indra and Soma have obtained the horse and the cow.

original: ādardṛtam apihitāny aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāś cit tatṛdānā
analyzed: ādardṛtam apihitāni aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāḥ cit tatṛdānā
translated: Ye have burst open the hidden stores of food, ye have filled even the narrow places.

original: ā na stuta upa vājebhir ūtī indra yāhi haribhir mandasānaḥ🔽tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā purūṇy āṅgūṣebhir gṛṇānaḥ satyarādhāḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ stutaḥ upa vājebhiḥ ūtī indra yāhi haribhiḥ mandasānaḥ  tiras cit aryaḥ savanā purūṇi āṅgūṣebhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ satya rādhāḥ
translated: Come hither, O Indra, praised, with aids to the feast, come, rejoicing, on thy two bay steeds.🔽Even the distant libations of many a foe, praised with our hymns, thou hast obtained, O thou who grantest true boons.

original: ā hi ṣmā yāti naryaś cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhir upa yajñam
analyzed: ā hi sma yāti naryaḥ cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ upa yajñam
translated: Hither comes the man who knows, invited by the pressers, to the sacrifice.

original: svaśvo yo abhīrur manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhir madati saṃ ha vīraiḥ
analyzed: su aśvaḥ yaḥ abhīruḥ manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhiḥ madati sam ha vīraiḥ
translated: He who has good horses, who is fearless, who is self-confident, rejoices with the well-pressed (juices) and with the heroes.

original: śrāvayed asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai
analyzed: śrāvayet asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai
translated: One should make his ears hear, in order to win strength, and should gladden him according to the direction he likes.

original: udvāvṛṣāṇo rādhase tuviṣmān karan na indraḥ sutīrthābhayaṃ ca
analyzed: udvāvṛṣāṇaḥ rādhase tuviṣmān karat naḥ indraḥ su tīrthā abhayam ca
translated: The mighty one, pouring forth for the gift, makes for us, O Indra, a good ford and safety,

original: achā yo gantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipraṃ havamānaṃ gṛṇantam
analyzed: achā yaḥ gantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipram havamānam gṛṇantam
translated: He who will go to the one who worships, to the poet who sings and invokes here,

original: upa tmani dadhāno dhury āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajrabāhuḥ
analyzed: upa tmani dadhānaḥ dhuri āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajra bāhuḥ
translated: Placing the swift horses in his own self, the one with the thunderbolt in his arm, (he who) has thousands and hundreds,

original: tvotāso maghavann indra viprā vayaṃ te syāma sūrayo gṛṇantaḥ
analyzed: tvotāsaḥ maghavan indra viprāḥ vayam te syāma sūrayaḥ gṛṇantaḥ
translated: We, O bountiful Indra, the priests, O Maghavan, may we be yours, the poets, singing,

original: bhejānāso bṛhaddivasya rāya ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ
analyzed: bhejānāsaḥ bṛhat divasya rāyaḥ ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ
translated: Having enjoyed the wealth of the one with the great heaven, of the one who is to be invoked, of the one who gives, of the one with much food,

original: nakir indra tvad uttaro na jyāyāṃ asti vṛtrahan
analyzed: nakir indra tvat uttaraḥ na jyāyām asti vṛtrahan
translated: O Indra, the slayer of Vrtra, there is none higher than you, there is none greater,

original: nakir evā yathā tvam
analyzed: nakir evā yathā tvam
translated: There is none at all like you.

original: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayo viśvā cakreva vāvṛtuḥ
analyzed: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayaḥ viśvā cakrā iva vāvṛtuḥ
translated: All the peoples have turned to you, as if to a wheel, in every season.

original: satrā mahāṃ asi śrutaḥ
analyzed: satrā mahān asi śrutaḥ
translated: You are always great, O famous one.

original: viśve caned anā tvā devāsa indra yuyudhuḥ
analyzed: viśve cana id anā tvā devāsaḥ indra yuyudhuḥ
translated: All the gods, O Indra, have fought with you,

original: yad ahā naktam ātiraḥ
analyzed: yat ahā naktam ātiraḥ
translated: When you stretched out the night.

original: yatrota bādhitebhyaś cakraṃ kutsāya yudhyate
analyzed: yatra uta bādhitebhyaḥ cakram kutsāya yudhyate
translated: Where the wheel is set in motion for Kutsa, to fight with the oppressed,

original: muṣāya indra sūryam
analyzed: muṣāya indra sūryam
translated: You stole the sun, O Indra.

original: yatra devām ṛghāyato viśvāṃ ayudhya eka it
analyzed: yatra devām ṛghāyataḥ viśvān ayudhyaḥ ekaḥ id
translated: Where you, alone, O Indra, fought with all the gods who were bent on violence,

original: tvam indra vanūṃr ahan
analyzed: tvam indra vanūn ahan
translated: You, O Indra, slew the Vanūs.

original: yatrota martyāya kam ariṇā indra sūryam
analyzed: yatra uta martyāya kam ariṇāḥ indra sūryam
translated: Where, O Indra, for the sake of a mortal, you stole the sun with the swift horses,

original: prāvaḥ śacībhir etaśam
analyzed: prāvaḥ śacībhiḥ etaśam
translated: You helped Etaṣa with your powers.

original: kim ād utāsi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ
analyzed: kim āt uta asi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ
translated: What then, O Vritra-slayer, are you, O bountiful one, the most enraged?

original: atrāha dānum ātiraḥ
analyzed: atra aha dānum ātiraḥ
translated: Here you have overcome the Dânu.

original: etad ghed uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṃsyam🔽striyaṃ yad durhaṇāyuvaṃ vadhīr duhitaraṃ divaḥ
analyzed: etat gha id uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṃsyam  striyam yat durhaṇāyuvam vadhīḥ duhitaram divaḥ
translated: This indeed is the manly strength, O Indra, which you have performed,🔽When you slew the woman, the ill-fated daughter of the sky.

original: divaś cid ghā duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām
analyzed: divaḥ cit gha duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām
translated: Even from the sky the great one crushed the daughter,

original: uṣāsam indra sam piṇak
analyzed: uṣāsam indra sam piṇak
translated: The exalted Ushas, O Indra.

original: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭād aha bibhyuṣī
analyzed: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭāt aha bibhyuṣī
translated: Ushas fled from the crushed axle, trembling in fear,

original: ni yat sīṃ śiśnathad vṛṣā
analyzed: ni yat sīm śiśnathat vṛṣā
translated: When the bull crushed her.

original: etad asyā anaḥ śaye susampiṣṭaṃ vipāśy ā
analyzed: etat asyāḥ anaḥ śaye su sampiṣṭam vipāśi ā
translated: This is her axle, lying down, well-crushed, looking around,

original: sasāra sīm parāvataḥ
analyzed: sasāra sīm parāvataḥ
translated: She has gone away to a distant place.

original: uta sindhuṃ vibālyaṃ vitasthānām adhi kṣami🔽pari ṣṭhā indra māyayā
analyzed: uta sindhum vibālyam vitasthānām adhi kṣami  pari stha indra māyayā
translated: And the Sindhu, the turbulent one, of the scattered ones, on the earth,🔽You have surrounded, O Indra, with your magic.

original: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣo abhi vedanam
analyzed: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣaḥ abhi vedanam
translated: And the daring of Shushṇa, you have rubbed away the pain,

original: puro yad asya sampiṇak🔽uta dāsaṃ kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parvatād adhi
analyzed: puraḥ yat asya sampiṇak  uta dāsam kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parvatāt adhi
translated: When you crushed his forts.🔽And the Dâsa Kaulira, from the lofty mountain,

original: avāhann indra śambaram
analyzed: avāhan indra śambaram
translated: You have brought, O Indra, to Sambara.

original: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatāvadhīḥ
analyzed: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā avadhīḥ
translated: And the hundreds and thousands of the Dâsa's Varcha,

original: adhi pañca pradhīṃr iva
analyzed: adhi pañca pradhīn iva
translated: Above the five points, as it were.

original: uta tyam putram agruvaḥ parāvṛktaṃ śatakratuḥ
analyzed: uta tyam putram agruvaḥ parāvṛktam śatakratuḥ
translated: And that son of the crooked one, Parâvrit, the one of a hundred powers,

original: uktheṣv indra ābhajat
analyzed: uktheṣu indraḥ ābhajat
translated: Indra has allotted to the praises.

original: uta tyā turvaśāyadū asnātārā śacīpatiḥ🔽indro vidvāṃ apārayat
analyzed: uta tyā turvaśa yadū a snātārā śacīpatiḥ  indraḥ vidvān apārayat
translated: And for Turvaga you, O lord of power, Indra, the wise one, delivered them.

original: uta tyā sadya āryā sarayor indra pārataḥ
analyzed: uta tyā sadyas āryā sarayoḥ indra pāratas
translated: And for the Ārya you, O Indra, from the two rivers, from afar,

original: arṇācitrarathāvadhīḥ
analyzed: arṇā citrarathau adhīḥ
translated: you drove away the two with variegated chariots.

original: anu dvā jahitā nayo 'ndhaṃ śroṇaṃ ca vṛtrahan
analyzed: anu dvā jahitā nayaḥ ndham śroṇam ca vṛtrahan
translated: You killed the blind and the lame, O Vrtra-killer, with the two horses.

original: na tat te sumnam aṣṭave
analyzed: na tat te sumnam aṣṭave
translated: That is not your favor to be desired.

original: śatam aśmanmayīnām purām indro vy āsyat
analyzed: śatam aśmanmayīnām purām indraḥ vi āsyat
translated: Indra broke open a hundred forts made of stone

original: divodāsāya dāśuṣe
analyzed: divodāsāya dāśuṣe
translated: for Divodāsa, the worshipper.

original: asvāpayad dabhītaye sahasrā triṃśataṃ hathaiḥ
analyzed: asvāpayat dabhītaye sahasrā triṃśatam hathaiḥ
translated: He made Dābhīti sleep with his arms, thirty thousand,

original: dāsānām indro māyayā
analyzed: dāsānām indraḥ māyayā
translated: Indra with his magic power, the Dāsas.

original: sa ghed utāsi vṛtrahan samāna indra gopatiḥ
analyzed: sa gha id uta asi vṛtrahan samānaḥ indra go patiḥ
translated: You are indeed, O Vrtra-killer, the common Indra, the lord of cattle,

original: yas tā viśvāni cicyuṣe
analyzed: yaḥ tā viśvāni cicyuṣe
translated: who has all these things to look after.

original: uta nūnaṃ yad indriyaṃ kariṣyā indra pauṃsyam
analyzed: uta nūnam yat indriyam kariṣyāḥ indra pauṃsyam
translated: And now, O Indra, what manly power will I accomplish, O Indra?

original: adyā nakiṣ ṭad ā minat
analyzed: adyā nakir tat ā minat
translated: No one will diminish that today.

original: vāmaṃvāmaṃ ta ādure devo dadātv aryamā
analyzed: vāmam vāmam te ādure devaḥ dadātu aryamā

analyzed: vāmam pūṣā vāmam bhagaḥ vāmam devaḥ karūḍatī
translated: the desirable Pūṣan, the desirable Bhaga, the desirable the god may make.

original: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā
analyzed: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā
translated: By what wondrous help, O ever-waxing friend, will he come to us?

original: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā
analyzed: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā

analyzed: kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām maṃhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ

analyzed: dṛḍhā cit āruje vasu

original: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṇām
analyzed: abhī su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṇām
translated: Be thou the protector of our friends, the praiser's guardian,

original: śatam bhavāsy ūtibhiḥ
analyzed: śatam bhavāsi ūtibhiḥ

original: abhī na ā vavṛtsva cakraṃ na vṛttam arvataḥ
analyzed: abhi naḥ ā vavṛtsva cakram na vṛttam arvataḥ
translated: Turn hither unto us, as a wheel turns, the steed's wheel,

original: niyudbhiś carṣaṇīnām
analyzed: niyudbhiḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: With the reins of the men.

original: pravatā hi kratūnām ā hā padeva gachasi🔽abhakṣi sūrye sacā
analyzed: pravatā hi kratūnām ā ha padā iva gacchasi  abhakṣi sūrye sacā

original: saṃ yat ta indra manyavaḥ saṃ cakrāṇi dadhanvire
analyzed: sam yat te indra manyavaḥ sam cakrāṇi dadhanvire
translated: When, O Surya, thy thoughts and thy wheels have been set in motion,

original: adha tve adha sūrye
analyzed: adha tve adha sūrye

original: uta smā hi tvām āhur in maghavānaṃ śacīpate
analyzed: uta smā hi tvām āhuḥ id maghavānam śacīpate
translated: Yea, they call thee, O Maghavan, Lord of power,

original: dātāram avidīdhayum
analyzed: dātāram avidīdhayum
translated: The giver who delights in the worshipper.

analyzed: uta smā sadyas id pari śaśamānāya sunvate  purū cit maṃhase vasu
translated: Yea, even in a moment thou bestowest much wealth🔽On the man who presses out the juice and longs for it.🔽For a hundred times, O thou who art not to be deceived,

original: nahi ṣmā te śataṃ cana rādho varanta āmuraḥ
analyzed: nahi sma te śatam cana rādhaḥ varante āmuraḥ
translated: Will not thy bounty give us wealth,

original: na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ
analyzed: na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ
translated: Nor will thy help fail us.🔽Let thy hundreds and thousands of aids

analyzed: asmān avantu te śatam asmān sahasram ūtayaḥ  asmān viśvāḥ abhiṣṭayaḥ

analyzed: asmān iha ā vṛṇīṣva sakhyāya svastaye

original: maho rāye divitmate
analyzed: mahaḥ rāye divitmate
translated: For great wealth, O thou of heaven.🔽O Indra, grant us with thy favour

analyzed: asmān aviḍḍhi viśvahā indra rāyā parīṇasā

analyzed: asmān viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ  asmabhyam tām apa ā vṛdhi vrajām astā iva gomataḥ

original: navābhir indrotibhiḥ
analyzed: navābhiḥ indra ūtibhiḥ
translated: As 'twere from a stable, with thy new aids, O Indra.

original: asmākaṃ dhṛṣṇuyā ratho dyumāṃ indrānapacyutaḥ
analyzed: asmākam dhṛṣṇuyā rathaḥ dyumān indra an apacyutaḥ

analyzed: gavyuḥ aśvayuḥ īyate
translated: it goes forth winning cattle and horses.🔽Make us the highest in fame among the gods, O Sun,

analyzed: asmākam uttamam kṛdhi śravaḥ deveṣu sūrya  varṣiṣṭham dyām iva upari

analyzed: ā tu naḥ indra vṛtrahan asmākam ardham ā gahi

original: mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ
analyzed: mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ

original: bhṛmiś cid ghāsi tūtujir ā citra citriṇīṣv ā
analyzed: bhṛmiḥ cit gha asi tūtujiḥ ā citra citriṇīṣu ā

analyzed: citram kṛṇoṣi ūtaye

analyzed: dabhrebhiḥ cit śaśīyāṃsam haṃsi vrādhantam ojasā

translated: with the friends who are with you.🔽We, O Indra, with you, we exalt you,🔽us, O Indra, do thou exalt.

original: asmāṃasmāṃ id ud ava
analyzed: asmān asmān id ud ava
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,🔽with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,🔽with which thou gavest Gokṣa the victory.🔽Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,

original: sa naś citrābhir adrivo 'navadyābhir ūtibhiḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ citrābhiḥ adrivas navadyābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,

original: anādhṛṣṭābhir ā gahi
analyzed: anādhṛṣṭābhiḥ ā gahi

original: bhūyāmo ṣu tvāvataḥ sakhāya indra gomataḥ
analyzed: bhūyāma u su tvāvataḥ sakhāyaḥ indra gomataḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,🔽with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,

original: yujo vājāya ghṛṣvaye
analyzed: yujaḥ vājāya ghṛṣvaye
translated: with which thou gavest Gokṣa the victory.🔽Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,🔽with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,🔽with which thou gavest Gokṣa the victory.

original: tvaṃ hy eka īśiṣa indra vājasya gomataḥ
analyzed: tvam hi ekaḥ īśiṣe indra vājasya gomataḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,🔽with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,🔽with which thou gavest Gokṣa the victory.

original: sa no yandhi mahīm iṣam🔽na tvā varante anyathā yad ditsasi stuto magham
analyzed: sa naḥ yandhi mahīm iṣam  na tvā varante anyathā yat ditsasi stutaḥ magham
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,🔽with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,🔽with which thou gavest Gokṣa the victory.

original: stotṛbhya indra girvaṇaḥ
analyzed: stotṛbhyaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with those aids of thine which are most mighty,🔽with which thou holpest Kaṇva and Dadhyac,🔽with which thou gavest Gokṣa the victory.

original: abhi tvā gotamā girānūṣata pra dāvane
