analyzed: abhi tvā gotamāḥ girā anūṣata pra dāvane
translated: The Gotamas sing forth their songs to thee, O Indra, to bestow

original: indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye
analyzed: indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye
translated: Strength that is keen as a razor.

original: pra te vocāma vīryā yā mandasāna ārujaḥ
analyzed: pra te vocāma vīryā yāḥ mandasānaḥ ārujaḥ
translated: We will proclaim thy deeds of old, O thou who rejoicest in the juice,

original: puro dāsīr abhītya
analyzed: puraḥ dāsīḥ abhītya
translated: Having overcome the Dasyus' forts.

original: tā te gṛṇanti vedhaso yāni cakartha pauṃsyā
analyzed: tā te gṛṇanti vedhasaḥ yāni cakartha pauṃsyā
translated: The sages sing those manly deeds of thine which thou hast done,

original: suteṣv indra girvaṇaḥ
analyzed: suteṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: O Indra, lover of the song, at the Soma-pressings.

original: avīvṛdhanta gotamā indra tve stomavāhasaḥ
analyzed: avīvṛdhanta gotamāḥ indra tve stoma vāhasaḥ
translated: The Gotamas have magnified thee, O Indra, in their hymns of praise.

original: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśaḥ
analyzed: ā eṣu dhāḥ vīravat yaśaḥ
translated: Bestow upon them glory that is rich in heroes.

original: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam
analyzed: yat cit hi śaśvatām asi indra sādhāraṇaḥ tvam
translated: For thou art the common property of all who sing thy praise, O Indra.

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe
analyzed: tam tvā vayam havāmahe
translated: We invoke thee for this.

original: arvācīno vaso bhavāsme su matsvāndhasaḥ🔽somānām indra somapāḥ
analyzed: arvācīnaḥ vaso bhava asme su matsva andhasaḥ  somānām indra soma pāḥ
translated: Be thou inclined to us, O Vasu, rejoice in our libations,🔽O Indra, thou who drinkest the Soma of the pressed (juice).

original: asmākaṃ tvā matīnām ā stoma indra yachatu🔽arvāg ā vartayā harī
analyzed: asmākam tvā matīnām ā stomaḥ indra yacchatu  arvāk ā vartaya harī
translated: Let the hymn, O Indra, come to thee of our prayers.🔽Turn hither thy two Bay Steeds.

original: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse giraś ca naḥ
analyzed: puroḷāśam ca naḥ ghasaḥ joṣayāse giraḥ ca naḥ
translated: Accept our sacrificial cake and our food and our songs,

original: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām
analyzed: vadhūyuḥ iva yoṣaṇām
translated: As a bridegroom receives the bride.

original: sahasraṃ vyatīnāṃ yuktānām indram īmahe
analyzed: sahasram vyatīnām yuktānām indram īmahe
translated: We invoke Indra, the thousand, the exceeding strong, the well-yoked,

original: śataṃ somasya khāryaḥ
analyzed: śatam somasya khāryaḥ
translated: The hundred jars of Soma.

original: sahasrā te śatā vayaṃ gavām ā cyāvayāmasi
analyzed: sahasrā te śatā vayam gavām ā cyāvayāmasi
translated: We will bring thee, O Indra, a thousand, a hundred cows.

original: asmatrā rādha etu te
analyzed: asmatrā rādhaḥ etu te
translated: Let thy bounty come to us.

original: daśa te kalaśānāṃ hiraṇyānām adhīmahi
analyzed: daśa te kalaśānām hiraṇyānām adhīmahi
translated: We will milk out for thee ten of the golden udders of the milk-pail.

original: bhūridā asi vṛtrahan
analyzed: bhūri dāḥ asi vṛtrahan
translated: Thou art the bountiful one, O Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: bhūridā bhūri dehi no mā dabhram bhūry ā bhara
analyzed: bhūri dāḥ bhūri dehi naḥ mā dabhram bhūri ā bhara
translated: Bestow much, give us much, do not be niggardly, bring us much.

original: bhūri ghed indra ditsasi
analyzed: bhūri gha id indra ditsasi
translated: For much, indeed, O Indra, you wish to give.

original: bhūridā hy asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan
analyzed: bhūri dāḥ hi asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan
translated: For you are the giver of much, O renowned one, in many ways, O hero, O Vrtra-slayer.

original: ā no bhajasva rādhasi🔽pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṃsāmi goṣaṇo napāt
analyzed: ā naḥ bhajasva rādhasi  pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṃsāmi goṣaṇaḥ napāt
translated: Do you share with us in the gift.🔽O you of the brown hue, O you of great discernment, I praise you, O son of Goṣaṇa,

original: mābhyāṃ gā anu śiśrathaḥ
analyzed: mā ābhyām gāḥ anu śiśrathaḥ
translated: Do not abandon the two cows to them.

original: kanīnakeva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake
analyzed: kanīnakā iva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake
translated: Like a young child, like a new-born infant, like a small child,

original: babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete
analyzed: babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete
translated: The two brown ones shine in their course.

original: aram ma usrayāmṇe 'ram anusrayāmṇe
analyzed: aram me usra yāmṇe ram an usra yāmṇe
translated: Easy for the one who goes with the wagon, easy for the one who follows with the wagon,

original: babhrū yāmeṣv asridhā
analyzed: babhrū yāmeṣu asridhā
translated: The two brown ones shine in their course.

original: pra ṛbhubhyo dūtam iva vācam iṣya upastire śvaitarīṃ dhenum īḷe
analyzed: pra ṛbhubhyaḥ dūtam iva vācam iṣye upastire śvaitarīm dhenum īḍe
translated: I send forth a message like a messenger to the Ṛbhus, I offer a white cow as a seat,

original: ye vātajūtās taraṇibhir evaiḥ pari dyāṃ sadyo apaso babhūvuḥ
analyzed: ye vāta jūtāḥ taraṇibhiḥ evaiḥ pari dyām sadyas apasaḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Who, impelled by the wind, with swift horses, in a moment, became the weavers of the sky.

original: yadāram akrann ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ
analyzed: yadā aram akran ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ
translated: When the Ṛbhus did this for their parents, with gifts, with offerings, with deeds of strength,

original: ād id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai
analyzed: āt id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai
translated: They entered the friendship of the gods, the wise ones brought prosperity for the sake of the mind.

original: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpeva jaraṇā śayānā
analyzed: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpā iva jaraṇā śayānā
translated: Those who made their parents young again, who made them lie down like old sacrificial posts,

original: te vājo vibhvām ṛbhur indravanto madhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñam
analyzed: te vājaḥ vibhvām ṛbhuḥ indravantaḥ madhu psarasaḥ naḥ vantu yajñam
translated: May that strength, the all-embracing Ṛbhu, together with Indra, delight in our sacrifice, whose food is honey.

original: yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo gām arakṣan yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo mā apiṃśan
analyzed: yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavaḥ gām arakṣan yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavaḥ māḥ apiṃśan
translated: The year that the Rbhus guarded the cow, the year that the Rbhus nourished me,

original: yat saṃvatsam abharan bhāso asyās tābhiḥ śamībhir amṛtatvam āśuḥ
analyzed: yat saṃvatsam abharan bhāsaḥ asyāḥ tābhiḥ śamībhiḥ amṛta tvam āśuḥ
translated: The year that they brought forth this light of hers, by those acts of service they have attained immortality.

original: jyeṣṭha āha camasā dvā kareti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāmety āha
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ āha camasā dvā karā iti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāma iti āha
translated: The eldest says, 'I will make two cups,' the youngest says, 'I will make three.'

original: kaniṣṭha āha caturas kareti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavas tat panayad vaco vaḥ
analyzed: kaniṣṭhaḥ āha caturaḥ kara iti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavaḥ tat panayat vacaḥ vaḥ
translated: The youngest says, 'I will make four,' Tvastr, O Rbhus, he fulfils your words.

original: satyam ūcur nara evā hi cakrur anu svadhām ṛbhavo jagmur etām
analyzed: satyam ūcuḥ naraḥ evā hi cakruḥ anu svadhām ṛbhavaḥ jagmuḥ etām
translated: They have spoken the truth, the men have indeed done so; the Rbhus have gone according to their nature to this.

original: vibhrājamānāṃś camasāṃ ahevāvenat tvaṣṭā caturo dadṛśvān
analyzed: vibhrājamānān camasān aha iva avenat tvaṣṭā caturaḥ dadṛśvān
translated: The four cups which Ahevin saw shining,

original: dvādaśa dyūn yad agohyasyātithye raṇann ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ
analyzed: dvādaśa dyūn yat agohyasya ātithye raṇan ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ
translated: The twelve days when the Rbhus, being together, rejoiced at the hospitality of Agobhya,

original: sukṣetrākṛṇvann anayanta sindhūn dhanvātiṣṭhann oṣadhīr nimnam āpaḥ
analyzed: su kṣetrā akṛṇvan anayanta sindhūn dhanva atiṣṭhan oṣadhīḥ nimnam āpaḥ
translated: They made good fields, they led the rivers, they placed the plants in the desert, the waters in the low ground.

original: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ nareṣṭhāṃ ye dhenuṃ viśvajuvaṃ viśvarūpām
analyzed: ratham ye cakruḥ suvṛtam nareṣṭhām ye dhenum viśva juvam viśva rūpām
translated: They who made the well-made chariot with a man to guide it, they who made the cow all-conquering, all-formed,

original: ta ā takṣantv ṛbhavo rayiṃ naḥ svavasaḥ svapasaḥ suhastāḥ
analyzed: te ā takṣantu ṛbhavaḥ rayim naḥ su avasaḥ su apasaḥ su hastāḥ
translated: May the Rbhus, of their own will, of their own impulse, with their skilful hands, fashion for us wealth.

original: apo hy eṣām ajuṣanta devā abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ
analyzed: apaḥ hi eṣām ajuṣanta devāḥ abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ
translated: For the gods have rejoiced in their waters, thinking with their mind, with their insight.

original: vājo devānām abhavat sukarmendrasya ṛbhukṣā varuṇasya vibhvā
analyzed: vājaḥ devānām abhavat sukarmā indrasya ṛbhukṣāḥ varuṇasya vibhvā
translated: The strength of the gods became well-made, the Rbhukṣaṇ of Indra, the Vibhvan of Varuṇa

original: ye harī medhayokthā madanta indrāya cakruḥ suyujā ye aśvā
analyzed: ye harī medhayā ukthā madantaḥ indrāya cakruḥ su yujā ye aśvā
translated: Those two bay horses who rejoice in the hymns and praises, who were yoked well for Indra, those two horses

original: te rāyas poṣaṃ draviṇāny asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayanto na mitram
analyzed: te rāyaḥ poṣam draviṇāni asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayantaḥ na mitram
translated: They bestow upon us increase of wealth and riches, the Rbhukṣaṇs, protecting us like a friend

original: idāhnaḥ pītim uta vo madaṃ dhur na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ
analyzed: idā ahnaḥ pītim uta vaḥ madam dhuḥ na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ
translated: This day's drink and your joy have I set forth; the gods, without weariness, for friendship

original: te nūnam asme ṛbhavo vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta
analyzed: te nūnam asme ṛbhavaḥ vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta
translated: You Rbhukṣaṇs, now bestow upon us riches in this third libation

original: ṛbhur vibhvā vāja indro no achemaṃ yajñaṃ ratnadheyopa yāta
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ vibhvā vājaḥ indraḥ naḥ achā imam yajñam ratna dheyā upa yāta
translated: Rbhukṣan, Vibhvan, Vāja, Indra, come to this sacrifice of ours, O you who bestow treasures

original: idā hi vo dhiṣaṇā devy ahnām adhāt pītiṃ sam madā agmatā vaḥ
analyzed: idā hi vaḥ dhiṣaṇā devī ahnām adhāt pītim sam madāḥ agmata vaḥ
translated: For this, O divine Dhiṣaṇā of the days, has set forth the drink; your joys have come together

original: vidānāso janmano vājaratnā uta ṛtubhir ṛbhavo mādayadhvam
analyzed: vidānāsaḥ janmanaḥ vāja ratnāḥ uta ṛtubhiḥ ṛbhavaḥ mādayadhvam
translated: You who find the birth, who possess treasures, rejoice, O Rbhukṣaṇs, with the seasons

original: saṃ vo madā agmata sam puraṃdhiḥ suvīrām asme rayim erayadhvam
analyzed: sam vaḥ madāḥ agmata sam puraṃdhiḥ su vīrām asme rayim erayadhvam
translated: Your joys have come together, and your great thought; send to us riches with good heroes

original: ayaṃ vo yajña ṛbhavo 'kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivo dadhidhve
analyzed: ayam vaḥ yajñaḥ ṛbhavaḥ kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivaḥ dadhidhve
translated: This sacrifice, O Rbhukṣaṇs, has been made for you, which you, like Manu, have approved

original: pra vo 'chā jujuṣāṇāso asthur abhūta viśve agriyota vājāḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ chā jujuṣāṇāsaḥ asthuḥ abhūta viśve agriyā uta vājāḥ
translated: Your joys have come, eager to enjoy; all the treasures have been brought, O Vāja

original: abhūd u vo vidhate ratnadheyam idā naro dāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: abhūt u vaḥ vidhate ratna dheyam idā naraḥ dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: You have become the bestowers of treasure to the one who has prepared (the sacrifice), to the mortal who offers, O men.

original: pibata vājā ṛbhavo dade vo mahi tṛtīyaṃ savanam madāya
analyzed: pibata vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ dade vaḥ mahi tṛtīyam savanam madāya
translated: Drink, O Vājas, O Rbhus, I have given you the great third libation for your delight.

original: ā vājā yātopa na ṛbhukṣā maho naro draviṇaso gṛṇānāḥ
analyzed: ā vājāḥ yātā upa naḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ mahaḥ naraḥ draviṇasaḥ gṛṇānāḥ
translated: O Vājas, come, O men who desire strength, you treasure-givers, praised by the great ones.

original: ā vaḥ pītayo 'bhipitve ahnām imā astaṃ navasva iva gman
analyzed: ā vaḥ pītayaḥ bhipitve ahnām imāḥ astam nava svaḥ iva gman
translated: Your libations, at the time of the evening of the days, have come to this new one, as if to a resting place.

original: ā napātaḥ śavaso yātanopemaṃ yajñaṃ namasā hūyamānāḥ
analyzed: ā napātaḥ śavasaḥ yātana upa imam yajñam namasā hūyamānāḥ
translated: O offspring of power, come to this sacrifice, invoked with reverence.

original: sajoṣasaḥ sūrayo yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā indravantaḥ
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ sūrayaḥ yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratna dhāḥ indravantaḥ
translated: You who are of one mind with those who are, you glorious ones, drink the sweet (drink), you who bestow treasure, together with Indra.

original: sajoṣā indra varuṇena somaṃ sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marudbhiḥ
analyzed: sajoṣāḥ indra varuṇena somam sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ
translated: O Indra, be of one mind with Varuṇa in drinking the Soma; be of one mind, O you who love praise, with the Maruts in drinking.

original: agrepābhir ṛtupābhiḥ sajoṣā gnāspatnībhī ratnadhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: agre pābhiḥ ṛtu pābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ gnāspatnībhiḥ ratna dhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: Be of one mind with the foremost, the seasonal ones, be of one mind with the wives of the lords of the houses, the bestowers of treasure.

original: sajoṣasa ādityair mādayadhvaṃ sajoṣasa ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ ādityaiḥ mādayadhvam sajoṣasaḥ ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ
translated: Be of one mind with the Ādityas, rejoice; be of one mind, O Rbhus, with the mountains.

original: sajoṣaso daivyenā savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhī ratnadhebhiḥ🔽ye aśvinā ye pitarā ya ūtī dhenuṃ tatakṣur ṛbhavo ye aśvā
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ daivyena savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhiḥ ratna dhebhiḥ  ye aśvinā ye pitarā ye ūtī dhenum tatakṣuḥ ṛbhavaḥ ye aśvā
translated: Be of one mind with the divine Savitar; be of one mind with the treasure-giving rivers.🔽You who are the two Aśvins, you who are the parents, you who are the helpers, the Rbhus who fashioned the cow, you who are the horses,

original: ye aṃsatrā ya ṛdhag rodasī ye vibhvo naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ
analyzed: ye aṃsatrā ye ṛdhak rodasī ye vibhvaḥ naraḥ su apatyāni cakruḥ
translated: You who are the ones without enmity, you who are the ones who have extended the two worlds, you who are the all-pervading men who have performed their own duties,

original: ye gomantaṃ vājavantaṃ suvīraṃ rayiṃ dhattha vasumantam purukṣum
analyzed: ye gomantam vājavantam su vīram rayim dhattha vasumantam purukṣum
translated: You who bestow wealth, with cattle, with strength, with brave men, with abundance, with much food,

original: te agrepā ṛbhavo mandasānā asme dhatta ye ca rātiṃ gṛṇanti
analyzed: te agre pāḥ ṛbhavaḥ mandasānāḥ asme dhatta ye ca rātim gṛṇanti
translated: You Ṛbhus, first-drinkers, rejoicing, bestow upon us those who enjoy the gift and sing praises.

original: nāpābhūta na vo 'tītṛṣāmāniḥśastā ṛbhavo yajñe asmin
analyzed: na apābhūta na vaḥ tītṛṣāma a niḥśastāḥ ṛbhavaḥ yajñe asmin
translated: We have not been disappointed, O Ṛbhus, we have not been thirsty at this sacrifice.

original: sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ saṃ rājabhī ratnadheyāya devāḥ
analyzed: sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ sam rājabhiḥ ratna dheyāya devāḥ
translated: Rejoice together with Indra, together with the Maruts, together with the royal ones, O gods, for the bestowal of treasures.

original: ihopa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo māpa bhūta
analyzed: iha upa yāta śavasaḥ napātaḥ saudhanvanāḥ ṛbhavaḥ mā apa bhūta
translated: Come hither, O sons of strength, O Ṛbhus, sons of Sudhanvan, be not far away.

original: asmin hi vaḥ savane ratnadheyaṃ gamantv indram anu vo madāsaḥ
analyzed: asmin hi vaḥ savane ratna dheyam gamantu indram anu vaḥ madāsaḥ
translated: For here is the bestowal of treasure at this libation of yours. Let your joys go forth, following Indra.

original: āgann ṛbhūṇām iha ratnadheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ
analyzed: āgan ṛbhūṇām iha ratna dheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ
translated: The bestowal of treasure of the Ṛbhus has come here. There has been the drinking of the well-pressed Soma.

original: sukṛtyayā yat svapasyayā caṃ ekaṃ vicakra camasaṃ caturdhā
analyzed: su kṛtyayā yat su apasyayā cam ekam vicakra camasam caturdhā
translated: By good performance and by good thought, they have made one four-part drinking bowl out of one.

original: vy akṛṇota camasaṃ caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣety abravīta
analyzed: vi akṛṇota camasam caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣa iti abravīta
translated: They have made the drinking bowl four-part. He said, O friend, let us divide it.

original: athaita vājā amṛtasya panthāṃ gaṇaṃ devānām ṛbhavaḥ suhastāḥ
analyzed: atha eta vājāḥ amṛtasya panthām gaṇam devānām ṛbhavaḥ su hastāḥ
translated: Then these Ṛbhus, the skillful ones, the path of immortality, the troop of the gods,

original: kimmayaḥ svic camasa eṣa āsa yaṃ kāvyena caturo vicakra
analyzed: kimmayaḥ svid camasaḥ eṣaḥ āsa yam kāvyena caturaḥ vicakra
translated: What was this drinking bowl made of, which they made four-part with their thought?

original: athā sunudhvaṃ savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavo madhunaḥ somyasya
analyzed: athā sunudhvam savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavaḥ madhunaḥ somyasya
translated: Then, O Ṛbhus, press out the juice for the rapture, drink the sweet Soma juice,

original: śacyākarta pitarā yuvānā śacyākarta camasaṃ devapānam
analyzed: śacyā akarta pitarā yuvānā śacyā akarta camasam deva pānam
translated: You have made the youthful parents strong, you have made the drinking vessel of the gods strong,

original: śacyā harī dhanutarāv ataṣṭendravāhāv ṛbhavo vājaratnāḥ
analyzed: śacyā harī dhanutarau ataṣṭa indra vāhau ṛbhavaḥ vāja ratnāḥ
translated: With might the two strong tawny horses have been harnessed, the bearers of Indra, the Ṛbhus, finders of strength.

original: yo vaḥ sunoty abhipitve ahnāṃ tīvraṃ vājāsaḥ savanam madāya
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ sunoti abhipitve ahnām tīvram vājāsaḥ savanam madāya
translated: He who presses for you at the time of the day's end, the strong juice, O Vājas, for the rapture,

original: tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarvavīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇo mandasānāḥ
analyzed: tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarva vīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇaḥ mandasānāḥ
translated: To him, O Ṛbhus, you bulls, rejoicing, fashion wealth with all heroes.

original: prātaḥ sutam apibo haryaśva mādhyaṃdinaṃ savanaṃ kevalaṃ te🔽sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratnadhebhiḥ sakhīṃr yāṃ indra cakṛṣe sukṛtyā
analyzed: prātar sutam apibaḥ hari aśva mādhyaṃdinam savanam kevalam te  sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratna dhebhiḥ sakhīn yām indra cakṛṣe su kṛtyā
translated: O you with tawny horses, you drank the morning juice, the midday libation is all yours,🔽Together with the Ṛbhus, who bestow treasures, drink, O Indra, whom you have made friends through good deeds.

original: ye devāso abhavatā sukṛtyā śyenā ived adhi divi niṣeda
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ abhavata su kṛtyā śyenāḥ iva id adhi divi niṣeda
translated: O gods who have become good through good deeds, you have sat down in the sky like hawks.

original: te ratnaṃ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā abhavatāmṛtāsaḥ
analyzed: te ratnam dhāta śavasaḥ napātaḥ saudhanvanāḥ abhavata amṛtāsaḥ
translated: You, O sons of power, have distributed the treasure, you have become immortal, O Saudhanvanas.

original: yat tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ ratnadheyam akṛṇudhvaṃ svapasyā suhastāḥ
analyzed: yat tṛtīyam savanam ratna dheyam akṛṇudhvam su apasyā su hastāḥ
translated: The third libation, which bestows treasure, which you have made, O you of good hands, for your own enjoyment,

original: tad ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktaṃ va etat sam madebhir indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam
analyzed: tat ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktam vaḥ etat sam madebhiḥ indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam
translated: That, O Ṛbhus, is sprinkled for you; drink it with your joys and powers.

original: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur ukthyo rathas tricakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ
analyzed: an aśvaḥ jātaḥ an abhīśuḥ ukthyaḥ rathaḥ tri cakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ
translated: The chariot, not a horse, not a goad, worthy of praise, is born, with three wheels, it moves around in the realm.

original: mahat tad vo devyasya pravācanaṃ dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīṃ yac ca puṣyatha
analyzed: mahat tat vaḥ devyasya pravācanam dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīm yat ca puṣyatha
translated: That is your great deed, O divine ones, O Rbhus, that you support the heaven and earth.

original: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ sucetaso 'vihvarantam manasas pari dhyayā
analyzed: ratham ye cakruḥ suvṛtam su cetasaḥ vihvarantam manasaḥ pari dhyayā
translated: Those who have made the well-constructed, well-thought-out chariot, which does not waver, by the thought of the mind,

original: tāṃ ū nv asya savanasya pītaya ā vo vājā ṛbhavo vedayāmasi
analyzed: tām u nu asya savanasya pītaye ā vaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ vedayāmasi
translated: Those of you who have drunk of this libation, O Vājas and Rbhus, we acknowledge you.

original: tad vo vājā ṛbhavaḥ supravācanaṃ deveṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanam
analyzed: tat vaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ su pravācanam deveṣu vibhvaḥ abhavat mahitvanam
translated: That, O Vājas and Rbhus, is your good deed, O all-pervading ones, which has become greatness among the gods.

original: jivrī yat santā pitarā sanājurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha
analyzed: jivrī yat santā pitarā sanā jurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha
translated: When you have made the old parents young again, so that they may move about, you have fashioned them anew.

original: ekaṃ vi cakra camasaṃ caturvayaṃ niś carmaṇo gām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: ekam vi cakra camasam caturvayam niḥ carmaṇaḥ gām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ
translated: You have made the one pot fourfold, and with thoughts you have brought the cow out of the skin.

original: athā deveṣv amṛtatvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājā ṛbhavas tad va ukthyam
analyzed: athā deveṣu amṛta tvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ tat vaḥ ukthyam
translated: Then you have obtained immortality among the gods, O Vājas and Rbhus, that is your praiseworthy deed.

original: ṛbhuto rayiḥ prathamaśravastamo vājaśrutāso yam ajījanan naraḥ
analyzed: ṛbhutaḥ rayiḥ prathama śravastamaḥ vāja śrutāsaḥ yam ajījanat naraḥ
translated: The wealth of the Rbhus, most famous from the beginning, which the men have generated, famous for strength,

original: vibhvataṣṭo vidatheṣu pravācyo yaṃ devāso 'vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: vibhva taṣṭaḥ vidatheṣu pravācyaḥ yam devāsaḥ vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Well-fashioned by the all-pervading ones, to be proclaimed in the assemblies, whom the gods have favored, he is very active.

original: sa vājy arvā sa ṛṣir vacasyayā sa śūro astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ🔽sa rāyas poṣaṃ sa suvīryaṃ dadhe yaṃ vājo vibhvām ṛbhavo yam āviṣuḥ
analyzed: sa vājī arvā saḥ ṛṣiḥ vacasyayā sa śūraḥ astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ  sa rāyaḥ poṣam sa su vīryam dadhe yam vājaḥ vibhvām ṛbhavaḥ yam āviṣuḥ
translated: He is the strong steed, he the Ṛṣi with his song, he the invincible hero in battles.🔽He has obtained the increase of wealth, the good heroism, whom Vāja, Vibhvan, and the Ṛbhus have favoured.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ vaḥ peśo adhi dhāyi darśataṃ stomo vājā ṛbhavas taṃ jujuṣṭana
analyzed: śreṣṭham vaḥ peśaḥ adhi dhāyi darśatam stomaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ tam jujuṣṭana
translated: The most beautiful form of you all has been established, O Vāja, O Ṛbhus, accept this praise.

original: dhīrāso hi ṣṭhā kavayo vipaścitas tān va enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi
analyzed: dhīrāsaḥ hi stha kavayaḥ vipaścitaḥ tān vaḥ enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi
translated: For you are wise, O wise ones, skilled in knowledge, we make you known by this prayer.

original: yūyam asmabhyaṃ dhiṣaṇābhyas pari vidvāṃso viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā
analyzed: yūyam asmabhyam dhiṣaṇābhyaḥ pari vidvāṃsaḥ viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā
translated: You, knowing all manly deeds, have been chosen by us from among the Dhiṣaṇās.

original: dyumantaṃ vājaṃ vṛṣaśuṣmam uttamam ā no rayim ṛbhavas takṣatā vayaḥ
analyzed: dyumantam vājam vṛṣa śuṣmam uttamam ā naḥ rayim ṛbhavaḥ takṣata vayaḥ
translated: O Ṛbhus, fashion for us the brilliant, strong, most excellent wealth, the strength of a bull.

original: iha prajām iha rayiṃ rarāṇā iha śravo vīravat takṣatā naḥ
analyzed: iha prajām iha rayim rarāṇāḥ iha śravaḥ vīravat takṣata naḥ
translated: Bestowing here offspring, here wealth, here fashion for us fame with heroes.

original: yena vayaṃ citayemāty anyān taṃ vājaṃ citram ṛbhavo dadā naḥ
analyzed: yena vayam citayema ati anyān tam vājam citram ṛbhavaḥ dada naḥ
translated: By which we may surpass others, O Ṛbhus, give us that brilliant strength.

original: upa no vājā adhvaram ṛbhukṣā devā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ
analyzed: upa naḥ vājāḥ adhvaram ṛbhukṣāḥ devāḥ yāta pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: O Vājas, come to our sacrifice, O Ṛbhus, come to the sacrifice by the paths of the gods.

original: yathā yajñam manuṣo vikṣv āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣv ahnām
analyzed: yathā yajñam manuṣaḥ vikṣu āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣu ahnām
translated: That you may enjoy the sacrifice among men in all the delightful days.

original: te vo hṛde manase santu yajñā juṣṭāso adya ghṛtanirṇijo guḥ
analyzed: te vaḥ hṛde manase santu yajñāḥ juṣṭāsaḥ adya ghṛta nirṇijaḥ guḥ
translated: Let your sacrifices be in your heart, in your mind, today, purifying with ghee.

original: pra vaḥ sutāso harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ sutāsaḥ harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ
translated: Your pressed juices, tawny ones, are carried forth full, delighting in the draught, gladdening in wisdom.

original: tryudāyaṃ devahitaṃ yathā va stomo vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo dade vaḥ
analyzed: tri udāyam deva hitam yathā vaḥ stomaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ dade vaḥ
translated: As the gods will, I give you the praise that brings threefold increase, O you who possess power, O you who possess strength.

original: juhve manuṣvad uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam
analyzed: juhve manuṣvat uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam
translated: I offer in the lower regions like Manu, with you as companions, the Soma in the great days.

original: pīvoaśvāḥ śucadrathā hi bhūtāyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkāḥ
analyzed: pīvaḥ aśvāḥ śucat rathāḥ hi bhūta ayaḥ śiprāḥ vājinaḥ su niṣkāḥ
translated: You are the fat-fed horses, the bright-wheeled ones, for prosperity, the strong ones with iron-tipped arrows, the well-equipped ones.

original: indrasya sūno śavaso napāto 'nu vaś cety agriyam madāya
analyzed: indrasya sūno śavasaḥ napātaḥ nu vaḥ ceti agriyam madāya
translated: O son of Indra, O offspring of power, I follow your most excellent one for the sake of joy.

original: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇo rayiṃ vāje vājintamaṃ yujam
analyzed: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ rayim vāje vājintamam yujam
translated: The Rbhukṣaṇas, the Rbhus, the wealth, the strongest in strength, the yoke,

original: indrasvantaṃ havāmahe sadāsātamam aśvinam🔽sed ṛbhavo yam avatha yūyam indraś ca martyam
analyzed: indrasvantam havāmahe sadā sātamam aśvinam  sa id ṛbhavaḥ yam avatha yūyam indraḥ ca martyam
translated: We invoke the one who possesses Indra, the one who is always praised, the one who has horses.🔽O Rbhukṣaṇas, that mortal whom you and Indra favor,

original: sa dhībhir astu sanitā medhasātā so arvatā
analyzed: sa dhībhiḥ astu sanitā medha sātā saḥ arvatā
translated: May he be the one who conquers with his thoughts, with his wisdom, and with his horse.

original: vi no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaś citana yaṣṭave
analyzed: vi naḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaḥ citana yaṣṭave
translated: O you who possess power, open for us the paths to sacrifice.

original: asmabhyaṃ sūraya stutā viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi🔽taṃ no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇa indra nāsatyā rayim
analyzed: asmabhyam sūrayaḥ stutāḥ viśvāḥ āśāḥ tarīṣaṇi  tam naḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ indra nāsatyā rayim
translated: May the lords, praised by us, conquer all the quarters for us.🔽O you who possess power, O Nāsatyas, grant us that wealth,

original: sam aśvaṃ carṣaṇibhya ā puru śasta maghattaye
analyzed: sam aśvam carṣaṇibhyaḥ ā puru śasta maghattaye
translated: O Indra, the horse to the men, for the sake of great praise.

original: uto hi vāṃ dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyas trasadasyur nitośe
analyzed: uta u hi vām dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyaḥ trasadasyuḥ nitośe
translated: For, O ye two, there are your ancient gifts, which ye bestowed on Trasadasyu for the Pūrus,

original: kṣetrāsāṃ dadathur urvarāsāṃ ghanaṃ dasyubhyo abhibhūtim ugram
analyzed: kṣetrāsām dadathuḥ urvarāsām ghanam dasyubhyaḥ abhibhūtim ugram
translated: Ye gave them the fields and the tilled lands, the strong protection of the Dasyus, O ye terrible ones.

original: uta vājinam puruniṣṣidhvānaṃ dadhikrām u dadathur viśvakṛṣṭim
analyzed: uta vājinam puru niṣṣidhvānam dadhikrām u dadathuḥ viśvakṛṣṭim
translated: And the strong one, the much-desired, Dadhikrāvan, ye gave to all the cultivators.

original: ṛjipyaṃ śyenam pruṣitapsum āśuṃ carkṛtyam aryo nṛpatiṃ na śūram
analyzed: ṛjipyam śyenam pruṣitapsum āśum carkṛtyam aryaḥ nṛpatim na śūram
translated: The swift one, the hawk, with the rain-moistened feathers, the active one, the noble one, like a king of men, the hero.

original: yaṃ sīm anu pravateva dravantaṃ viśvaḥ pūrur madati harṣamāṇaḥ
analyzed: yam sīm anu pravatā iva dravantam viśvaḥ pūruḥ madati harṣamāṇaḥ
translated: After whom, as he rushes on, like a torrent, all the Pūrus rejoice, exulting.

original: paḍbhir gṛdhyantam medhayuṃ na śūraṃ rathaturaṃ vātam iva dhrajantam🔽yaḥ smārundhāno gadhyā samatsu sanutaraś carati goṣu gachan
analyzed: paḍbhiḥ gṛdhyantam medhayum na śūram ratha turam vātam iva dhrajantam  yaḥ sma ārundhānaḥ gadhyā samatsu sanutaraḥ carati goṣu gachan
translated: The bold one, like a hero, eager for the sacrifice, borne on his chariot, rushing like the wind.🔽He who, being bound, moves about in the battles, passing through the farthest regions, going to the cows.

original: āvirṛjīko vidathā nicikyat tiro aratim pary āpa āyoḥ
analyzed: āvirṛjīkaḥ vidathā nicikyat tiras aratim pari āpaḥ āyoḥ
translated: The brilliant one, observing the sacrifices, has gone round the enemy of the people, the son of Āyu.

original: uta smainaṃ vastramathiṃ na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayo bhareṣu
analyzed: uta smā enam vastramathim na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayaḥ bhareṣu
translated: And the people cry after him, as after a falcon, the shaker of the robe, in the battles.

original: nīcāyamānaṃ jasuriṃ na śyenaṃ śravaś cāchā paśumac ca yūtham
analyzed: nīcāyamānam jasurim na śyenam śravaḥ ca achā paśumat ca yūtham
translated: The low-flying one, the swift one, like a hawk, the glory and the herd with cattle.

original: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhī rathānām
analyzed: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhiḥ rathānām
translated: And he, the first to start among us, moves along with the rows of chariots.

original: srajaṃ kṛṇvāno janyo na śubhvā reṇuṃ rerihat kiraṇaṃ dadaśvān
analyzed: srajam kṛṇvānaḥ janyaḥ na śubhvā reṇum rerihat kiraṇam dadaśvān
translated: Making a garland, like a beautiful one, the swift one, licking the dust, giving the reins,

original: uta sya vājī sahurir ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye🔽turaṃ yatīṣu turayann ṛjipyo 'dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan
analyzed: uta sya vājī sahuriḥ ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye  turam yatīṣu turayan ṛjipyaḥ dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan
translated: And his strong, truthful steed, listening with his body in the battle,🔽Speeding among the swift ones, strewing dust on his brows, longing,

original: uta smāsya tanyator iva dyor ṛghāyato abhiyujo bhayante
analyzed: uta sma asya tanyatoḥ iva dyoḥ ṛghāyataḥ abhiyujaḥ bhayante
translated: And then his enemies are afraid of him, as of the roaring sky, when he is violently attacking,

original: yadā sahasram abhi ṣīm ayodhīd durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīma ṛñjan
analyzed: yadā sahasram abhi sīm ayodhīt durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīmaḥ ṛñjan
translated: When he fights with a thousand, then he becomes invincible, terrible, longing,

original: uta smāsya panayanti janā jūtiṃ kṛṣṭipro abhibhūtim āśoḥ
analyzed: uta sma asya panayanti janāḥ jūtim kṛṣṭipraḥ abhibhūtim āśoḥ
translated: And then the people praise his speed, the lord of the people, the conqueror,

original: utainam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrā asarat sahasraiḥ
analyzed: uta enam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrāḥ asarat sahasraiḥ
translated: And they call him in the battle, saying, 'Dadhikrāvan has gone away with thousands.'

original: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya iva jyotiṣāpas tatāna
analyzed: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūryaḥ iva jyotiṣā apaḥ tatāna
translated: Dadhikrāvan, with his strength, has extended over the five peoples, like the sun with his light,

original: sahasrasāḥ śatasā vājy arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṃsi
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ śata sāḥ vājī arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṃsi
translated: The strong steed, with a thousand and a hundred, may he fill these words of ours with sweetness.

original: āśuṃ dadhikrāṃ tam u nu ṣṭavāma divas pṛthivyā uta carkirāma
analyzed: āśum dadhikrām tam u nu stavāma divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ uta carkirāma
translated: Let us praise that swift Dadhikrāvan, and let us think of him with heaven and earth.

original: uchantīr mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantv ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan
analyzed: uchantīḥ mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan
translated: May the rising dawns make me ready, and may I pass over all misfortunes.

original: mahaś carkarmy arvataḥ kratuprā dadhikrāvṇaḥ puruvārasya vṛṣṇaḥ🔽yam pūrubhyo dīdivāṃsaṃ nāgniṃ dadathur mitrāvaruṇā taturim🔽yo aśvasya dadhikrāvṇo akārīt samiddhe agnā uṣaso vyuṣṭau🔽anāgasaṃ tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇenā sajoṣāḥ🔽dadhikrāvṇa iṣa ūrjo maho yad amanmahi marutāṃ nāma bhadram
analyzed: mahaḥ carkarmi arvataḥ kratu prāḥ dadhikrāvṇaḥ puru vārasya vṛṣṇaḥ  yam pūrubhyaḥ dīdivāṃsam nā agnim dadathuḥ mitrāvaruṇā taturim  yaḥ aśvasya dadhikrāvṇaḥ akārīt samiddhe agnau uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau  anāgasam tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇena sajoṣāḥ  dadhikrāvṇaḥ iṣaḥ ūrjaḥ mahaḥ yat amanmahi marutām nāma bhadram
translated: And the great, powerful, swift-moving steed of Dadhikrâvan, the bountiful, the strong,🔽Whom, O Mitra and Varuna, ye have given to the Pûrus as a shining, swift Agni,🔽Who has performed the office of Dadhikrâvan the steed, in the kindled fire, at the rising of the dawn,🔽May Aditi make him free from sin, he who is of one mind with Mitra and Varuna.🔽When we have thought of the great food and strength of Dadhikrâvan, the auspicious name of the Maruts,

original: svastaye varuṇam mitram agniṃ havāmaha indraṃ vajrabāhum🔽indram ived ubhaye vi hvayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ🔽dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathur mitrāvaruṇā no aśvam🔽dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ🔽surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat🔽dadhikrāvṇa id u nu carkirāma viśvā in mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu🔽apām agner uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspater āṅgirasasya jiṣṇoḥ
analyzed: svastaye varuṇam mitram agnim havāmahe indram vajra bāhum 🔽indram iva id ubhaye vi hvayante udīrāṇāḥ yajñam upaprayantaḥ 🔽dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathuḥ mitrāvaruṇā naḥ aśvam 🔽dadhikrāvṇaḥ akāriṣam jiṣṇoḥ aśvasya vājinaḥ 🔽surabhi naḥ mukhā karat pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat 🔽dadhikrāvṇaḥ id u nu carkirāma viśvāḥ id mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu 🔽apām agneḥ uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspateḥ āṅgirasasya jiṣṇoḥ
translated: And the great one, the swift one, the strong one, the powerful one, the son of Aditi, the son of Dyaus, the son of Pṛthivī, the son of Varuṇa, the son of Mitra, the son of Aryaman, the son of Bhaga, the son of Tvaṣṭar, the son of Visnu, the son of Pūṣan, the son of Sarasvatī, the son of Sarasvat, the son of Agni, the son of Indra, the son of Soma, the son of the Maruts, the son of the All-gods, the son of the Rṣis, the son of the Ṛc, the son of the Sāman, the son of the Yajus, the son of the Atharvan, the son of the Angiras, the son of the Brahman, the son of the Brahmanaspati, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the gods, the son of the

original: satvā bhariṣo gaviṣo duvanyasac chravasyād iṣa uṣasas turaṇyasat
analyzed: satvā bhariṣaḥ gaviṣaḥ duvanyasad śravasyāt iṣaḥ uṣasaḥ turaṇyasad
translated: The beings, the bearers, the wise, the blowing one, the one to be praised, the food, the dawns, the swift one,

original: satyo dravo dravaraḥ pataṃgaro dadhikrāveṣam ūrjaṃ svar janat
analyzed: satyaḥ dravaḥ dravaraḥ pataṃgaraḥ dadhikrāvā iṣam ūrjam svar janat
translated: The true, the swift, the swifter, the flying one, Dadhikrāvan has produced the strength, the heaven.

original: uta smāsya dravatas turaṇyataḥ parṇaṃ na ver anu vāti pragardhinaḥ🔽śyenasyeva dhrajato aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ sahorjā taritrataḥ
analyzed: uta sma asya dravataḥ turaṇyataḥ parṇam na veḥ anu vāti pragardhinaḥ  śyenasya iva dhrajataḥ aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ saha ūrjā taritrataḥ
translated: And his swift one, the swift one who runs, blows after him like a leaf, the greedy one.🔽Like the wing of a flying bird, around the mark, Dadhikrāvan's strength, the swift one, the triple one.

original: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇiṃ turaṇyati grīvāyām baddho apikakṣa āsani
analyzed: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇim turaṇyati grīvāyām baddhaḥ apikakṣe āsani
translated: And his strong one, the swift one, hurls the dart, bound by the neck, in the armpit, in the chest.

original: kratuṃ dadhikrā anu saṃtavītvat pathām aṅkāṃsy anv āpanīphaṇat🔽haṃsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat
analyzed: kratum dadhikrāḥ anu saṃtavītvat pathām aṅkāṃsi anu āpanīphaṇat  haṃsaḥ śuci sad vasuḥ antarikṣa sad hotā vedi sad atithiḥ duroṇa sad
translated: Dadhikrāvan shall follow your will, along the paths, along the marks, he shall spread them out.🔽The swan, sitting in the pure, the good one, sitting in the atmosphere, the priest, sitting on the altar, the guest, sitting in the house,

original: nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam🔽indrā ko vāṃ varuṇā sumnam āpa stomo haviṣmāṃ amṛto na hotā🔽yo vāṃ hṛdi kratumāṃ asmad uktaḥ pasparśad indrāvaruṇā namasvān
analyzed: nṛṣad vara sad ṛta sad vyoma sad ap jāḥ go jāḥ ṛta jāḥ adri jāḥ ṛtam  indrā kaḥ vām varuṇā sumnam āpa stomaḥ haviṣmān amṛtaḥ na hotā  yaḥ vām hṛdi kratumān asmat uktaḥ pasparśat indrāvaruṇāḥ namasvān
translated: Sitting among men, sitting in the best, sitting in truth, sitting in the sky, born from the water, born from the cow, born from truth, born from the mountain, truth.🔽O Indra and Varuṇa, who shall win your favour, the hymn, rich in oblations, like an immortal priest,🔽Who, full of thought in your heart, addressed to you, shall touch you, O Indra and Varuṇa, with homage.

original: indrā ha yo varuṇā cakra āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān
analyzed: indrā ha yaḥ varuṇā cakre āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, the mortal who, full of power, has made you, the two gods, his allies,

original: sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhir vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve
analyzed: sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhiḥ vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve
translated: He slays the Vr̥itras in the battles, the foes, and hears with his great aids the invocation.

original: indrā ha ratnaṃ varuṇā dheṣṭhetthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyas tā
analyzed: indrā ha ratnam varuṇā dheṣṭhā itthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyaḥ tā
translated: Indra and Varuṇa are the best bestowers of treasure here on men who long for it.

original: yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ suprayasā mādayaite
analyzed: yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ su prayasā mādayaite
translated: If, as friends, ye be pleased with friends, with the pressed Soma, with well-ordered rites, rejoice you.

original: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā didyum asminn ojiṣṭham ugrā ni vadhiṣṭaṃ vajram
analyzed: indrā yuvam varuṇā didyum asmin ojiṣṭham ugrā ni vadhiṣṭam vajram
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, in this thunderbolt ye have the mightiest, O ye terrible ones, fix your strongest bolt.

original: yo no durevo vṛkatir dabhītis tasmin mimāthām abhibhūty ojaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ durevaḥ vṛkatiḥ dabhītiḥ tasmin mimāthām abhibhūti ojaḥ
translated: On him who is our evil-hearted wolf, our scorner, bestow ye conquering strength.

original: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā bhūtam asyā dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabheva dhenoḥ
analyzed: indrā yuvam varuṇā bhūtam asyāḥ dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabhā iva dhenoḥ
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, be ye the furtherers of this my thought, as steers of a cow.

original: sā no duhīyad yavaseva gatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī gauḥ
analyzed: sā naḥ duhīyat yavasā iva gatvī sahasra dhārā payasā mahī gauḥ
translated: May she yield to us, like a cow coming to the fodder, the great cow with a thousand streams of milk.

original: toke hite tanaya urvarāsu sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṃsye
analyzed: toke hite tanaye urvarāsu sūraḥ dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaḥ ca pauṃsye
translated: In the birth of a son, in the fields where food is stored, in the sight of the sun, in the strength of the bulls,

original: indrā no atra varuṇā syātām avobhir dasmā paritakmyāyām
analyzed: indrā naḥ atra varuṇā syātām avobhiḥ dasmā paritakmyāyām
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, be ye here, with your aids, terrible in the conflict with the foe.

original: yuvām id dhy avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī gaviṣaḥ svāpī
analyzed: yuvām id hi avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī gaviṣaḥ svāpī
translated: For you are the most bountiful, the most powerful, the most ready to help in the ancient way.

original: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitareva śambhū
analyzed: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitarā iva śambhū
translated: We choose for our dear friend, for our delight, the most liberal heroes, like two auspicious fathers.

original: tā vāṃ dhiyo 'vase vājayantīr ājiṃ na jagmur yuvayūḥ sudānū
analyzed: tāḥ vām dhiyaḥ vase vājayantīḥ ājim na jagmuḥ yuvayūḥ sudānū
translated: Those your thoughts, O bountiful ones, striving for strength, have gone to the race-course, as it were, for help.

original: śriye na gāva upa somam asthur indraṃ giro varuṇam me manīṣāḥ
analyzed: śriye na gāvaḥ upa somam asthuḥ indram giraḥ varuṇam me manīṣāḥ
translated: For glory the cows have come to the Soma; my thoughts to Indra, to Varuna.

original: imā indraṃ varuṇam me manīṣā agmann upa draviṇam ichamānāḥ
analyzed: imāḥ indram varuṇam me manīṣāḥ agman upa draviṇam ichamānāḥ
translated: These my thoughts have come to Indra, to Varuna, seeking wealth.

original: upem asthur joṣṭāra iva vasvo raghvīr iva śravaso bhikṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: upa īm asthuḥ joṣṭāraḥ iva vasvaḥ raghvīḥ iva śravasaḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ
translated: They have come to the riches, as if to enjoy, to the fame, as if to beg, like those who have much to do.

original: aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭer nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
analyzed: aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭeḥ nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
translated: May we be lords of wealth that is ever ours, of wealth that is fit for horses, fit for chariots.

original: tā cakrāṇā ūtibhir navyasībhir asmatrā rāyo niyutaḥ sacantām
analyzed: tā cakrāṇau ūtibhiḥ navyasībhiḥ asmatrā rāyaḥ niyutaḥ sacantām
translated: May their new aids, their protections, come to us, and their teams of wealth.

original: ā no bṛhantā bṛhatībhir ūtī indra yātaṃ varuṇa vājasātau
analyzed: ā naḥ bṛhantā bṛhatībhiḥ ūtī indra yātam varuṇa vājasātau
translated: O ye bountiful ones, come hither with great aids, O Indra, O Varuna, to the winning of strength,

original: yad didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḷān tasya vāṃ syāma sanitāra ājeḥ
analyzed: yat didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḍān tasya vām syāma sanitāraḥ ājeḥ
translated: When the thunderers are sporting in the battles, may we be the winners of booty in your contests.

original: mama dvitā rāṣṭraṃ kṣatriyasya viśvāyor viśve amṛtā yathā naḥ
analyzed: mama dvitā rāṣṭram kṣatriyasya viśvāyoḥ viśve amṛtāḥ yathā naḥ
translated: On this day may the kingdom of the Kshatriya be prosperous for me, as all the immortals are for Vishvâyu.

original: kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ
analyzed: kratum sacante varuṇasya devāḥ rājāmi kṛṣṭeḥ upamasya vavreḥ
translated: The gods attend on the wisdom of Varuna, I rule over the people, over the people of the king.

original: ahaṃ rājā varuṇo mahyaṃ tāny asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta
analyzed: aham rājā varuṇaḥ mahyam tāni asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta
translated: I am king Varuna; to me the Asura powers first gave (the charge of) these (waters).

original: kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ
analyzed: kratum sacante varuṇasya devāḥ rājāmi kṛṣṭeḥ upamasya vavreḥ
translated: The gods attend on the sacrifice of Varuṇa, I on the king's command of the wide-ruling one.

original: aham indro varuṇas te mahitvorvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke
analyzed: aham indraḥ varuṇaḥ te mahitvā urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke
translated: I am Indra and Varuṇa of your greatness, the two deep and well-formed regions of the sky.

original: tvaṣṭeva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayaṃ rodasī dhārayaṃ ca
analyzed: tvaṣṭā iva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayam rodasī dhārayam ca
translated: Like Tvaṣṭṛ, knowing all beings, I have brought together the two worlds and support them.

original: aham apo apinvam ukṣamāṇā dhārayaṃ divaṃ sadana ṛtasya
analyzed: aham apaḥ apinvam ukṣamāṇāḥ dhārayam divam sadane ṛtasya
translated: I have caused the waters to swell, pouring forth, I support the heaven, the seat of truth.

original: ṛtena putro aditer ṛtāvota tridhātu prathayad vi bhūma
analyzed: ṛtena putraḥ aditeḥ ṛtāvā uta tridhātu prathayat vi bhūma
translated: By law, the son of Aditi, by law, the three-fold one has spread out the earth.

original: māṃ naraḥ svaśvā vājayanto māṃ vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante
analyzed: mām naraḥ su aśvāḥ vājayantaḥ mām vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante
translated: Men with good horses, striving for strength, call on me, the surrounded ones in the battle.

original: kṛṇomy ājim maghavāham indra iyarmi reṇum abhibhūtyojāḥ
analyzed: kṛṇomi ājim maghavā aham indraḥ iyarmi reṇum abhibhūti ojāḥ
translated: I make the race, I, Indra, the bearer of wealth, I stir up the dust, with overpowering strength.

original: ahaṃ tā viśvā cakaraṃ nakir mā daivyaṃ saho varate apratītam
analyzed: aham tā viśvā cakaram nakir mā daivyam sahaḥ varate apratītam
translated: I have done all that, none can resist my divine strength and vow.

original: yan mā somāso mamadan yad ukthobhe bhayete rajasī apāre
analyzed: yat mā somāsaḥ mamadan yat ukthā ubhe bhayete rajasī apāre
translated: When the Soma-pressers have made me joyful, when both the boundless regions are afraid of me,

original: viduṣ te viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ
analyzed: viduḥ te viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ
translated: You know all the existing things, O wise one, you proclaim them to Varuṇa.

original: tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn
analyzed: tvam vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvam vṛtām ariṇāḥ indra sindhūn
translated: You hear the Vr̥itras, you who have struck down the Vr̥itras, O Indra, you have crossed the rivers.

original: asmākam atra pitaras ta āsan sapta ṛṣayo daurgahe badhyamāne
analyzed: asmākam atra pitaraḥ te āsan sapta ṛṣayaḥ daurgahe badhyamāne
translated: Our fathers were there, the seven Rishis, when the difficult one was being bound.

original: ta āyajanta trasadasyum asyā indraṃ na vṛtraturam ardhadevam
analyzed: te āyajanta trasadasyum asyāḥ indram na vṛtra turam ardha devam
translated: They worshipped Trasadasyu of this (earth), Indra who conquers foes, the god of half (the people).

original: purukutsānī hi vām adāśad dhavyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
analyzed: purukutsānī hi vām adāśat havyebhiḥ indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
translated: For Purukutsa's son has served you, O Indra and Varuna, with oblations and adorations.

original: athā rājānaṃ trasadasyum asyā vṛtrahaṇaṃ dadathur ardhadevam
analyzed: athā rājānam trasadasyum asyāḥ vṛtra haṇam dadathuḥ ardha devam
translated: Then give ye the king Trasadasyu of this (earth), the foe-destroyer, the god of half (the people).

original: rāyā vayaṃ sasavāṃso madema havyena devā yavasena gāvaḥ
analyzed: rāyā vayam sasavāṃsaḥ madema havyena devāḥ yavasena gāvaḥ
translated: Through wealth may we rejoice together, O gods, through oblations, and the kine through pasture.

original: tāṃ dhenum indrāvaruṇā yuvaṃ no viśvāhā dhattam anapasphurantīm🔽ka u śravat katamo yajñiyānāṃ vandāru devaḥ katamo juṣāte🔽kasyemāṃ devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhāṃ hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutiṃ suhavyām
analyzed: tām dhenum indrāvaruṇāḥ yuvam naḥ viśvāhā dhattam an apasphurantīm  kaḥ u śravat katamaḥ yajñiyānām vandāru devaḥ katamaḥ juṣāte  kasya imām devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhām hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutim su havyām
translated: That milch cow, O Indra and Varuna, grant ye to us, that never fails, all the days of the year.🔽Who is the most famous, of the gods worthy of sacrifice? Which god accepts the invocation?🔽Whose is this divine one, most dear among the immortals? In whose heart do we place the hymn of praise, the easy to invoke?

original: ko mṛḷāti katama āgamiṣṭho devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ mṛḍāti katamaḥ āgamiṣṭhaḥ devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: Who is the most merciful, who the most frequent visitor of the gods, who the most auspicious of the gods?

original: rathaṃ kam āhur dravadaśvam āśuṃ yaṃ sūryasya duhitāvṛṇīta
analyzed: ratham kam āhuḥ dravat aśvam āśum yam sūryasya duhitā avṛṇīta
translated: What chariot do they call swift, with fleet horses, which the daughter of the sun has chosen?

original: makṣū hi ṣmā gachatha īvato dyūn indro na śaktim paritakmyāyām
analyzed: makṣū hi sma gacchathaḥ īvataḥ dyūn indraḥ na śaktim paritakmyāyām
translated: For quickly ye come to the houses of the rich, as Indra to the shaking of the thunderbolt.

original: diva ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā
analyzed: divaḥ ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā
translated: Born from the sky, ye heavenly birds of fair feathers, with what power are ye the most powerful of the mighty?

original: kā vām bhūd upamātiḥ kayā na āśvinā gamatho hūyamānā
analyzed: kā vām bhūt upamātiḥ kayā naḥ āśvinā gamathaḥ hūyamānā
translated: What is your most excellent comparison? By what are you, O Aṣvins, invoked to come?

original: ko vām mahaś cit tyajaso abhīka uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī
analyzed: kaḥ vām mahaḥ cit tyajasaḥ abhīke uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā naḥ ūtī
translated: What is your most mighty deed, O ye who are not to be deceived? Protect us, O ye wondrous, with your help, O ye who love the sweet.

original: uru vāṃ rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrād abhi vartate vām
analyzed: uru vām rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrāt abhi vartate vām
translated: Wide is your chariot-path that goes round the sky, when it comes to you from the ocean.

original: madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīṃ vām pṛkṣo bhurajanta pakvāḥ
analyzed: madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīm vām pṛkṣaḥ bhurajanta pakvāḥ
translated: O ye who love the sweet, the sweet of you two, sprinkling you with meath, when your two portions are being cooked and move.

original: sindhur ha vāṃ rasayā siñcad aśvān ghṛṇā vayo 'ruṣāsaḥ pari gman🔽tad ū ṣu vām ajiraṃ ceti yānaṃ yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ
analyzed: sindhuḥ ha vām rasayā siñcat aśvān ghṛṇāḥ vayaḥ ruṣāsaḥ pari gman  tat u su vām ajiram ceti yānam yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ
translated: The river, O ye who love the sweet, shall sprinkle your horses with juice, with ghee, with ruddy wings, around the air.🔽That swift-moving chariot of yours, by which ye are the lords of Sûryâ, that we invoke.

original: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā
analyzed: iha iha yat vām samanā sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā
translated: Here, here, what I desire to obtain from you both, this favour of yours, O ye who have treasure in your hands, is for us.

original: uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik
analyzed: uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik
translated: Protect ye the singer, O ye two, for to you is come the desire, O Nâsatyas, that is to be fulfilled.

original: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃgatiṃ goḥ
analyzed: tam vām ratham vayam adya ā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃgatim goḥ
translated: That chariot of yours, O ye Aṣvins, we will invoke this day, the far-famed, the meeting-place of the cow,

original: yaḥ sūryāṃ vahati vandhurāyur girvāhasam purutamaṃ vasūyum
analyzed: yaḥ sūryām vahati vandhurāyuḥ gir vāhasam purutamam vasūyum
translated: Which carries Sûryâ, the friend, the life, the bearer of songs, the most abundant, the possessor of wealth.

original: yuvaṃ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṃ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ
analyzed: yuvam śriyam aśvinā devatā tām divaḥ napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: Ye, O Aṣvins, are the deities of glory. Ye, O ye who rain from the sky, bestow it with your powers.

original: yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām
analyzed: yuvoḥ vapuḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāsaḥ rathe vām
translated: The drops attend on your form, which the humpbacked ones carry in your chariot.

original: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ
analyzed: kaḥ vām adyā karate rāta havyaḥ ūtaye vā suta peyāya vā arkaiḥ
translated: Who will bring you today, O you to whom oblations are offered, for help or to drink the Soma, with praises?

original: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namo yemāno aśvinā vavartat
analyzed: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namaḥ yemānaḥ aśvinā vavartat
translated: Or to the ancient observance of truth, the homage offered, O Aśvins, has turned.

original: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathenemaṃ yajñaṃ nāsatyopa yātam
analyzed: hiraṇyayena puru bhū rathena imam yajñam nāsatyā upa yātam
translated: Come to this sacrifice, O Nāsatyas, with your golden chariot that goes to many places.

original: pibātha in madhunaḥ somyasya dadhatho ratnaṃ vidhate janāya
analyzed: pibāthaḥ id madhunaḥ somyasya dadhathaḥ ratnam vidhate janāya
translated: Drink of this sweet Soma, and bestow treasure on the man who offers.

original: ā no yātaṃ divo achā pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena
analyzed: ā naḥ yātam divaḥ achā pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena
translated: Come to us from heaven and from earth, with your golden well-constructed chariot.

original: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ saṃ yad dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām
analyzed: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ sam yat dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām
translated: Let not others who honor the gods separate you, since the ancient navel has been given to you.

original: nū no rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṃ dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣv asme
analyzed: nu naḥ rayim puru vīram bṛhantam dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣu asme
translated: Now, O wonder-workers, fashion for us wealth with many heroes, for both of us.

original: naro yad vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḷhāso agman
analyzed: naraḥ yat vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḍhāsaḥ agman
translated: When the men, O Aśvins, have come to your praise and assembly, to the place of worship.

original: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā
analyzed: iha iha yat vām samanā sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā
translated: Here, here, as I long for you, may this favor of yours, rich in treasure, be with us.

original: uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik
analyzed: uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik
translated: Protect the singer, O you two, for the desire that has come to you, O Nāsatyas, is great.

original: eṣa sya bhānur ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divo asya sānavi
analyzed: eṣa sya bhānuḥ ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divaḥ asya sānavi
translated: This his light rises, the chariot is yoked on the ridge of the sky, the ever-rolling one

original: pṛkṣāso asmin mithunā adhi trayo dṛtis turīyo madhuno vi rapśate
analyzed: pṛkṣāsaḥ asmin mithunāḥ adhi trayaḥ dṛtiḥ turīyaḥ madhunaḥ vi rapśate
translated: Three pairs of creatures are in this one, the fourth is a bag that bursts with honey

original: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanta īrate rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu
analyzed: ud vām pṛkṣāsaḥ madhumantaḥ īrate rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: Your honey-rich powers move forth, the chariots, the horses, at the break of dawn

original: aporṇuvantas tama ā parīvṛtaṃ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ
analyzed: aporṇuvantaḥ tamaḥ ā parīvṛtam svar na śukram tanvantaḥ ā rajaḥ
translated: Uncovering the darkness that surrounds it, they spread out the bright light in the sky

original: madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhir uta priyam madhune yuñjāthāṃ ratham
analyzed: madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhiḥ āsabhiḥ uta priyam madhune yuñjāthām ratham
translated: Drink the sweet drink with your honey-sweet mouths, and yoke your dear chariot with the sweet drink

original: ā vartanim madhunā jinvathas patho dṛtiṃ vahethe madhumantam aśvinā
analyzed: ā vartanim madhunā jinvathaḥ pathaḥ dṛtim vahethe madhumantam aśvinā
translated: You quicken the path with sweetness for your journey, O Aśvins, you carry the honey-rich bag

original: haṃsāso ye vām madhumanto asridho hiraṇyaparṇā uhuva uṣarbudhaḥ🔽udapruto mandino mandinispṛśo madhvo na makṣaḥ savanāni gachathaḥ
analyzed: haṃsāsaḥ ye vām madhumantaḥ asridhaḥ hiraṇya parṇāḥ uhuve uṣarbudhaḥ  uda prutaḥ mandinaḥ mandi nispṛśaḥ madhvaḥ na makṣaḥ savanāni gachathaḥ
translated: The geese that are yours, rich in honey, unsoiled, with golden wings, swift to rise at dawn🔽Swift, rushing through the water, delighting in joy, you come to the libations like a bee to honey

original: svadhvarāso madhumanto agnaya usrā jarante prati vastor aśvinā
analyzed: su adhvarāsaḥ madhumantaḥ agnayaḥ usrāḥ jarante prati vastoḥ aśvinā
translated: The hearths are rich in honey, O Aśvins, the dawns sing to you at daybreak

original: yan niktahastas taraṇir vicakṣaṇaḥ somaṃ suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ
analyzed: yat nikta hastaḥ taraṇiḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ somam suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ
translated: When the deft, swift, discerning one with pure hands has pressed the sweet Soma with the stones

original: ākenipāso ahabhir davidhvataḥ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ🔽sūraś cid aśvān yuyujāna īyate viśvāṃ anu svadhayā cetathas pathaḥ
analyzed: ākenipāsaḥ ahabhiḥ davidhvataḥ svar na śukram tanvantaḥ ā rajaḥ  sūraḥ cit aśvān yuyujānaḥ īyate viśvān anu svadhayā cetathaḥ pathaḥ
translated: The swift ones, with the days, have spread out the bright light in the sky🔽Even the sun, yoking his horses, moves along, you two, by your own nature, mark out all the paths

original: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṃdhā rathaḥ svaśvo ajaro yo asti
analyzed: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṃdhāḥ rathaḥ su aśvaḥ ajaraḥ yaḥ asti
translated: I have proclaimed to you, O you who find wisdom, O Aśvins, the chariot with good horses, which is undecaying

original: yena sadyaḥ pari rajāṃsi yātho haviṣmantaṃ taraṇim bhojam acha
analyzed: yena sadyas pari rajāṃsi yāthaḥ haviṣmantam taraṇim bhojam acha
translated: By which you quickly traverse the realms, to the swift one who offers, to the one who entertains

original: agram pibā madhūnāṃ sutaṃ vāyo diviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: agram pibā madhūnām sutam vāyo diviṣṭiṣu
translated: Drink first of the sweet juices pressed, O Vayu, in the sacrifices in the sky

original: tvaṃ hi pūrvapā asi
analyzed: tvam hi pūrva pāḥ asi
translated: For you are the first to eat

original: śatenā no abhiṣṭibhir niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ
analyzed: śatena ā naḥ abhiṣṭibhiḥ niyutvān indra sārathiḥ
translated: With a hundred protections, O you who have a team, O Indra's charioteer

original: vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam
analyzed: vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam
translated: O Vayu, be satisfied with the pressed (juice)

original: ā vāṃ sahasraṃ haraya indravāyū abhi prayaḥ
analyzed: ā vām sahasram harayaḥ indra vāyū abhi prayaḥ
translated: May a hundred tawny (horses), O Indra and Vayu, bring you to the offering

original: vahantu somapītaye
analyzed: vahantu soma pītaye
translated: To drink the Soma

original: rathaṃ hiraṇyavandhuram indravāyū svadhvaram
analyzed: ratham hiraṇya vandhuram indra vāyū su adhvaram
translated: The chariot with a golden seat, O Indra and Vayu, which is well-ordered

original: ā hi sthātho divispṛśam
analyzed: ā hi sthāthaḥ divispṛśam
translated: For you shall stand, touching the sky

original: rathena pṛthupājasā dāśvāṃsam upa gachatam
analyzed: rathena pṛthu pājasā dāśvāṃsam upa gacchatam
translated: With a chariot of wide prosperity go to the one who offers

original: indravāyū ihā gatam
analyzed: indra vāyū iha ā gatam
translated: O Indra and Vayu, come hither

original: indravāyū ayaṃ sutas taṃ devebhiḥ sajoṣasā
analyzed: indra vāyū ayam sutaḥ tam devebhiḥ sajoṣasā
translated: O Indra and Vayu, this is the pressed (juice); drink it in unison with the gods

original: pibataṃ dāśuṣo gṛhe
analyzed: pibatam dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: In the house of the one who offers

original: iha prayāṇam astu vām indravāyū vimocanam
analyzed: iha prayāṇam astu vām indra vāyū vimocanam
translated: Here let there be your journey, O Indra and Vayu, your release

original: iha vāṃ somapītaye
analyzed: iha vām soma pītaye
translated: Here for you to drink Soma

original: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo agraṃ diviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: vāyo śukraḥ ayāmi te madhvaḥ agram diviṣṭiṣu
translated: O Vayu, I send forth to you the pure first portion of the sweet drink at the feasts in heaven

original: ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā
analyzed: ā yāhi soma pītaye spārhaḥ deva niyutvatā
translated: Come to drink the Soma, O desired-for god, with your team

original: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ somānām pītim arhathaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ ca vāyo eṣām somānām pītim arhathaḥ
translated: You, Indra and Vayu, are worthy to drink of these Soma juices

original: yuvāṃ hi yantīndavo nimnam āpo na sadhryak
analyzed: yuvām hi yanti indavaḥ nimnam āpaḥ na sadhryak
translated: For the drops come to you, as the waters to the low-lying place, together

original: vāyav indraś ca śuṣmiṇā sarathaṃ śavasas patī
analyzed: vāyo indraḥ ca śuṣmiṇā sa ratham śavasaḥ patī
translated: O Vayu and Indra, with your strong chariots, lords of power

original: niyutvantā na ūtaya ā yātaṃ somapītaye🔽yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā
analyzed: niyutvantā naḥ ūtaye ā yātam soma pītaye  yāḥ vām santi puruspṛhaḥ niyutaḥ dāśuṣe narā
translated: With your teams come to the feast, to drink the Soma🔽Those teams of yours, O heroes, which are much desired by the worshipper

original: asme tā yajñavāhasendravāyū ni yachatam
analyzed: asme tā yajña vāhasā indra vāyū ni yacchatam
translated: Bestow them on us, O Indra and Vayu, who bring the sacrifice

original: vihi hotrā avītā vipo na rāyo aryaḥ
analyzed: vihi hotrāḥ a vītāḥ vipaḥ na rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: Open the doors, O bountiful one, open the doors to wealth

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come with your bright chariot to drink the pressed Soma

original: niryuvāṇo aśastīr niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ
analyzed: niryuvāṇaḥ aśastīḥ niyutvān indra sārathiḥ
translated: Driving away the curses, O you with a team, with Indra as your charioteer

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye🔽anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī yemāte viśvapeśasā
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye  anu kṛṣṇe vasu dhitī yemāte viśva peśasā
translated: O Vayu, come with your bright chariot to drink the pressed Soma🔽Those two, dark and light, which are placed here, all-formed, bestowing wealth

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come with your bright chariot to drink the pressed Soma

original: vahantu tvā manoyujo yuktāso navatir nava
analyzed: vahantu tvā manaḥ yujaḥ yuktāsaḥ navatiḥ nava
translated: May the yoked ones, yoked by the mind, ninety-nine

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come with your bright chariot to drink the pressed Soma

original: vāyo śataṃ harīṇāṃ yuvasva poṣyāṇām
analyzed: vāyo śatam harīṇām yuvasva poṣyāṇām
translated: O Vayu, yoke thy hundred tawny steeds worthy of praise,

original: uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā
analyzed: uta vā te sahasriṇaḥ rathaḥ ā yātu pājasā
translated: Or may thy thousand-fold chariot come hither with speed.

original: idaṃ vām āsy haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī
analyzed: idam vām āsi haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī
translated: This is your dear oblation, O Indra and Brhaspati,

original: uktham madaś ca śasyate
analyzed: uktham madaḥ ca śasyate
translated: Praise and joy are extolled.

original: ayaṃ vām pari ṣicyate soma indrābṛhaspatī
analyzed: ayam vām pari sicyate somaḥ indrābṛhaspatī
translated: This Soma is poured around for you, O Indra and Brhaspati,

original: cārur madāya pītaye
analyzed: cāruḥ madāya pītaye
translated: Delightful for joy and drinking.

original: ā na indrābṛhaspatī gṛham indraś ca gachatam
analyzed: ā naḥ indrābṛhaspatī gṛham indraḥ ca gacchatam
translated: O Indra and Brhaspati, come to our house, O Indra,

original: somapā somapītaye
analyzed: soma pā soma pītaye
translated: To drink the Soma, to drink the Soma.

original: asme indrābṛhaspatī rayiṃ dhattaṃ śatagvinam
analyzed: asme indrābṛhaspatī rayim dhattam śatagvinam
translated: O Indra and Brhaspati, bestow upon us wealth of a hundred (head of cattle),

original: aśvāvantaṃ sahasriṇam
analyzed: aśvāvantam sahasriṇam
translated: Of a thousand head of cattle.

original: indrābṛhaspatī vayaṃ sute gīrbhir havāmahe
analyzed: indrābṛhaspatī vayam sute gīrbhiḥ havāmahe
translated: O Indra and Brhaspati, we invoke with songs at the pressing,

original: asya somasya pītaye
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: To drink this Soma.

original: somam indrābṛhaspatī pibataṃ dāśuṣo gṛhe
analyzed: somam indrābṛhaspatī pibatam dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: O Indra and Brhaspati, drink the Soma in the worshipper's house,

original: mādayethāṃ tadokasā
analyzed: mādayethām tad okasā
translated: To delight you, to that abode.

original: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa
analyzed: yaḥ tastambha sahasā vi jmaḥ antān bṛhaspatiḥ triṣadhasthaḥ raveṇa
translated: He who with might hath propped the ends of the earth, Brhaspati, he who is in the three stations with his roar,

original: tam pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam
analyzed: tam pratnāsaḥ ṛṣayaḥ dīdhyānāḥ puras viprāḥ dadhire mandra jihvam
translated: Him the ancient sages, meditating, the priests have placed in the beginning, he who hath a sweet tongue.

original: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre
analyzed: dhunetayaḥ su praketam madantaḥ bṛhaspate abhi ye naḥ tatasre
translated: O Brhaspati, those who have sought to assail us, the swift ones, rejoicing in good signs,

original: pṛṣantaṃ sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim
analyzed: pṛṣantam sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatāt asya yonim
translated: O Brihaspati, protect his unfailing, strong, and safe abode.

original: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā ta ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvat atas ā te ṛta spṛśaḥ ni seduḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, those who touch the truth have sat down here from the highest distance.

original: tubhyaṃ khātā avatā adridugdhā madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam
analyzed: tubhyam khātāḥ avatāḥ adri dugdhāḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam
translated: For you, O Brihaspati, the dug-out wells, dug by the rock, flow around with honey, with their lips extended.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman
translated: Brihaspati, being born first, in the highest heaven, in the great light,

original: saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṃsi
analyzed: sapta āsyaḥ tuvi jātaḥ raveṇa vi sapta raśmiḥ adhamat tamāṃsi
translated: With seven mouths, greatly born, with his radiance, with seven rays, he has dispelled the darkness.

original: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā gaṇena valaṃ ruroja phaligaṃ raveṇa
analyzed: sa suṣṭubhā saḥ ṛkvatā gaṇena valam ruroja phaligam raveṇa
translated: He, with the Stomas, with the Rik verses, with the host, has shattered Vala and Flig with his radiance.

original: bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ usriyāḥ havyasūdaḥ kanikradat vāvaśatīḥ ud ājat
translated: Brihaspati, the invoker of the gods, has risen up with the lowing, eager cows.

original: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
analyzed: eva pitre viśva devāya vṛṣṇe yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
translated: Thus let us serve with sacrifice, with homage, with oblations, the father, the all-god, the mighty one.

original: bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām
analyzed: bṛhaspate su prajāḥ vīravantaḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: O Brihaspati, may we be prosperous, having good offspring and heroic sons, lords of wealth.

original: sa id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthāv abhi vīryṇa
analyzed: saḥ id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthau abhi
translated: He indeed is the king, with his might he has stood over all the peoples, with his heroic power.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ yaḥ subhṛtam bibharti valgūyati vandate pūrvabhājam
analyzed: bṛhaspatim yaḥ su bhṛtam bibharti valgūyati vandate pūrvabhājam
translated: He who supports well the well-supported Brihaspati, praises him, worships him, the first to receive.

original: sa it kṣeti sudhita okasi sve tasmā iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm
analyzed: saḥ id kṣeti sudhite okasi sve tasmai iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm
translated: He dwells happily in his own well-ordered abode; for him Ilā swells at all times.

original: tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrva eti
analyzed: tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrvaḥ eti
translated: To him the people bow of their own accord, in whom the Brahman priest goes forth as the king's forerunner.

original: apratīto jayati saṃ dhanāni pratijanyāny uta yā sajanyā
analyzed: apratītaḥ jayati sam dhanāni pratijanyāni uta yā sajanyā
translated: He wins the spoils unopposed, and those of his opponents as well,

original: avasyave yo varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ
analyzed: avasyave yaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ
translated: whom the king favors with room to move for one in need. The gods help him whom the king favors.

original: indraś ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū
analyzed: indraḥ ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: O Indra and Brhaspati, rejoice in the Soma at this sacrifice, O you whose wealth is mighty.

original: ā vāṃ viśantv indavaḥ svābhuvo 'sme rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yachatam
analyzed: ā vām viśantu indavaḥ su ābhuvaḥ sme rayim sarva vīram ni yacchatam
translated: Let your own-moving drops enter into you; bestow upon us wealth with all heroes.

original: bṛhaspata indra vardhataṃ naḥ sacā sā vāṃ sumatir bhūtv asme
analyzed: bṛhaspate indra vardhatam naḥ sacā sā vām sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: O Brhaspati and Indra, prosper us together; may your favor be with us.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtam puraṃdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam puraṃdhīḥ jajastam aryaḥ vanuṣām arātīḥ
translated: Accept the inspired thoughts, the wise ones; destroy the evil designs of the enemies.

original: idam u tyat purutamam purastāj jyotis tamaso vayunāvad asthāt
analyzed: idam u tyad purutamam purastāt jyotiḥ tamasaḥ vayunāvat asthāt
translated: This light hath risen in front, most abundant, dispelling the darkness from the sky.

original: nūnaṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīr gātuṃ kṛṇavann uṣaso janāya
analyzed: nūnam divaḥ duhitaraḥ vibhātīḥ gātum kṛṇavan uṣasaḥ janāya
translated: The shining daughters of the sky, the dawns, have made their way for the people.

original: asthur u citrā uṣasaḥ purastān mitā iva svaravo 'dhvareṣu
analyzed: asthuḥ u citrāḥ uṣasaḥ purastāt mitāḥ iva svaravaḥ dhvareṣu
translated: The wondrous dawns have stood in front, like measured posts at sacrifices.

original: vy ū vrajasya tamaso dvārochantīr avrañ chucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
analyzed: vi ū vrajasya tamasaḥ dvārā ūchantīḥ avram śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: The pure, purifying ones have opened the doors of the stall, the darkness, and have shone forth.

original: uchantīr adya citayanta bhojān rādhodeyāyoṣaso maghonīḥ
analyzed: uchantīḥ adya citayanta bhojān rādhaḥ deyāya uṣasaḥ maghonīḥ
translated: Shining today, they think of the bountiful gifts, the rich, generous dawns that bring wealth.

original: acitre antaḥ paṇayaḥ sasantv abudhyamānās tamaso vimadhye
analyzed: acitre antar paṇayaḥ sasantu a budhyamānāḥ tamasaḥ vimadhye
translated: Let the merchants be in the indistinct, unknowing, in the middle of darkness.

original: kuvit sa devīḥ sanayo navo vā yāmo babhūyād uṣaso vo adya🔽yenā navagve aṅgire daśagve saptāsye revatī revad ūṣa
analyzed: kuvid sa devīḥ sanayaḥ navaḥ vā yāmaḥ babhūyāt uṣasaḥ vaḥ adya  yena navagve aṅgire daśagve sapta āsye revatī revat ūṣa
translated: Will he not become a new or old messenger of yours, O divine dawns, today?🔽By which (messenger) you, O rich ones, will come to the rich Navagva, Angiras, Dasagva, Saptasya.

original: yūyaṃ hi devīr ṛtayugbhir aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyaḥ
analyzed: yūyam hi devīḥ ṛta yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyas
translated: For you, O divine ones, with your righteous horses, go round all the worlds in a moment.

original: prabodhayantīr uṣasaḥ sasantaṃ dvipāc catuṣpāc carathāya jīvam
analyzed: prabodhayantīḥ uṣasaḥ sasantam dvipād catuṣpād carathāya jīvam
translated: Awakening the dawns, the living being, two-footed and four-footed, to move about.

original: kva svid āsāṃ katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhur ṛbhūṇām
analyzed: kva svid āsām katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhuḥ ṛbhūṇām
translated: Where are they, which of them is the oldest, by which the Rbhus have established the ordinances?

original: śubhaṃ yac chubhrā uṣasaś caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīr ajuryāḥ
analyzed: śubham yat śubhrāḥ uṣasaḥ caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīḥ ajuryāḥ
translated: The auspicious which the auspicious dawns move, they are not known to be similar, undecaying.

original: tā ghā tā bhadrā uṣasaḥ purāsur abhiṣṭidyumnā ṛtajātasatyāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ gha tāḥ bhadrāḥ uṣasaḥ purā āsuḥ abhiṣṭi dyumnāḥ ṛta jāta satyāḥ
translated: Those indeed are the auspicious dawns of old, with glory to be guarded, born of truth, true.

original: yāsv ījānaḥ śaśamāna ukthai stuvañ chaṃsan draviṇaṃ sadya āpa
analyzed: yāsu ījānaḥ śaśamānaḥ ukthaiḥ stuvam chaṃsan draviṇam sadyas āpa
translated: By which (dawn) the sacrificer, striving with praises, singing, extolling, quickly obtains wealth.

original: tā ā caranti samanā purastāt samānataḥ samanā paprathānāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ ā caranti samanā purastāt samānatas samanā paprathānāḥ
translated: They move together, the same in front, the same in the middle, the same in the end.

original: ṛtasya devīḥ sadaso budhānā gavāṃ na sargā uṣaso jarante🔽tā in nv eva samanā samānīr amītavarṇā uṣasaś caranti
analyzed: ṛtasya devīḥ sadasaḥ budhānāḥ gavām na sargāḥ uṣasaḥ jarante  tāḥ id nu eva samanā samānīḥ amīta varṇāḥ uṣasaḥ caranti
translated: The goddesses of truth, the finders of the seat, the dawns, like the streams of milk, are singing.🔽These very same dawns, of the same form, of the same appearance, move together.

original: gūhantīr abhvam asitaṃ ruśadbhiḥ śukrās tanūbhiḥ śucayo rucānāḥ
analyzed: gūhantīḥ abhvam asitam ruśadbhiḥ śukrāḥ tanūbhiḥ śucayaḥ rucānāḥ
translated: Concealing the fearful darkness with their ruddy forms, the bright ones shine with pure bodies.

original: rayiṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīḥ prajāvantaṃ yachatāsmāsu devīḥ
analyzed: rayim divaḥ duhitaraḥ vibhātīḥ prajāvantam yacchata asmāsu devīḥ
translated: O daughters of heaven, the shining ones, grant us wealth, O goddesses, bestowing offspring.

original: syonād ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
analyzed: syonāt ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: May we be the lords of good heroism, O you who are awakened from the auspicious.

original: tad vo divo duhitaro vibhātīr upa bruva uṣaso yajñaketuḥ
analyzed: tat vaḥ divaḥ duhitaraḥ vibhātīḥ upa bruve uṣasaḥ yajña ketuḥ
translated: To you, O daughters of heaven, the shining ones, I speak, O dawns, the banner of the sacrifice.

original: vayaṃ syāma yaśaso janeṣu tad dyauś ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī
analyzed: vayam syāma yaśasaḥ janeṣu tat dyauḥ ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī
translated: May we be famous among the people, and may heaven and the goddess earth grant that.

original: prati ṣyā sūnarī janī vyuchantī pari svasuḥ
analyzed: prati syā sūnarī janī vyuchantī pari svasuḥ
translated: The auspicious young woman, shining, rising, around her sister,

original: divo adarśi duhitā
analyzed: divaḥ adarśi duhitā
translated: The daughter of heaven is seen.

original: aśveva citrāruṣī mātā gavām ṛtāvarī
analyzed: aśvā iva citrā aruṣī mātā gavām ṛtāvarī
translated: Like a horse, variegated, impetuous, the mother of cows, of true vows,

original: sakhābhūd aśvinor uṣāḥ
analyzed: sakhā abhūt aśvinoḥ uṣāḥ
translated: Dawn has become the friend of the Ashvins.

original: uta sakhāsy aśvinor uta mātā gavām asi
analyzed: uta sakhā asi aśvinoḥ uta mātā gavām asi
translated: And you are the friend of the Ashvins, and the mother of cows,

original: utoṣo vasva īśiṣe
analyzed: uta uṣaḥ vasvaḥ īśiṣe
translated: And, O Ushas, you rule over wealth.

original: yāvayaddveṣasaṃ tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari
analyzed: yāvayat dveṣasam tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari
translated: I have sought you, O you who are rich in good deeds, to dispel hatred.

original: prati stomair abhutsmahi
analyzed: prati stomaiḥ abhutsmahi
translated: We have rejoiced with praises

original: prati bhadrā adṛkṣata gavāṃ sargā na raśmayaḥ🔽oṣā aprā uru jrayaḥ
analyzed: prati bhadrāḥ adṛkṣata gavām sargāḥ na raśmayaḥ  oṣāḥ aprāḥ uru jrayaḥ
translated: We have seen the auspicious, the streams of milk, like rays🔽The far-reaching have flowed forth

original: āpapruṣī vibhāvari vy āvar jyotiṣā tamaḥ
analyzed: āpapruṣī vibhāvari vi āvaḥ jyotiṣā tamaḥ
translated: The rain-shower, the light-bringer, has dispersed the darkness with light

original: uṣo anu svadhām ava
analyzed: uṣaḥ anu svadhām ava
translated: O Dawn, according to your own nature

original: ā dyāṃ tanoṣi raśmibhir āntarikṣam uru priyam
analyzed: ā dyām tanoṣi raśmibhiḥ ā antarikṣam uru priyam
translated: You extend the sky with your rays, the vast and beloved atmosphere
