original: uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā🔽tad devasya savitur vāryam mahad vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ
analyzed: uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā  tat devasya savituḥ vāryam mahat vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ
translated: O Dawn, with your bright radiance🔽We choose that excellent boon of Savitar the God, the impeller, the Asur, the wise one,

original: chardir yena dāśuṣe yachati tmanā tan no mahāṃ ud ayān devo aktubhiḥ🔽divo dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅgaṃ drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ
analyzed: chardiḥ yena dāśuṣe yacchati tmanā tat naḥ mahān ud ayān devaḥ aktubhiḥ  divaḥ dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅgam drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ
translated: By which he bestows on the worshipper his own bounty. May that great God rise up for us with his rays.🔽The supporter of heaven, the lord of the world, the creator, the tawny-hued, the wise one, releases the garment.

original: vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayann āpṛṇann urv ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam
analyzed: vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayan āpṛṇan uru ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam
translated: The all-seeing one, extending and filling the vast space, Savitar has generated the desirable, praiseworthy bliss.

original: āprā rajāṃsi divyāni pārthivā ślokaṃ devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe🔽pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvann aktubhir jagat
analyzed: āprāḥ rajāṃsi divyāni pārthivā ślokam devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe  pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvan aktubhiḥ jagat
translated: The God has created the hymn for his own law, reaching the heavenly and earthly realms.🔽Savitar has stretched forth his arms in the contest, establishing and generating the world with his rays.

original: adābhyo bhuvanāni pracākaśad vratāni devaḥ savitābhi rakṣate
analyzed: adābhyaḥ bhuvanāni pracākaśat vratāni devaḥ savitā abhi rakṣate
translated: The unshakable God Savitar has spread out the worlds, and he protects the vows.

original: prāsrāg bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyo dhṛtavrato maho ajmasya rājati
analyzed: prāsrāk bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyaḥ dhṛtavrataḥ mahaḥ ajmasya rājati
translated: He has stretched forth his arms to the people of the world, the one of firm vow shines forth in the great abode of motion.

original: trir antarikṣaṃ savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṃsi paribhus trīṇi rocanā
analyzed: tris antarikṣam savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṃsi paribhuḥ trīṇi rocanā
translated: Savitar with his greatness thrice the atmosphere, thrice the regions, thrice the luminous realms.

original: tisro divaḥ pṛthivīs tisra invati tribhir vratair abhi no rakṣati tmanā
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ pṛthivīḥ tisraḥ invati tribhiḥ vrataiḥ abhi naḥ rakṣati tmanā
translated: He impels the three earths of the sky with three vows, he protects us with three forms.

original: bṛhatsumnaḥ prasavītā niveśano jagata sthātur ubhayasya yo vaśī🔽sa no devaḥ savitā śarma yachatv asme kṣayāya trivarūtham aṃhasaḥ
analyzed: bṛhat sumnaḥ prasavītā niveśanaḥ jagataḥ sthātuḥ ubhayasya yaḥ vaśī  sa naḥ devaḥ savitā śarma yacchatu asme kṣayāya tri varūtham aṃhasaḥ
translated: The one who is the lord of both the moving and the still, the bestower of great bliss, the one who sends forth, the one who dwells,🔽may that god Savita grant us shelter, a threefold protection from harm for our abode.

original: āgan deva ṛtubhir vardhatu kṣayaṃ dadhātu naḥ savitā suprajām iṣam
analyzed: āgan devaḥ ṛtubhiḥ vardhatu kṣayam dadhātu naḥ savitā su prajām iṣam
translated: The god has come with the seasons, may he prosper our abode. May Savita grant us food with good offspring.

original: sa naḥ kṣapābhir ahabhiś ca jinvatu prajāvantaṃ rayim asme sam invatu
analyzed: sa naḥ kṣapābhiḥ ahabhiḥ ca jinvatu prajāvantam rayim asme sam invatu
translated: May he stimulate us with the nights and days. May he impel to us wealth with offspring.

original: abhūd devaḥ savitā vandyo nu na idānīm ahna upavācyo nṛbhiḥ
analyzed: abhūt devaḥ savitā vandyaḥ nu naḥ idānīm ahnaḥ upavācyaḥ nṛbhiḥ
translated: The god Savita has become worthy of worship for us now, to be praised by men at this time of day.

original: vi yo ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭhaṃ no atra draviṇaṃ yathā dadhat
analyzed: vi yaḥ ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭham naḥ atra draviṇam yathā dadhat
translated: He who distributes treasures to the people, may he bestow on us the best wealth here.

original: devebhyo hi prathamaṃ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvaṃ suvasi bhāgam uttamam
analyzed: devebhyaḥ hi prathamam yajñiyebhyaḥ mṛta tvam suvasi bhāgam uttamam
translated: For to the gods first, to the worthy ones, he grants immortality, the highest portion.

original: ād id dāmānaṃ savitar vy rṇuṣe 'nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ🔽acittī yac cakṛmā daivye jane dīnair dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā
analyzed: āt id dāmānam savitar vi rṇuṣe nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ  acittī yat cakṛma daivye jane dīnaiḥ dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā
translated: O Savitar, thou breakest the bonds of him who liveth after the manner of men,🔽If we have done aught displeasing to the divine people, through our meanness, our skill, our greatness, our manhood.

original: deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvaṃ no atra suvatād anāgasaḥ
analyzed: deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvam naḥ atra suvatāt anāgasaḥ
translated: In the gods, O Savitar, and among men, do thou make us here sinless.

original: na pramiye savitur daivyasya tad yathā viśvam bhuvanaṃ dhārayiṣyati🔽yat pṛthivyā varimann ā svaṅgurir varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat🔽indrajyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayāṃ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ
analyzed: na pramiye savituḥ daivyasya tat yathā viśvam bhuvanam dhārayiṣyati  yat pṛthivyāḥ variman ā su aṅguriḥ varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat  indra jyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayām ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ
translated: I do not envy the divine Savitar that he will rule over the whole world.

original: yathāyathā patayanto viyemira evaiva tasthuḥ savitaḥ savāya te🔽ye te trir ahan savitaḥ savāso divedive saubhagam āsuvanti🔽indro dyāvāpṛthivī sindhur adbhir ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat🔽ko vas trātā vasavaḥ ko varūtā dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ naḥ

original: sahīyaso varuṇa mitra martāt ko vo 'dhvare varivo dhāti devāḥ
analyzed: sahīyasaḥ varuṇa mitra martāt kaḥ vaḥ dhvare varivaḥ dhāti devāḥ
translated: O Varuṇa and Mitra, who among mortals, O ye Gods, bestows on you a place of rest in the sacrifice?

original: pra ye dhāmāni pūrvyāṇy arcān vi yad uchān viyotāro amūrāḥ
analyzed: pra ye dhāmāni pūrvyāṇi arcān vi yat uchān viyotāraḥ amūrāḥ
translated: They who have set in motion the ancient ordinances, who are the unerring directors, when they have spread them out,

original: vidhātāro vi te dadhur ajasrā ṛtadhītayo rurucanta dasmāḥ
analyzed: vidhātāraḥ vi te ajasrāḥ ṛta dhītayaḥ rurucanta dasmāḥ
translated: The wise, the ever-moving, have established them for you: the holy thoughts shine forth.

original: pra pastyām aditiṃ sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḷe sakhyāya devīm
analyzed: pra pastyām aditim sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḍe sakhyāya devīm
translated: I praise the kindly Goddess Aditi, the home, the river, with my songs, for friendship.

original: ubhe yathā no ahanī nipāta uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe
analyzed: ubhe yathā naḥ ahanī nipātaḥ uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe
translated: As both the days may they, the infallible Dawn and Night, vouchsafe us shelter.

original: vy aryamā varuṇaś ceti panthām iṣas patiḥ suvitaṃ gātum agniḥ
analyzed: vi aryamā varuṇaḥ ceti panthām iṣaḥ patiḥ suvitam gātum agniḥ
translated: Aryaman and Varuna have passed along the path: the Lord of food, Agni, hath gone to bliss.

original: indrāviṣṇū nṛvad u ṣu stavānā śarma no yantam amavad varūtham
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū nṛvat u su stavānā śarma naḥ yantam amavat varūtham
translated: Indra and Vishnu, when we sing as men should sing, may they vouchsafe us shelter that shall guard from woe.

original: ā parvatasya marutām avāṃsi devasya trātur avri bhagasya
analyzed: ā parvatasya marutām avāṃsi devasya trātuḥ avri bhagasya
translated: The Maruts' bosoms, the dear shelter of the God, the help of Bhaga, the support of Aditi,

original: pāt patir janyād aṃhaso no mitro mitriyād uta na uruṣyet
analyzed: pāt patiḥ janyāt aṃhasaḥ naḥ mitraḥ mitriyāt uta naḥ uruṣyet
translated: The Lord of men, may Mitra guard us from the treacherous foe, and from the spiteful one.

original: nū rodasī ahinā budhnyena stuvīta devī apyebhir iṣṭaiḥ
analyzed: nu rodasī ahinā budhnyena stuvīta devī apyebhiḥ iṣṭaiḥ
translated: Now let the two world-halves be glorified with the deep-voiced dragon: with these hymns let the two Goddesses be worshipped.

original: samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavo gharmasvaraso nadyo apa vran
analyzed: samudram na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ gharma svarasaḥ nadyaḥ apa vran
translated: The rivers have flowed to the ocean, to the place of meeting, eager for the heat of the sun.

original: devair no devy aditir ni pātu devas trātā trāyatām aprayuchan
analyzed: devaiḥ naḥ devī aditiḥ ni pātu devaḥ trātā trāyatām aprayuchan
translated: May the Goddess Aditi, the Goddess, protect us, may the God, the protector, protect us, never failing.

original: nahi mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim arhāmasi pramiyaṃ sānv agneḥ
analyzed: nahi mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim arhāmasi pramiyam sānū agneḥ
translated: For we are not worthy of the favour of Mitra, Varuna, or Agni.

original: agnir īśe vasavyasyāgnir mahaḥ saubhagasya
analyzed: agniḥ īśe vasavyasya agniḥ mahaḥ saubhagasya
translated: Agni is the lord of wealth, Agni of great good fortune.

original: tāny asmabhyaṃ rāsate
analyzed: tāni asmabhyam rāsate
translated: May he grant them to us.

original: uṣo maghony ā vaha sūnṛte vāryā puru🔽asmabhyaṃ vājinīvati
analyzed: uṣaḥ maghoni ā vaha sūnṛte vāryā puru  asmabhyam vājinīvati
translated: O Ushas, bring us riches, O bountiful one, many boons,🔽O you who are rich in treasures for us.

original: tat su naḥ savitā bhago varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: tat su naḥ savitā bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May Savitar, Bhaga, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: indro no rādhasā gamat🔽mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatāṃ śucayadbhir arkaiḥ
analyzed: indraḥ naḥ rādhasā gamat  mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatām śocayadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: May Indra come to us with bounty.🔽O great Dyaus and Prithivī, be here the most excellent with your pure lights,

original: yat sīṃ variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvad dhokṣā paprathānebhir evaiḥ🔽devī devebhir yajate yajatrair aminatī tasthatur ukṣamāṇe
analyzed: yat sīm variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvat dhokṣā paprathānebhiḥ evaiḥ  devī devebhiḥ yajate yajatraiḥ a minatī tasthatuḥ ukṣamāṇe
translated: When you, the most spacious, the great, the unconfined, roar, the milker, with these far-reaching ones.🔽The Goddess, with the Gods, the performers of sacrifice, transgressing, stands firm, the milker.

original: ṛtāvarī adruhā devaputre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhir arkaiḥ
analyzed: ṛtāvarī adruhā deva putre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: The truthful, the unerring, the daughters of the God, the leader of the sacrifice, with pure lights.

original: sa it svapā bhuvaneṣv āsa ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna
analyzed: saḥ id su apāḥ bhuvaneṣu āsa yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna
translated: He who created these two, heaven and earth, is indeed self-moving in the worlds.

original: urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke avaṃśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat
analyzed: urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke a vaṃśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat
translated: The vast, deep, well-formed spaces, the wise one has united in the beam with might.

original: nū rodasī bṛhadbhir no varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhir iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: nu rodasī bṛhadbhiḥ naḥ varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhiḥ iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ
translated: Now, O Heaven and Earth, with your great protecting powers, accordant, bestowing food, as if they were wives,

original: urūcī viśve yajate ni pātaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
analyzed: urūcī viśve yajate ni pātam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: May we, O ye who are far extended, be ever victorious with our thoughts, O ye who are worshipped by all.

original: pra vām mahi dyavī abhy upastutim bharāmahe
analyzed: pra vām mahi abhī upastutim bharāmahe
translated: We bring to you, O ye of great might, the praise that is due to you,

original: śucī upa praśastaye
analyzed: śucī upa praśastaye
translated: Pure, for the sake of praise.

original: punāne tanvā mithaḥ svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ
analyzed: punāne tanvā mithas svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ
translated: Purifying yourselves mutually by your own power, ye shine,

original: ūhyāthe sanād ṛtam
analyzed: ūhyāthe sanāt ṛtam
translated: Ye have brought forth the eternal truth.

original: mahī mitrasya sādhathas tarantī pipratī ṛtam
analyzed: mahī mitrasya sādhathaḥ tarantī pipratī ṛtam
translated: Ye fulfil the great law of Mitra, saving and fulfilling the truth,

original: pari yajñaṃ ni ṣedathuḥ
analyzed: pari yajñam ni sedathuḥ
translated: Ye sit around the sacrifice.

original: kṣetrasya patinā vayaṃ hiteneva jayāmasi🔽gām aśvam poṣayitnv ā sa no mṛḷātīdṛśe🔽kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmiṃ dhenur iva payo asmāsu dhukṣva
analyzed: kṣetrasya patinā vayam hitena iva jayāmasi  gām aśvam poṣayitnu ā sa naḥ mṛḷāti īdṛśe  kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmim dhenuḥ iva payaḥ asmāsu dhukṣva
translated: By the lord of the field, as if by a friend, we gain victory.🔽May he, the nourisher, increase our cattle and horses. May he be gracious to us in this matter.🔽O lord of the field, as a cow yields milk, so do thou milk for us the sweet wave.

original: madhuścutaṃ ghṛtam iva supūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayo mṛḷayantu
analyzed: madhuścutam ghṛtam iva su pūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayaḥ mṛḍayantu
translated: May the lords of truth favour us with the sweet-flowing ghee, well-purified, as with clarified butter.

original: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam
analyzed: madhumatīḥ oṣadhīḥ dyāvaḥ āpaḥ madhumat naḥ bhavatu antarikṣam
translated: May the sweet plants, the heavens, the waters, and the sweet atmosphere be sweet to us.

original: kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṃ carema
analyzed: kṣetrasya patiḥ madhumān naḥ astu a riṣyantaḥ anu enam carema
translated: May the lord of the field be sweet to us. May we, the harmless ones, follow after him.

original: śunaṃ vāhāḥ śunaṃ naraḥ śunaṃ kṛṣatu lāṅgalam
analyzed: śunam vāhāḥ śunam naraḥ śunam kṛṣatu lāṅgalam
translated: Good be to the oxen, good to the men, good be to the plough that is yoked.

original: śunaṃ varatrā badhyantāṃ śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya
analyzed: śunam varatrāḥ badhyantām śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya
translated: Let the ploughs be yoked, let the ploughs be yoked.

original: śunāsīrāv imāṃ vācaṃ juṣethāṃ yad divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ
analyzed: śunāsīrau imām vācam juṣethām yat divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ
translated: O Suna and Siera, accept this speech of ours, the milk that ye have created in the heaven.

original: tenemām upa siñcatam
analyzed: tena imām upa siñcatam
translated: Therewith do ye sprinkle this (earth).

original: arvācī subhage bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā
analyzed: arvācī subhage bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā
translated: O blessed one, come hither to us. O Sita, we worship thee.

original: yathā naḥ subhagāsasi yathā naḥ suphalāsasi
analyzed: yathā naḥ subhagā asasi yathā naḥ su phalā asasi
translated: That thou mayst be blessed for us, that thou mayst be fruitful for us.

original: indraḥ sītāṃ ni gṛhṇātu tām pūṣānu yachatu
analyzed: indraḥ sītām ni gṛhṇātu tām pūṣā anu yacchatu
translated: May Indra seize hold of Sita; may Pusan follow her.

original: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarāmuttarāṃ samām
analyzed: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām uttarām samām
translated: May she, rich in milk, yield milk for us in the later and later (years).

original: śunaṃ naḥ phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmiṃ śunaṃ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ
analyzed: śunam naḥ phālāḥ vi kṛṣantu bhūmim śunam kīnāśāḥ abhi yantu vāhaiḥ
translated: May the ploughs make our land fruitful; may the ploughmen go forth with their teams.

original: śunam parjanyo madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam
analyzed: śunam parjanyaḥ madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam
translated: May Parjanya with honey and milk; may Suna and Siera bestow on us what is good.

original: samudrād ūrmir madhumāṃ ud ārad upāṃśunā sam amṛtatvam ānaṭ
analyzed: samudrāt ūrmiḥ madhumān ud ārat upāṃśunā sam amṛta tvam ānaṭ
translated: From the ocean the honey-rich wave has risen up; with the water it has attained immortality.

original: ghṛtasya nāma guhyaṃ yad asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
analyzed: ghṛtasya nāma guhyam yat asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translated: The name of ghee which exists in secret, the tongue of the gods, the navel of immortality.

original: vayaṃ nāma pra bravāmā ghṛtasyāsmin yajñe dhārayāmā namobhiḥ
analyzed: vayam nāma pra bravāma ghṛtasya asmin yajñe dhārayāma namobhiḥ
translated: We proclaim the name of ghee in this sacrifice with offerings and adorations.

original: upa brahmā śṛṇavac chasyamānaṃ catuḥśṛṅgo 'vamīd gaura etat
analyzed: upa brahmā śṛṇavat śasyamānam catur śṛṅgaḥ vamīt gauraḥ etat
translated: Let the Brahman listen to what is being praised: the four-horned bull has brought forth this (cow).

original: catvāri śṛṅgā trayo asya pādā dve śīrṣe sapta hastāso asya
analyzed: catvāri śṛṅgā trayaḥ asya pādāḥ dve śīrṣe sapta hastāsaḥ asya
translated: It has four horns, three feet, two heads, and seven hands.

original: tridhā baddho vṛṣabho roravīti maho devo martyāṃ ā viveśa
analyzed: tridhā baddhaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti mahaḥ devaḥ martyān ā viveśa
translated: The bull is bound in three places, he bellows; the great god has entered among mortals.

original: tridhā hitam paṇibhir guhyamānaṃ gavi devāso ghṛtam anv avindan
analyzed: tridhā hitam paṇibhiḥ guhyamānam gavi devāsaḥ ghṛtam anu avindan
translated: The gods found the ghee in the cow, divided into three parts, concealed by the Pāṇis.

original: indra ekaṃ sūrya ekaṃ jajāna venād ekaṃ svadhayā niṣ ṭatakṣuḥ
analyzed: indraḥ ekam sūryaḥ ekam jajāna venāt ekam svadhayā niḥ tatakṣuḥ
translated: Indra generated one, the sun one; from Vena they fashioned one by their own nature.

original: etā arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāc chatavrajā ripuṇā nāvacakṣe
analyzed: etāḥ arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāt śata vrajāḥ ripuṇā na avacakṣe
translated: These flow from the ocean of the heart, the hundred-streamed ones, not to be looked at by an enemy.

original: ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhya āsām
analyzed: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayaḥ vetasaḥ madhye āsām
translated: I behold the streams of ghee, the golden reed is in their midst.

original: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ
analyzed: samyak sravanti saritaḥ na dhenāḥ antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ
translated: They flow together like rivers, like thoughts purified in the heart and mind.

original: ete arṣanty ūrmayo ghṛtasya mṛgā iva kṣipaṇor īṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: ete arṣanti ūrmayaḥ ghṛtasya mṛgāḥ iva kṣipaṇoḥ īṣamāṇāḥ
translated: These waves of ghee flow, seeking, like deer, the place of the thrower.

original: sindhor iva prādhvane śūghanāso vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ🔽ghṛtasya dhārā aruṣo na vājī kāṣṭhā bhindann ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ
analyzed: sindhoḥ iva prādhvane śūghanāsaḥ vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ  ghṛtasya dhārāḥ aruṣaḥ na vājī kāṣṭhāḥ bhindan ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ
translated: Like the Sindhu on its way, the mighty ones, delighted by the wind, fly.🔽The streams of ghee, like a red steed, bursting the dams, swelling with waves,

original: abhi pravanta samaneva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāso agnim
analyzed: abhi samanā iva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāsaḥ agnim
translated: Rush to Agni like young women to a gathering, the lovely ones, smiling, rejoicing.

original: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidho nasanta tā juṣāṇo haryati jātavedāḥ
analyzed: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidhaḥ nasanta tāḥ juṣāṇaḥ haryati jātavedāḥ
translated: The streams of ghee are the kindling-sticks, he, accepting them, delights in them, the all-knower.

original: kanyā iva vahatum etavā u añjy añjānā abhi cākaśīmi
analyzed: kanyāḥ iva vahatum etavai u añjī añjānāḥ abhi cākaśīmi
translated: Like maidens, they are anointed for the wedding, I look upon them, the brown ones, as they are anointed.

original: yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajño ghṛtasya dhārā abhi tat pavante
analyzed: yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajñaḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi tat pavante
translated: Where the Soma is pressed, where the sacrifice is, the streams of ghee flow over it.

original: abhy arṣata suṣṭutiṃ gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta
analyzed: abhi arṣata suṣṭutim gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta
translated: Flow to our praise, to the race for the cattle, bestow on us good things of various kinds.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavante🔽dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antaḥ samudre hṛdy antar āyuṣi
analyzed: imam yajñam nayata devatāḥ naḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ madhumat pavante  dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antar samudre hṛdi antar āyuṣi
translated: Lead this sacrifice of ours to the gods, the streams of ghee, rich in honey, are purified.🔽In thy abode all the world is established, in the heart, in the midst of the ocean, in the midst of life.

original: apām anīke samithe ya ābhṛtas tam aśyāma madhumantaṃ ta ūrmim
analyzed: apām anīke samithe yaḥ ābhṛtaḥ tam aśyāma madhumantam te ūrmim
translated: The one who is brought in the presence of the waters in the gathering, may we obtain that wave of yours, rich in honey.
